sense.def: You use a or an when you are referring to someone or something for the first time, or when you do not want to be specific.
A ali an uporabljamo, kadar nekoga ali nekaj prvič omenimo ali kadar ne želimo povedati natančno, za kaj ali za koga gre.

seg.quote: Tom could see a hallway.
She wanted to be an actress.

sense.def: You can use a or an instead of the number "one".
A ali an lahko uporabljamo namesto števila "ena".

seg.quote: ...in an hour's time.

sense.def: When you express rates, prices, and measurements, you can use a or an to say how many units apply to each of the items being measured.
Pri izražanju tarif, cen in merskih enot lahko uporabimo a ali an, da povemo, koliko enot od celote smo izmerili.

seg.quote: He charges 100 dollars an hour.

sense.def: You can use a or an in front of uncount nouns when they are preceded by adjectives or followed by words that describe the uncount noun more fully.
A ali an lahko uporabljamo pred neštevnimi samostalniki, kadar stojijo za pridevniki, ali pred besedami, ki natančneje opisujejo neštevni samostalnik.

seg.quote: ...a happiness that he couldn't quite hide.

sense.def: An abacus is a frame used for counting. It has rods with sliding beads on them.
An abacus je okvir, v katerega so vpete žice, nanje pa so nanizane kroglice; uporablja se kot pripomoček za računanje.
If you abandon a place, thing, or person, you leave them permanently or for a long time.
To abandon a place, thing, or person pomeni za vedno ali za dolgo časa zapustiti neki kraj, stvar ali človeka.

seg.quote: You're not supposed to abandon your car on the motorway.
...the abandonment of farms.

sense.def: To abandon an activity or idea means to stop doing it or thinking about it before it is finished.
To abandon an activity or idea pomeni, da se z neko dejavnostjo ali idejo nehamo ukvarjati, še preden pridemo do konca.

seg.quote: I abandoned the search.
She disagreed with the abandonment of the project.

sense.def: If you abandon yourself to an emotion, you feel it strongly and do not try to control it.
To abandon oneself to an emotion pomeni silovito čutiti in se ne poskušati krotiti.

seg.quote: She abandoned herself to grief.

sense.def: If you do something with abandon, you do it in a carefree way.
Kadar nekaj naredimo with abandon, tisto naredimo sproščeno, brez pomislekov.
When something abates, it becomes much less strong or widespread;
Kadar nekaj abates, postane veliko šibkejše ali manj razširjeno;

seg.quote: My terror abated a little.

sense.def: An abattoir is a place where animals are killed for meat.
An abattoir je kraj, kjer pobijajo živali za hrano.
An abbey is a church with buildings attached to it in which monks or nuns live.
An abbey je cerkev, poleg katere so stavbe, kjer živijo menihi ali nune.
An abbot is a monk in charge of the other monks in a monastery or abbey.
An abbot je menih, ki vodi druge menihe v samostanu ali opatiji.
If you abbreviate a piece of writing or speech, you make it shorter.
To abbreviate a piece of writing or speech pomeni, da pisni sestavek ali govor naredimo krajši.

seg.quote: Don't be afraid to abbreviate, to cut a paragraph here and there.

sense.def: A word or phrase that is abbreviated is made shorter by leaving out some of the letters or by using only the first letters of each word.
Beseda ali stavek, ki je abbreviated, postane krajši, ker iz njega izpustimo nekaj črk ali uporabimo samo prve črke vsake besede.
An abbreviation is a short form of a word or phrase, made by leaving out some of the letters or by using only the first letters of each word.
An abbreviation je krajša oblika besede ali stavka, ki nastane tako, da iz njega izpustimo nekaj črk ali uporabimo samo prve črke vsake besede.
If a king or queen abdicates, he or she resigns.
Kadar kralj ali kraljica abdicates, se odpovesta svojemu položaju.

seg.quote: ...the day Edward VIII abdicated
...the abdication crisis of 1936.

sense.def: If you abdicate responsibility for something, you refuse to accept the responsibility for it any longer.
Kadar človek abdicates responsibility for something, za določeno stvar noče več odgovarjati.

seg.quote: We would be abdicating our responsibility to the local community.
...an abdication of political responsibility.

sense.def: Your abdomen is the part of your body below your chest where your stomach and intestines are.
One's abdomen je del telesa pod prsnim košem; v njem sta želodec in črevesje.

seg.quote: ...a patient suffering from abdominal pains.

sense.def: If someone abducts another person, they take the person away illegally.
Kadar človek abducts someone, tisto osebo nezakonito zadrži.

seg.quote: He was afraid of being abducted by a rival gang.

sense.def: An aberration is an action or way of behaving that is not normal.
An aberration je nenormalno dejanje ali vedênje.
If you abet someone, you help or encourage them to do something wrong.
To abet someone pomeni nekomu pomagati ali ga spodbujati k nedovoljenemu dejanju.

seg.quote: ...aiding and abetting the enemy.

sense.def: If you abhor something, you hate it very much.
To abhor something pomeni nekaj močno sovražiti;
If something is abhorrent to you, you hate it and find it unacceptable.
Kadar je nekaj abhorrent to somebody, tisto sovraži in je zanj nesprejemljivo;

seg.quote: ...a ruthless and utterly abhorrent system.

sense.def: If you can't abide something, you dislike it very much.
Kadar človek can't abide something, tistega ne mara.

seg.quote: He likes you but he can't abide Dennis.

sense.def: If something abides, it continues to happen or exist for a long time.
Kadar nekaj abides, se dogaja ali obstaja dolgo časa.
If you abide by a law, agreement, or decision, you do what it says.
To abide by a law, agreement, or decision pomeni ravnati tako, kot je določeno v zakonu, pogodbi ali sklepu.

seg.quote: Both parties must agree to abide by the court's decision.

sense.def: Your ability to do something is the quality or skill that makes it possible for you to do it.
One's ability to do something je lastnost ali spretnost, ki človeku omogoči, da tisto uresniči.

seg.quote: ...the ability to see.
...his ability as a journalist.

sense.def: -ability is added in place of "-able" at the end of adjectives to form nouns referring to a quality or state. Nouns of this kind are often not defined but are treated with the related adjectives.

Pripono -ability dodajamo pridevnikom namesto -able, da iz njih naredimo samostalnike, ki se nanašajo na lastnost ali stanje. Takih samostalnikov v tem slovarju ponavadi ne razlagamo, temveč jih obravnavamo pri ustreznih pridevnikih.

seg.quote: ...the suitability of particular courses.
...their vulnerability to criticism.

sense.def: You use abject to say that a situation or quality is shameful or depressing.
Z besedo abject povemo, da sta položaj ali lastnost sramotna ali povzročata potrtost.

seg.quote: ...abject poverty.

sense.def: Someone who is abject shows no self-respect or courage.
Kdor je abject, ne kaže samozavesti ali poguma.
Something that is ablaze is burning fiercely.
Kar je ablaze, močno gori.
If a place is ablaze with lights or colours, it is very bright.
Kraj, ki je ablaze with lights or colurs, je zaradi luči ali barv zelo svetel.
If someone or something is able to do something, they have the skill, knowledge, means, or opportunity to do it.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj able to do something, ima potrebno spretnost, znanje, sredstva ali priložnost, da tisto stori.

seg.quote: The frog is able to jump three metres.
I wasn't able to do these quizzes.

sense.def: An able person is clever or good at doing something.
Človek, ki je able, je pri določenem opravilu dober ali domiseln.

seg.quote: He was an unusually able detective.

sense.def: -able is added to some verbs to form adjectives which describe someone or something as able to have something done to them. For example, something that is identifiable can be identified.

Pripono -able dodamo nekaterim glagolom, da iz njih oblikujemo pridevnike, ki opisujejo nekoga ali nekaj, za katerega je mogoče nekaj narediti. Na primer, kar je identifiable, je mogoče identificirati.

seg.quote: They are both immediately recognizable.

sense.def: Ably means skilfully and successfully.
Ably pomeni spretno in uspešno.

seg.quote: They were ably supported by the Party members.

sense.def: Someone or something that is abnormal is unusual or exceptional, especially in a worrying way.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj abnormal, je nenavaden ali izjemen, posebej če je to zaskrbljujoče.

seg.quote: Maybe my child is abnormal.
...an abnormal interest in food.
...people who are behaving abnormally.

sense.def: If you are aboard a ship or plane, you are on or in it.
Kadar je človek aboard a ship or plane, je na ladji ali v letalu.

seg.quote: The plane crashed, killing all 271 aboard.

sense.def: Your abode is the place where you live.
One's abode je kraj, kjer določen človek živi;
If you abolish a system or practice, you put an end to it.
To abolish a system or practice pomeni ustaviti neki sistem ali dejavnost.

seg.quote: They believed the death penalty should be abolished.
...the abolition of slavery.

sense.def: Something that is abominable is very unpleasant or very bad.
Kar je abominable, je zelo neprijetno ali slabo.
An aboriginal is a member of one of the tribes which were living in Australia when Europeans arrived.
An aboriginal je član enega od plemen, ki so v Avstraliji živela že pred prihodom Evropejcev.
If a woman's pregnancy is aborted or if she aborts, her pregnancy is ended deliberately and the baby dies.
Kadar je nosečnost aborted ali če ženska aborts, se njena nosečnost umetno prekine in plod umre.
If you abort a process, plan, or activity, you stop it before it is finished.
To abort a process, plan or activity pomeni prekiniti tisti postopek, načrt ali dejavnost, preden so končani.
If a woman has an abortion, the pregnancy is ended deliberately and the baby dies.
To have an abortion pomeni, da se pri ženski nosečnost umetno prekine in plod umre.
An abortive attempt or action is unsuccessful.
Poskus ali dejanje, ki sta abortive, sta neuspešna.
If a place abounds with things, there are very large numbers of them.
Kadar določen kraj abounds with something, je tistega tam veliko;
The thing that you talk, write, or think about is the subject of what you are saying, writing, or thinking.
Tisto, o čemer nekdo talks, writes, or thinks about, je predmet tega, kar govori, piše ali misli.

seg.quote: I'll have to think about that.
This is a book about India.

sense.def: If you do something about a problem, you take action to solve it.
To do something about a problem pomeni ravnati tako, da bi neki problem rešili.

seg.quote: They knew they had to do something about their mother's unhappiness.

sense.def: When you say that there is a particular quality about someone or something, you mean that they have this quality.
Kadar je določena lastnost about someone or something, tisti človek ali stvar tisto lastnost ima.

seg.quote: There's something peculiar about him.

sense.def: About in front of a number means approximately.
Kadar beseda about stoji pred številom, pomeni njegovo približno vrednost.

seg.quote: We went about forty miles.

sense.def: If someone or something moves about, they keep moving in different directions.
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj moves about, se premika v različnih smereh.

seg.quote: We saw them walking about.

sense.def: If someone or something is about, they are present or available.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj about, je navzoč ali dosegljiv.

seg.quote: There was no money about.

sense.def: If you are about to do something, you are going to do it soon.
To be about to do something pomeni tisto storiti kmalu.

seg.quote: Her father is about to retire.

sense.def: If one thing is above another one, it is directly over it or higher than it.
Kadar je neka stvar above another one, je neposredno nad drugo stvarjo ali više od nje.

seg.quote: ...the branches above their heads.
A noise was coming from the bedroom above.

sense.def: You use above in writing to refer to something that has already been mentioned.
Z besedo above pri pisanju označujemo nekaj, kar je bilo že prej omenjeno.

seg.quote: All the above items can be obtained from Selfridges.
The above is a fair description of teaching machines.

sense.def: If an amount or measurement is above a particular level, it is greater than that level.
Kadar je neka količina ali mera above a particular level, je večja od določene ravni.

seg.quote: ...children above the age of 5.

sense.def: If someone is above you, they are in a position of authority over you.
Kadar je nekdo above someone, ima višji položaj od tistega človeka.

seg.quote: He will have an executive above him to whom he reports.

sense.def: If someone thinks that they are above a particular activity, they do not approve of it and refuse to become involved in it.
Kadar človek misli, da je above a particular activity, določene dejavnosti ne mara in se noče ukvarjati z njo.

seg.quote: They consider themselves above such mercenary transactions.

sense.def: If someone is above criticism or suspicion, they cannot be criticized or suspected because of their good qualities or their position.
Kadar je nekdo above criticism or suspicion, ga zaradi njegovih dobrih lastnosti ali položaja ni mogoče kritizirati ali sumničiti.

seg.quote: ...those whose loyalty and morals were above reproach.

sense.def: An abrasion is an area of scraped or damaged skin;
An abrasion je področje, kjer je koža obdrgnjena ali ranjena;

seg.quote: ...abrasions to the side of the neck.

sense.def: An abrasive person is unkind and rude.
Kdor je abrasive, je neljubezniv in nesramen.

seg.quote: He could be abrasive and insensitive.

sense.def: An abrasive substance is rough and can be used to clean hard surfaces.
Snov, ki je abrasive, je groba in z njo lahko čistimo trde površine.
If people or things walk or move abreast, they are side by side.
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj walks or moves abreast, hodi ali se premika poleg drugega.

seg.quote: ...carts pulled by donkeys three abreast.

sense.def: If you keep abreast of a subject, you know all the most recent facts about it.
To keep abreast of a subject pomeni poznati najnovejše podatke o tistem predmetu.

seg.quote: The press kept abreast of each development.

sense.def: A book or play that has been abridged has been made shorter by removing some parts of it.
Knjiga ali igra, ki je bila abridged, je bila skrajšana, tako da so iz nje odstranili nekatere dele.

seg.quote: ...an abridged version of the novel.

sense.def: If you go abroad, you go to a foreign country.
To go abroad pomeni iti v tujo državo.

seg.quote: ...a holiday abroad.
I just got back from abroad.

sense.def: An abrupt action is very sudden and often unpleasant.
Dejanje, ki je abrupt, je zelo nenadno in pogosto neprijetno.

seg.quote: It came to an abrupt end.
I had to apply the brakes abruptly.

sense.def: Someone who is abrupt is rather rude and unfriendly.
Kdor je abrupt, je nevljuden in neljubezniv.

seg.quote: ...David's abrupt and bullying manner.
I wouldn't have spoken so abruptly if I'd realized you were ill.

sense.def: An abscess is a painful, pus-filled swelling.
An abscess je boleča, gnojna oteklina.
Someone's absence from a place is the fact of their not being there.
One's absence from a place pomeni, da tisti človek ni navzoč na tistem kraju.

seg.quote: ...frequent absences from school.

sense.def: The absence of something is the fact that it is not there.
The absence of something pomeni, da tistega ni.

seg.quote: The absence of electricity made matters worse.

sense.def: If someone or something is absent from a place or situation, they are not there.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj absent from a place or situation, v določenem kraju ali situaciji ni navzoč ali ga ni zraven.

seg.quote: You have been absent twenty minutes.

sense.def: If someone appears absent, they are not paying attention.
Kadar je človek videti absent, ni pozoren.

seg.quote: ...an absent stare.
"Did you?" Boylan said absently.

sense.def: An absentee is a person who should be in a particular place but who is not there.
An absentee je oseba, ki bi morala biti na nekem kraju, vendar je ni tam.

seg.quote: ...absentees from school.

sense.def: An absent-minded person is very forgetful.
Kdor je absent-minded, je pozabljiv.

seg.quote: She is so absent-minded and careless.
...if you absent-mindedly drop a ring down the sink.

sense.def: Absolute means total and complete.
Absolute pomeni popoln in v celoti.

seg.quote: ...the necessity for absolute secrecy.

sense.def: You use absolute to emphasize what you are saying.
Z besedo absolute poudarimo tisto, kar pripovedujemo.

seg.quote: The script is an absolute mess.

sense.def: An absolute ruler has complete power and authority over his or her country.
Vladar, ki je absolute, ima neomejeno oblast nad svojo deželo.
Absolute rules and principles are believed to be true or right for all situations.
Pravila in načela, ki so absolute, naj bi bila resnična ali pravilna v vseh primerih ali okoliščinah.

seg.quote: ...absolute doctrines.
...rigid absolutes, such as "divorce is always wrong".

sense.def: Absolutely means totally and completely.
Absolutely pomeni vsestransko in v celoti.

seg.quote: That's an absolutely fascinating piece of work.

sense.def: You say absolutely as an emphatic way of agreeing with someone.
Z besedo absolutely želimo poudariti, da se z nekom strinjamo.

seg.quote: "She's excellent, though."—"Absolutely."

sense.def: If someone is absolved from blame or responsibility, a formal statement is made that they are not guilty or are not to blame.
To be absolved from blame or responsibility pomeni, da človek uradno ni kriv in da ga ne smemo obtoževati.
To absorb a substance means to soak it up or take it in.
To absorb a substance pomeni, da se tista snov vsrka tako, da nekaj namočimo vanjo ali da se v nekaj vpije.

seg.quote: Frogs absorb water through their skins.

sense.def: If a group is absorbed into a larger group, it becomes part of the larger group.
Če je skupina oseb absorbed into a larger group, postane del večje skupine.

seg.quote: Small businesses are absorbed by larger ones.

sense.def: If a system or society absorbs changes or effects, it is able to cope with them.
Kadar sistem ali družba absorbs changes or effects, sta sposobna uporabiti spremembe ali vplive.
If you absorb information, you learn and understand it.
To absorb information pomeni naučiti se in razumeti podatke.
If something absorbs you, it interests you and gets all your attention.
Kadar nekaj absorbs someone, v človeku zbudi zanimanje in pritegne vso njegovo pozornost.

seg.quote: I was utterly absorbed in what I was doing.
The work is absorbing.

sense.def: Absorbent material soaks up liquid easily.
Snov, ki je absorbent, brez težav vsrka tekočino.

seg.quote: Dry it inside with an absorbent cloth.

sense.def: If you have an absorption in something, you are very interested in it.
To have an absorption in something pomeni, da se za tisto zelo zanimamo.
Absorption is the action of absorbing something.
Absorption je dogajanje, pri katerem nekaj postane del nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: ...the absorption of foreign minorities.

sense.def: If you abstain from doing something, you deliberately do not do it.
To abstain from doing something pomeni namenoma ne opraviti nekega dela.
If you abstain during a vote, you do not vote.
Kadar človek med volitvami abstains, ne voli.
An abstention is a formal act of not voting.
An abstention je uradno dejanje, ki pomeni, da ne volimo.

seg.quote: There were 4 abstentions.
We have the right of abstention.

sense.def: Abstinence is the practice of not having something you enjoy, such as alcoholic drinks.
Abstinence pomeni, da se odrečemo nečemu, v čemer uživamo, na primer alkoholnim pijačam.
An abstract idea or argument is based on general ideas rather than on particular things and events.
Zamisel ali argument, ki je abstract, sloni na splošnih zamislih, ne pa na konkretnih predmetih ali dogodkih.

seg.quote: ...our capacity for abstract reasoning.

sense.def: Abstract is a style of art using shapes and colours rather than representing people or things.
Umetnostni slog, ki je abstract, poudarja uporabo oblik in barv, ne pa oseb ali stvari.

seg.quote: ...abstract sculptures.

sense.def: An abstract noun describes a quality or idea rather than a physical object.
Samostalnik, ki je abstract, opisuje lastnost ali pojem, ne pa zunanjost predmeta.
An abstract of an article or speech is a short piece of writing that summarizes the main points of it.
An abstract of an article or speech je krajši sestavek, v katerem ponovimo glavne točke članka ali govora.
If you abstract information from an article or other piece of writing, you make a summary of the main points in it.
To abstract information pomeni narediti povzetek glavnih točk nekega članka ali drugega zapisa.
Someone whose behaviour is abstracted does not notice what is happening around them.
Kdor je abstracted, ne opazi, kaj se dogaja okoli njega.

seg.quote: ...a dreamy, abstracted stare.

sense.def: An abstraction is a general idea rather than one relating to a specific thing.
An abstraction je splošna ideja, ki se ne nanaša na določen predmet.

seg.quote: ...abstractions of philosophy and religion.

sense.def: Something that is absurd is ridiculous.
Kar je absurd, je neumno.

seg.quote: It seemed absurd to try to carry a twenty-five-pound camera about.
...the oddities and absurdities of the language.
...a feeling of absurdity.
...an absurdly low rent.

sense.def: An abundance of something is a large quantity of it.
An abundance of something pomeni veliko količino nečesa.

seg.quote: ...an abundance of evidence.

sense.def: If something is in abundance, there is a lot of it.
Kadar je nekaj in abundance, je količina tiste stvari velika.

seg.quote: There was grass in abundance.

sense.def: Something that is abundant is present in large quantities.
Kar je abundant, je navzoče v velikih količinah.

seg.quote: ...an abundant supply of food.

sense.def: If something is abundantly obvious, it is extremely obvious.
Kadar je nekaj abundantly obvious, je zelo očitno.

seg.quote: It has become abundantly clear that there is no time to lose.

sense.def: Abuse is rude and unkind things that people say when they are angry.
Abuse so nevljudne in neprijazne besede, ki jih človek izreče v jezi.

seg.quote: The girls shrieked abuse at the lawyers.

sense.def: If someone abuses you, they say rude or unkind things to you or treat you cruelly and violently.
Kadar človek abuses someone, tistemu človeku govori nevljudne ali neprijazne besede ali z njim ravna kruto ali nasilno.

seg.quote: He did not like to hear Elaine abused or criticized.
The patients were often physically abused.

sense.def: Abuse of someone is cruel and violent treatment of them.
Abuse of someone je kruto ali nasilno ravnanje z nekim človekom.

seg.quote: ...found guilty of gross neglect and abuse.

sense.def: If you abuse something, you use it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.
To abuse something pomeni nekaj uporabljati narobe ali s slabim namenom.
Abuse of something is the use of it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.
Abuse of something je nepravilna raba ali uporaba nečesa v slabe namene.

seg.quote: ...drug abuse.

sense.def: Someone who is abusive says rude or unkind things.
Kdor je abusive, govori nevljudno ali neprijazno.

seg.quote: ...abusive language.

sense.def: Abysmal means very bad or poor in quality.
Abysmal pomeni zelo slab ali nizke kakovosti.

seg.quote: ...abysmal wages.
...an abysmal failure.
He failed abysmally.

sense.def: An abyss is a very deep hole in the ground.
An abyss je zelo globoka jama v zemlji.

seg.quote: We looked down into the abyss.

sense.def: A very frightening or threatening situation can be referred to as an abyss.
Abyss so okoliščine, ki vzbujajo močan strah ali so zelo nevarne;

seg.quote: The world was teetering on the edge of the abyss of World War III.

sense.def: AC is used to refer to an electric current that continually changes direction as it flows. AC is an abbreviation for "alternating current".
Z izrazom AC opišemo električni tok, ki ves čas spreminja svojo smer. AC je okrajšava za alternating current.
Academic work is work done in schools, colleges, and universities.
Delo, ki je academic, opravljajo v šolah, na kolidžih in univerzah.

seg.quote: ...the academic system.
...people who are well qualified academically.

sense.def: Someone who is academic is good at studying.
Kdor je academic, je dober študent.
An academic is a member of a university or college who teaches or does research.
An academic je sodelavec univerze ali kolidža, ki tam poučuje ali raziskuje.
You also use academic to say that you think a particular point has no real effect on or relevance to what is happening.
Z besedo academic povemo tudi to, da določena stvar po našem mnenju nima resničnega vpliva na dogajanje in ni povezana z njim.

seg.quote: It was all academic, because there were never any profits to share out.

sense.def: A school or college specializing in a particular subject is sometimes called an academy.
An academy včasih imenujemo tudi šolo ali kolidž, namenjen določenemu področju.

seg.quote: ...the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art.

sense.def: If you accede to someone's request or opinion, you allow it or agree with it.
To accede to someone's request or opinion pomeni dovoliti ali se strinjati z neko zahtevo ali mnenjem;
When the rate or speed of something accelerates, it increases.
Kadar pogostost ali hitrost nečesa accelerates, se poveča.

seg.quote: Inflation rates began to accelerate.
...the acceleration of economic growth.

sense.def: The accelerator in a vehicle is the pedal which is pressed to make the vehicle go faster.
V vozilu je the accelerator pedal, na katerega pritisnemo, da peljemo hitreje.
sense.ref: glej slikovno prilogo CAR AND BICYCLE.

sense.def: Someone who speaks with a particular accent pronounces the words of a language in a way that indicates their country, region, or social class.
Človek, ki govori z določenim accent, besede izgovarja tako, da izdaja svoje poreklo — državo, pokrajino ali družbeni razred.

seg.quote: She has a strong Irish accent.

sense.def: An accent is also a mark written above or below certain letters in some languages to show how they are pronounced.
An accent je tudi znak, zapisan pod ali nad črkami v nekaterih jezikih, s katerim označimo, kako se izgovarjajo.
If the accent is on a particular feature of something, that feature is its most important part.
Kadar je na določeni značilnosti nečesa accent, je ta lastnost najpomembnejša.

seg.quote: The accent is on presentation in this contest.

sense.def: If you accent a word or a musical note, you emphasize it.
To accent a word or a musical note pomeni, da neki besedi ali noti damo večji poudarek.
To accentuate something means to emphasize it.
To accentuate something pomeni tistemu dati večji pomen.

seg.quote: These laws accentuate inequality and exploitation.

sense.def: If you accept something that you have been offered, agree to take it.
Če človek accepts something, privoli, da bo vzel, kar mu je nekdo ponudil.

seg.quote: He accepted our invitation.
I thanked him and accepted.
...the acceptance of foreign aid.

sense.def: If you accept someone's advice or suggestion, you agree to do what they say.
To accept someone's advice or suggestion pomeni strinjati se z nasvetom ali predlogom nekoga drugega.

seg.quote: I knew that they would accept my proposal.

sense.def: If you accept a story or statement, you believe it.
To accept a story or statement pomeni verjeti tisti zgodbi ali trditvi.

seg.quote: The panel accepted her version of the story.
The majority do not accept that there has been any discrimination.

sense.def: To accept a difficult or unpleasant situation means to recognize that it cannot be changed.
To accept a difficult or unpleasant situation pomeni sprejeti težaven ali neprijeten položaj in razumeti, da ga ni mogoče spremeniti.

seg.quote: ...unwillingness to accept bad working conditions.
...their acceptance of their plight.

sense.def: If you accept the blame or responsibility for something, you admit that you are responsible for it.
To accept the blame or responsibility for something pomeni priznati krivdo ali odgovornost za tisto.
When an institution or organization accepts someone, they give them a job or allow them to join.
Kadar neka ustanova ali organizacija accepts someone, tistega človeka sprejme v službo ali mu dovoli, da se ji pridruži.

seg.quote: I was accepted by the Open University.
...a letter of acceptance.

sense.def: If a group accepts you, they begin to think of you as part of the group.
Kadar neka skupina accepts someone, tistega človeka vzame za svojega člana.

seg.quote: The children gradually begin to accept her.
...her speedy acceptance into the San Diego community.

sense.def: If a situation or action is acceptable, people generally approve of it or allow it to happen.
Kadar je položaj ali dejanje acceptable, se ljudje na splošno strinjajo z njim ali dovolijo, da se uresniči.

seg.quote: In war killing is acceptable.
The proof of the doctrine is its acceptability to the man in the street.
...an acceptably low heat loss.

sense.def: If you think that something such as an action, a plan or a piece of work is acceptable, you consider it to be good enough.
Kadar mislimo, da je dejanje, načrt ali delovno okolje acceptable, se nam zdi dovolj dobro.

seg.quote: To my relief he found the article acceptable.
...a strategy acceptable to all classes and interests.

sense.def: Accepted ideas are generally agreed to be correct.
Zamisli, ki so accepted, so po splošnem prepričanju pravilne.

seg.quote: ...the accepted wisdom about old age.

sense.def: If you gain access to a building or other place, you succeed in getting into it;
To gain access to a building or other place pomeni, da se nam posreči priti v neko stavbo ali kakšen drug kraj;

seg.quote: They attempted to gain access through a side entrance.
The entrance door gives access to a living room.

sense.def: Access is also the opportunity or right to use or see something or someone.
Access je tudi priložnost ali pravica, da nekaj ali nekoga vidimo ali uporabimo.

seg.quote: I demanded access to a telephone.
Has Donald got access to the child?

sense.def: If you access information from a computer, you get it.
To access information from a computer pomeni dobiti podatke iz računalnika.
If a place is accessible, you are able to reach it.
Kadar je neki kraj accessible, je možno priti tja.

seg.quote: The hidden room was accessible only through a secret back entrance.

sense.def: If something is accessible to people, they are able to use it or understand it.
Kadar je nekaj accessible to people, ljudje tisto lahko uporabijo ali razumejo.

seg.quote: ...computers cheap enough to be accessible to virtually everyone.

sense.def: Accessories are extra parts added to a machine or tool to make it more efficient or useful.
Accessories so deli, dodani stroju ali orodju, da je bolj učinkovit ali uporaben.

seg.quote: ...an attractive range of accessories such as built-in tape decks and radios.

sense.def: Accessories are also articles such as belts or handbags which you wear or carry but which are not part of your main clothing.
Accessories so tudi predmeti, na primer pasovi ali torbice, ki jih nosimo, niso pa del osnovnega oblačila.
An accessory to a crime is a person who knows who committed the crime but does not tell the police.
An accessory to a crime je oseba, ki ve, kdo je zločin zagrešil, vendar tega ne pove policiji;

seg.quote: They are all accessories to murder.

sense.def: An accident is an event which happens completely by chance.
An accident je dogodek, ki se zgodi povsem po naključju.

seg.quote: The fact that there is a university here is due to a historic accident.

sense.def: An accident is also something unpleasant and unfortunate that happens and that often leads to injury or death.
An accident je tudi neprijeten ali nesrečen dogodek, ki navadno povzroči poškodbo ali smrt.

seg.quote: She was killed in a motor accident.

sense.def: If something happens by accident, it happens completely by chance.
Kadar se nekaj zgodi by accident, se zgodi po naključju.

seg.quote: I only came to Liverpool by accident.

sense.def: Something that is accidental happens by chance.
Kar je accidental, se zgodi po nesreči.

seg.quote: The evidence doesn't suggest accidental death.
We accidentally found an ideal solution.

sense.def: If someone or something is acclaimed, they are praised enthusiastically.
To be acclaimed pomeni, da tistega človeka ljudje navdušeno hvalijo;

seg.quote: He has been widely acclaimed for his paintings.
His book was published in 1919 and met with unusual acclaim.

sense.def: When you acclimatize to something or acclimatize yourself to it, you become used to it.
To acclimatize to something ali to acclimatize oneself to something pomeni, da se tistemu privadimo.

seg.quote: Once you've acclimatized to the heat you won't feel so tired.

sense.def: An accolade is praise or an award given publicly to someone who is greatly admired.
An accolade je hvala ali nagrada, ki jo javno izročijo zelo cenjenemu človeku;

seg.quote: This was the highest accolade he could receive.

sense.def: If you accommodate someone, you provide them with a place where they can stay, live, or work.
To accommodate someone pomeni tistemu človeku ponuditi prenočišče, stanovanje ali delovni prostor.

seg.quote: She can't accommodate guests at the moment.

sense.def: To accommodate someone also means to help them.
To accommodate someone pomeni nekomu pomagati.

seg.quote: The bank is accommodating its customers more than it used to.
The warder was always accommodating in allowing visitors in.

sense.def: If a building can accommodate a number of people or things, it has enough room for them.
Kadar stavba lahko accommodate a number of people or things, je v njej dovolj prostora za določeno število ljudi ali predmetov.
Accommodation is a room or building to stay in, work in, or live in.
Accommodation je soba ali stavba, v kateri lahko stanujemo, delamo ali živimo.

seg.quote: There is a shortage of accommodation.

sense.def: The accompaniment to a song or tune is the music that is played at the same time to form a background.
The accompaniment to a song or tune je glasba v pesmi ali napevu, ki jo igrajo kot podlago hkrati z osnovnim napevom.

seg.quote: ...a guitar accompaniment.

sense.def: An accompaniment to something is another thing that happens or exists at the same time.
An accompaniment to something je nekaj, kar se zgodi ali obstaja hkrati z drugo stvarjo.

seg.quote: This sauce is often served as an accompaniment to fish.

sense.def: An accompanist is a musician who plays one part of a piece of music while someone else sings or plays the main tune.
An accompanist je glasbenik, ki igra spremljevalni del določene skladbe, medtem ko nekdo drug poje ali igra osnovno melodijo.
If you accompany someone, you go somewhere with them.
To accompany someone pomeni nekam iti s tistim človekom.

seg.quote: She asked me to accompany her to the church.

sense.def: If one thing accompanies another, the two things happen or exist at the same time.
Če ena stvar accompanies another, se obe dogajata ali obstajata hkrati.

seg.quote: A high fever often accompanies a mild infection.

gramGrp.pos: VB with OBJ or REFL VB

sense.def: When you accompany a singer or a musician, you play one part of a piece of music while they sing or play the main tune.
To accompany a singer or a musician pomeni, da igramo spremljevalni del skladbe, medtem ko pevec ali glasbenik izvaja glavno melodijo.
An accomplice is a person who helps to commit a crime.
An accomplice je oseba, ki pomaga izpeljati zločin.
If you accomplish something, you succeed in doing it.
To accomplish something pomeni, da se nekomu posreči nekaj narediti.

seg.quote: I never seem to accomplish anything.

sense.def: If someone is accomplished, they are very good at something.
Kadar je človek accomplished, je v nečem zelo dober.

seg.quote: ...an accomplished cook.

sense.def: Your accomplishments are the things you do well.
One's accomplishments so tista opravila, ki jih nekdo dobro obvlada.

seg.quote: One of her few accomplishments was the ability to do cartwheels.

sense.def: The accomplishment of a task or plan is the fact of finishing it;
The accomplishment of a task or plan pomeni, da sta naloga ali načrt opravljena;

seg.quote: The accomplishment of this task filled him with satisfaction.

sense.def: An accomplishment is something remarkable that has been done or achieved.
An accomplishment je nekaj izjemnega, kar je bilo narejeno ali doseženo.
When you do something of your own accord, you do it freely and because you want to.
Če nekaj storiš of your own accord, tisto storiš po svoji volji, ker tako želiš.

seg.quote: She knew they would leave of their own accord.

sense.def: If people are in accord, they agree about something.
To be in accord pomeni, da se ljudje o nečem strinjajo.

seg.quote: There are few issues on which the two are in perfect accord.

gramGrp.pos: VB with OBJ and OBJ or PREP "to"

sense.def: To accord someone a particular kind of treatment means to treat them in that way.
To accord someone a particular kind of treatment pomeni, da s tistim človekom ravnamo na določen način.

seg.quote: Newsmen accorded her the kind of coverage normally reserved for film stars.
They are given more importance than we would accord to them if left to ourselves.

sense.def: If something is done in accordance with a rule or system, it is done in the way that the rule or system says it should be done.
Kadar nekaj storimo in accordance with a rule or system, to storimo tako, kot določa tisto pravilo ali sistem.

seg.quote: ...in accordance with Islamic law.

sense.def: You use accordingly to say that one thing happens as the result of another thing.
Z besedo accordingly povemo, da se nekaj zgodi kot posledica nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: He wanted to be treated like any other star entertainer, and paid accordingly.

sense.def: If something is true according to a particular person or book, that person or book claims that it is true.
Kadar je nekaj true according to a particular person or book, tista oseba ali knjiga trdi, da je resnično.

seg.quote: According to Dr. Santos, the cause of death was drowning.

sense.def: If something is done according to a particular principle or plan, this principle or plan is used as the basis for the way it is done.
Kadar nekaj storimo according to a particular principle or plan, je tisto načelo ali načrt podlaga za način, kako tisto naredimo.

seg.quote: Each person was given tasks according to their skills.
There are six classes organized according to age.

sense.def: An accordion is a box-shaped musical instrument which is played by pressing buttons and moving the two sides together and apart.
An accordion je kvadratasto glasbilo, na katerega igramo s pritiskanjem na gumbe in z raztegovanjem in stiskanjem meha.
If you accost someone, you stop them and speak to them.
To accost someone pomeni nekega človeka ustaviti in govoriti z njim.

seg.quote: In the hall he was accosted by two men.

sense.def: An account is a written or spoken report of something that has happened.
An account je pisno ali ustno sporočilo o nekem dogodku.

seg.quote: There were accounts of the incident in the paper.

sense.def: Accounts are detailed records of all the money that a person or business receives and spends.
Accounts so podrobna poročila o vsem denarju, ki ga neka oseba ali podjetje prejme ali potroši.

seg.quote: He had to submit accounts of his expenditure.

sense.def: If you have an account with a bank, you leave money with it and withdraw it when you need it.
To have an account with a bank pomeni, da imamo svoj denar v tisti banki in ga dvigamo, kadar ga potrebujemo.
If you have an account with a shop or company, you can get goods or services from there and pay at a later time.
To have an account with a shop or company pomeni, da v tisti trgovini ali podjetju lahko dobivamo blago ali usluge in zanje plačamo pozneje.
If you take something into account you consider it when you are thinking about a situation.
To take something into account pomeni o tistem razmisliti, kadar se pripravljamo na določene okoliščine.
If you do something on account of something or someone, you do it because of that thing or person.
To do something on account of something or someone pomeni, da nekaj naredimo zaradi nekoga ali nečesa.

seg.quote: "Auntie told me not to run," he explained, "on account of my asthma."

sense.def: If you say that something should on no account be done, you mean that it should not be done under any circumstances.
Izraz on no account uporabimo, kadar hočemo reči, da nečesa pod nobenim pogojem ne bi smeli storiti.

seg.quote: On no account must strangers be let in.

sense.def: If something is of no account, it does not matter at all.
Kadar je nekaj of no account, je povsem brez smisla.
If you account for something, you explain how it happened.
To account for something pomeni povedati, kako se je nekaj zgodilo.

seg.quote: How do you account for the dent in the car?

sense.def: If something accounts for a particular part or proportion of a whole thing, it is what that part or proportion consists of.
Kadar nekaj accounts for a particular part or proportion of a whole thing, gre za tisto, iz česar je sestavljen neki del ali odstotek celote.

seg.quote: Computer software accounts for some 70 per cent of our range of products.

sense.def: If you are accountable for something that you do, you are responsible for it.
Kadar je človek accountable for something, odgovarja za tisto, kar stori.

seg.quote: They cannot be held accountable for what they did.
...the need for greater accountability of the police.

sense.def: Accountancy is the work of keeping financial accounts.
Accountancy je spremljanje in vodenje računov.
An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial knjige.
An accountant je oseba, ki poklicno vodi računovodske knjige.
If someone is accredited in a particular position or job, their position or job is officially recognized.
To be accredited in a particular position or job pomeni, da je položaj ali delo nekega človeka uradno priznano.

seg.quote: ...an accredited shop steward.

sense.def: When you accumulate things, they collect or gather over a period of time.
Če človek accumulates things, zbira ali spravlja stvari v daljšem obdobju.

seg.quote: ...the things I had accumulated over the last four years.
...an accumulation of facts.

sense.def: Accuracy is the ability to perform a task without making a mistake.
Accuracy je sposobnost, da določeno nalogo opravimo brez napake.

seg.quote: ...the speed and accuracy with which she typed.

sense.def: Accuracy is also the quality of being true or correct.
Accuracy je tudi lastnost, da smo natančni ali zanesljivi.

seg.quote: ...the reputation of The Times for accuracy.

sense.def: An accurate account or description gives a true idea of what someone or something is like.
Razlaga ali opis, ki je accurate, natančno opisuje, kakšna je neka oseba ali predmet.

seg.quote: ...an accurate picture of social history.
The story is accurately told.

sense.def: A person, device, or machine that is accurate is able to perform a task without making a mistake.
Oseba, priprava ali stroj, ki je accurate, lahko opravi nalogo brez napake.

seg.quote: Missiles are becoming more accurate.
She is accurate in punctuation and spelling.
I have not drawn it accurately enough.

sense.def: An accusation is a statement that someone has done something wrong.
An accusation je izjava, da je nekdo storil nekaj slabega.

seg.quote: ...accusations of cheating.

sense.def: Accusation is the quality of showing by your behaviour that you think someone has done something wrong.
Accusation je način, kako z vedenjem pokažemo, kadar mislimo, da je nekdo storil nekaj slabega.

seg.quote: Her eyes were full of accusation.

sense.def: If you accuse someone of something, you say they have done something wrong.
To accuse someone of something pomeni izjaviti, da je tisti človek storil nekaj narobe.

seg.quote: He was accused of incompetence.

sense.def: If someone is accused of a crime, they have been charged with the crime and are on trial for it.
To be accused of a crime pomeni, da so nekomu pripisali zločin in mu zanj sodijo.

seg.quote: He is accused of killing ten young women.

sense.def: The accused refers to the person or people being tried in a court for a crime.
Izraz the accused označuje osebo ali ljudi, ki jim na sodišču sodijo zaradi zločina.

seg.quote: Will the accused please stand?

sense.def: If your expression or tone of voice is accusing, it indicates that you think someone has done something wrong.
Če je človekov izraz ali glas accusing, kaže, da je po njegovem mnenju nekdo storil nekaj slabega.

seg.quote: She gave him an accusing look.
"You liked him," he said accusingly.

gramGrp.pos: REFL VB or VB with OBJ

sense.def: If you accustom yourself to something different, you make yourself get used to it.
To accustom oneself to something different pomeni privaditi se nečemu, kar je drugačno.

seg.quote: He sat very still, trying to accustom himself to the darkness.
I think it is preferable to accustom babies to sleeping on the stomach.
I am not accustomed to being interrupted.

sense.def: An ace is a playing card with a single symbol on it.
An ace je igralna karta z enim samim znakom.
If you ache or if a part of your body aches, you feel a dull steady pain.
Če človek aches ali če del njegovega telesa aches, čuti nenehno topo bolečino.

seg.quote: I was tired, aching, and miserable.
His leg ached.

sense.def: If you ache for something or ache to do something, you want it very much.
To ache for something ali to ache to do something pomeni, da si tisto močno želimo imeti ali pa si želimo tisto storiti.

seg.quote: She was aching for a cigarette.
I was aching to tell you all my news.

sense.def: An ache is a dull steady pain in a part of your body.
An ache je vztrajna topa bolečina v določenem delu telesa.

seg.quote: ...my usual aches and pains.

sense.def: If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in obtaining it.
To achieve a particular aim or effect pomeni, da se nekomu posreči priti do določenega cilja ali učinka.

seg.quote: The riots achieved nothing.

sense.def: An achievement is something which someone has succeeded in doing, especially after a lot of effort.
An achievement je nekaj, kar se je nekomu posrečilo narediti, posebej če je moral v to vložiti veliko truda.

seg.quote: It was an astonishing achievement.

sense.def: Achievement is the process of achieving something.
Achievement je postopek, s katerim nekaj dosežemo.

seg.quote: This fact did not lessen her sense of achievement.

sense.def: An acid is a liquid or substance with a pH value of less than 7. Strong acids can damage your skin and clothes.
An acid je tekočina ali snov, katere pH vrednost je nižja od sedem. Močne kisline nam lahko poškodujejo kožo ali oblačila.

seg.quote: Dab it with a solution of weak acid.
...an acid soil.

sense.def: An acid fruit or drink has a sour or sharp taste.
Sadež ali pijača, ki je acid, ima kisel ali pekoč okus.
An acid remark is unkind or critical.
Pripomba, ki je acid, je neprijazna ali kritična.

seg.quote: ...her acid wit.

sense.def: Something that is acidic contains acid or has a pH value of less than 7.
Kar je acidic, vsebuje kislino ali ima pH vrednost manjšo od sedem.
Acidity is the quality of having a pH value lower than 7.
Acidity je lastnost in pomeni, da je pH vrednost manjša od sedem.

seg.quote: ...the acidity of the wine.

sense.def: Acidity is also the making of unkind or critical remarks.
Acidity je tudi izgovarjanje neprijaznih ali kritičnih pripomb.

seg.quote: I noticed a certain acidity in his comments.

sense.def: If a fact or a situation is acknowledged, it is accepted as true or correct.
To acknowledge a fact or a situation pomeni sprejeti dejstvo ali položaj za resničnega ali pravilnega.

seg.quote: He was acknowledged as America's finest writer.
Most people will now acknowledge that there is a crisis.

sense.def: If you acknowledge someone, you show that you have seen and recognized them.
To acknowledge someone pomeni pokazati, da smo tistega človeka videli in vemo, kdo je.
If you acknowledge a message, letter, or parcel, you tell the person who sent it that you have received it.
To acknowledge a message, letter, or parcel pomeni sporočiti človeku, ki nam je poslal sporočilo, pismo ali paket, da smo pošiljko prejeli.

seg.quote: You have to sign here and acknowledge receipt.

sense.def: Acknowledgement of something is admitting or accepting that it is true.
Acknowledgement of something pomeni, da smo priznali, da je tisto res.

seg.quote: ...his acknowledgement of his guilt.
There was some acknowledgement that his parents had to be involved.

sense.def: Acknowledgement is the expression of gratitude for something that someone has done or said.
Acknowledgement je izraz hvaležnosti za nekaj, kar nam je nekdo storil ali rekel.

seg.quote: ...her acknowledgement of their offerings.

sense.def: Acknowledgement of someone is showing that you have seen and recognized them.
Acknowledgement of someone pomeni, da smo tistega človeka videli in prepoznali.

seg.quote: One of the men raised an arm in acknowledgement.

sense.def: Acknowledgement of a message, letter, or parcel is telling the sender that it has arrived.
Acknowledgement of a message, letter, or parcel pove pošiljatelju, da je naslovnik prejel njegovo sporočilo, pismo ali paket.

seg.quote: ...in acknowledgement of telephone orders.

sense.def: The acknowledgements in a book are the parts in which the author thanks the people who have helped.
V knjigi so the acknowledgements avtorjeve zahvale ljudem, ki so mu pomagali.
Someone who has acne has a lot of spots on their face and neck.
Človek, ki ima acne, ima po obrazu in vratu veliko mozoljev.
An acorn is a pale oval nut that is the fruit of an oak tree.
An acorn je svetel, ovalen orešek, ki raste na hrastu.
Acoustic means relating to sound or hearing.
Acoustic pomeni tak, ki je povezan z zvokom ali sluhom.

seg.quote: Acoustic contact had been made.

sense.def: The acoustics of a room are the structural features which determine how well you can hear music or speeches in it.
The acoustics of a room so strukturne lastnosti neke sobe, ki določajo, kako dobro v njej slišimo glasbo ali govor.

seg.quote: The theatre was large, with good acoustics.

sense.def: If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it.
To acquaint someone with something pomeni nekemu človeku o nečem nekaj povedati;

seg.quote: I will acquaint you with the facts.

sense.def: An acquaintance is someone who you have met but do not know well.
An acquaintance je oseba, ki smo jo že srečali, vendar je ne poznamo dobro.

seg.quote: My cousin is an acquaintance of Lord Northcliffe.

sense.def: Your acquaintance with a subject is your knowledge or experience of it.
One's acquaintance with a subject je človekovo poznavanje neke snovi ali izkušenost z njo.

seg.quote: ...her acquaintance with modern art.

sense.def: When you make someone's acquaintance, you meet them for the first time.
Če človek makes someone's acquaintance, se prvič sreča z neko osebo.
If you have a nodding or passing acquaintance withsomeone, you know them slightly but not very well.
To have a nodding or passing acquaintance with someone pomeni, da osebo sicer poznamo, vendar ne preveč dobro.
If you are acquainted with someone, you know them slightly but they are not a close friend.
Kadar je človek acquainted with someone, tisto osebo sicer pozna, vendar z njo ni prijatelj.

seg.quote: Mrs Oliver is acquainted with my mother.
The families were acquainted.

sense.def: If you acquiesce to something, you agree to do it.
To acquiesce to something pomeni strinjati se, da bomo nekaj storili;

seg.quote: He acquiesced to the demand.

sense.def: Acquiescence is agreement to do what someone wants or acceptance of what they do.
Acquiescence pomeni, da sprejmemo opravilo, ki ga nekdo želi od nas, ali da sprejmemo tisto, kar ta oseba počne.
If you acquire something, you obtain it.
To acquire something pomeni nekaj doseči ali dobiti.

seg.quote: I tried to acquire the information I needed.

sense.def: If you acquire a skill or habit, you learn it or develop it.
To acquire a skill or habit pomeni naučiti se neke spretnosti ali navade.

seg.quote: It is a habit well worth acquiring.
...hereditary and acquired characteristics.

sense.def: An acquisition is something that you have obtained.
An acquisition je nekaj, kar pridobimo.

seg.quote: He invited me to inspect his latest acquisition.

sense.def: The acquisition of something is the process of getting it or being given it.
The acquisition of something pomeni postopek, s katerim nekaj dobimo ali nam nekaj dajo.

seg.quote: ...the acquisition of land.

sense.def: The acquisition of a skill or habit is the process of learning it or developing it.
The acquisition of a skill or habit je postopek, s katerim se naučimo ali razvijemo neko spretnost ali navado.

seg.quote: ...the acquisition of knowledge.

sense.def: If someone is acquitted of a crime, it is formally declared in court that they did not commit it.
To be acquitted of a crime pomeni, da sodišče o nekom uradno izjavi, da ni storil zločina.

seg.quote: The jury acquitted her of theft.
Campbell was acquitted on all charges.

sense.def: If you acquit yourself in a particular way, other people feel that you behave in that way.
To acquit oneself in a particular way pomeni, da ljudje čutijo, da smo se vedli na določen način;

seg.quote: She acquitted herself well.

sense.def: Acquittal is a formal declaration that someone who has been accused of a crime is innocent.
Acquittal je uradna izjava, da je nekdo, ki so ga obtožili zločina, nedolžen.
An acre is a unit of area equal to 4840 square yards or approximately 4047 square metres.
An acre je ploščinska mera, enakovredna 40,47 arom ali približno 4047 kvadratnim metrom.
An acrid smell or taste is strong, sharp, and unpleasant.
Vonj ali okus, ki je acrid, je močan, pekoč in neprijeten.

seg.quote: ...acrid smoke.

sense.def: Acrimonious words or quarrels are bitter and angry.
Besede ali prepiri, ki so acrimonious, so ostri ali jezni;

seg.quote: An acrimonious dispute broke out.

sense.def: Acrimony is bitterness and anger about something.
Acrimony je zagrenjenost ali jeza zaradi nečesa;

seg.quote: ...acrimony over the involvement of the police.

sense.def: An acrobat is an entertainer who performs difficult jumps, somersaults, and balancing acts.
An acrobat je cirkuški umetnik, ki izvaja skoke, premete ali ravnotežne točke.
An acrobatic movement or display involves difficult jumps, somersaults, and balancing acts.
Gib ali nastop, ki je acrobatic, vsebuje zahtevne skoke, premete in ravnotežne točke.
Acrobatics are acrobatic movements.
Acrobatics so akrobatski gibi.
An acronym is a word made of the initial letters of the words in a phrase, especially when this is the name of something. An example of an acronym is NATO.
An acronym je beseda, sestavljena iz začetnic besed v zvezi, ki največkrat nadomešča neko poimenovanje. Primer akronima je NATO.
If you go or look across somewhere, you go or look from one side of it to the other.
To go or look across somewhere pomeni iti ali pogledati od ene strani do druge.

seg.quote: We ran across the bridge.
He turned his head and looked across at me.

sense.def: Something that is situated or stretched across something else is situated or stretches from one side to the other.
Kadar nekaj leži ali stoji across something, stoji ali sega od ene do druge strani nečesa.

seg.quote: ...a banner stretched across the street.
A straight line was ruled across the map.

sense.def: Something that is situated across a street or river is on the other side of it.
Kar je across a street or river, leži na drugi strani ceste ali reke.

seg.quote: He stared at the houses across the street.

sense.def: Across is used to indicate the width of something.
Z besedo across opisujemo širino nečesa.

seg.quote: The bomb blasted a hole 200 kilometres across.

sense.def: Acrylic material is man-made, manufactured by a chemical process.
Tkanina, ki je acrylic, je izdelana umetno v kemičnem procesu.
When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.
To act pomeni nekaj storiti z določenim namenom.

seg.quote: We have to act quickly.
He acted alone in the shooting.

sense.def: If someone acts in a particular way, they behave in that way.
Kadar človek acts in a particular way, se vede na določen način.

seg.quote: We acted as if we had never seen each other before.

sense.def: If one thing acts as another, it functions as that other thing.
Če neka stvar acts as another, deluje tako kot neka druga stvar.

seg.quote: The shark can twist its fins to act as brakes.

sense.def: If you act in a play or film, you have a part in it.
To act in a play or film pomeni imeti vlogo v igri ali filmu.
An act is a single action or thing that someone does.
An act je enkratno ravnanje ali tisto, kar nekdo stori.

seg.quote: Sometimes the act of writing down the problems straightens out your thinking.

sense.def: If you are in the act of doing something, you are doing it.
Kadar je človek in the act of doing something, opravlja neko dejanje.

seg.quote: He saw Jones in the act of snatching a gun.

sense.def: If you say that someone's behaviour is an act, you mean that it does not express their real feelings.
Kadar je človekovo vedenje an act, ne izraža njegovih resničnih čustev.

seg.quote: She appeared calm and confident but it was just an act.

sense.def: An Act is a law passed by the government.
An act je listina, ki jo sprejme vlada.

seg.quote: ...the 1944 Education Act.

sense.def: An act in a play, opera, or ballet is one of the main parts into which it is divided.
An act v igri, operi ali baletu je eden od delov, na katere je delo razdeljeno.
An act in a show is one of the short performances in the show.
An act v predstavi je eden od krajših nastopov v njej.

seg.quote: ...comedy acts.

sense.def: If someone or something is acting up, they are not working or behaving properly.
To be acting up pomeni, da nekdo ali nekaj ne deluje ali se ne vede tako, kot bi bilo treba.

seg.quote: Her car has started acting up again.

sense.def: Acting is the activity or profession of performing in plays or films.
Acting je dejavnost ali poklic nekoga, ki nastopa v igrah ali filmih.

seg.quote: ...the brilliant acting of Hawtrey.

sense.def: You use acting before the title of a job to indicate that someone is only doing that job temporarily.
Besedo acting uporabimo pred nazivom delovnega mesta in tako povemo, da človek opravlja tisto delo samo nekaj časa.

seg.quote: ...Yassin, acting Director of Education.

sense.def: Action is doing something for a particular purpose.
Action je določeno ravnanje s posebnim namenom.

seg.quote: The government was already taking action.

sense.def: An action is something that you do on a particular occasion.
An action je nekaj, kar počnemo ob določeni priložnosti.

seg.quote: Surely resigning was rather a rash action?

sense.def: The action refers to all the important and exciting things that are happening in a situation.
The action se nanaša na vse pomembne in razburljive dogodke v določenih okoliščinah.

seg.quote: They want to be where the action is.
The whole action of the book takes place in one day.

sense.def: Action is also fighting in a war.
Action je tudi bojevanje v vojni.

seg.quote: ...reports of military action.
Henry had been killed in action.

sense.def: If you put an idea or policy into action, you begin to use it.
To put an idea or policy into action pomeni začeti uporabljati neko zamisel ali politiko.
If a machine is out of action, it does not work.
Če je stroj out of action, ne dela.
If a device or process is activated, something causes it to start working.
Če je naprava ali proces activated, nekaj povzroči, da začne delovati.

seg.quote: The gates will open automatically when the detection equipment is activated.

sense.def: An active person is energetic and always busy or moving about.
Kdor je active, je poln moči, vedno dejaven in v gibanju.

seg.quote: ...active and noisy children.

sense.def: If someone is active in an organization or cause, they are involved in it and work hard for it.
Kdor je active in an organization or cause, dela in se močno trudi za neko organizacijo ali stvar.

seg.quote: He was active in drawing public attention to our problems.
He had not actively participated in politics.

sense.def: You use active to say that something is done with energy or enthusiasm.
Z besedo active povemo, da je nekaj storjeno z velikim trudom in navdušenjem.

seg.quote: The proposal is under active discussion.
Such qualities were actively discouraged.

sense.def: An active volcano has erupted recently.
Vulkan, ki je active, je izbruhnil nedavno.
An activist is a person who works to bring about political or social changes.
An activist je oseba, ki se zavzema za politične ali družbene spremembe.
Activity is a situation in which a lot of things are happening.
Activity so okoliščine, v katerih se veliko dogaja.

seg.quote: There was a flurry of activity in the hall.

sense.def: An activity is something that you spend time doing.
An activity je nekaj, s čimer se ukvarjamo.

seg.quote: I find tennis a very enjoyable activity.

sense.def: The activities of a group are the things they do to achieve their aims.
The activities of a group so stvari, ki jih skupina počne, da bi dosegla svoj cilj.

seg.quote: ...the activities of trade unions.

sense.def: An actor is someone whose job is acting in plays or films.
An actor je moški, ki nastopa v igrah ali filmih.
An actress is a woman whose job is acting in plays or films.
An actress je ženska, ki nastopa v igrah ali filmih.
Actual is used to emphasize that a place, object, or person is real and not imaginary.
Z besedo actual poudarimo, da je neki kraj, predmet ali človek resničen in ne namišljen.

seg.quote: The predicted results and the actual results are very different.

sense.def: You can also use actual to indicate that you are referring only to the specific thing mentioned and not to other things associated with it.
Z besedo actual lahko tudi povemo, da govorimo samo o tistem, kar je bilo omenjeno, in ne o drugih stvareh, ki so s tistim povezane.

seg.quote: The actual wedding procession starts at 10 a.m.

sense.def: You use actually to indicate that a situation exists in real life or that it is true or correct.
Z besedo actually povemo, da določene okoliščine v resnici obstajajo ali da so resnične ali prave.

seg.quote: No one actually saw this shark.
He actually died in exile, didn't he?

sense.def: You also use actually as a way of being more polite, especially when you are correcting or contradicting someone, advising them, or when you are introducing a new topic of conversation.
Besedo actually uporabljamo tudi , kadar hočemo biti vljudni, zlasti kadar nekoga popravljamo ali mu nasprotujemo, mu svetujemo ali začenjamo pogovor o novi témi.

seg.quote: Actually, it was more complicated than that.
Actually it might be a good idea to stop recording now.
Actually, Dan, before I forget, she asked me to give you this.

sense.def: Acumen is the ability to make good judgements and quick decisions.
Acumen je sposobnost dobre presoje in hitrih odločitev.

seg.quote: ...a man with big ideas and keen business acumen.

sense.def: If something such as a situation, feeling, or illness is acute, it is very severe or intense.
Kadar je čustvo, bolezen ali položaj acute, je zelo močen ali silovit.

seg.quote: ...acute staff shortages.
These problems have become more acute.

sense.def: If your sight, hearing, or sense of smell is acute, it is sensitive and powerful.
Če je človekov vid, sluh ali voh acute, je zelo občutljiv in močan.
In geometry, an acute angle is less than 90°.
Kót v geometriji, ki je acute, meri manj kot 90°.
If you feel something acutely, you feel it very strongly.
To feel something acutely pomeni tisto zelo močno občutiti.

seg.quote: They were acutely aware of the difficulties.

sense.def: If a feeling or quality is acutely unpleasant, it is very unpleasant.
Če sta občutek ali lastnost acutely neprijetna, sta zelo neprijetna.

seg.quote: It was acutely embarrassing.

sense.def: An ad is an advertisement;
An ad je reklama;
You use AD in dates to indicate a number of years or centuries since the year in which Jesus Christ is believed to have been born.
Kratico AD uporabljamo v datumih, da označimo število let ali stoletij pred Kristusovim rojstvom.
If you are adamant about something, you are determined not to change your mind.
Kadar je človek adamant about something, je sklenil, da si o nečem ne bo premislil.

seg.quote: He is adamant that we must put less emphasis on nationalism.
He adamantly refused to be moved to a hospital.

sense.def: Your Adam's apple is the lump that sticks out of the front of your neck.
Pri moškem je Adam's apple izboklina na prednji strani vratu.
If you adapt to a new situation or adapt yourself to it, you change in order to deal with it.
To adapt to a new situation ali to adapt oneself to a new situation pomeni spremeniti se zaradi novih okoliščin.

seg.quote: He cannot adapt himself to being free.

sense.def: If you adapt something, you change it to make it suitable for a new purpose or situation.
To adapt something pomeni tisto spremeniti, da bi bilo primerno novi namembnosti ali okoliščinam.

seg.quote: Reformers attempted to adapt traditional religion.

sense.def: If you adapt a book or play, you change it so that it can be made into a film or a television programme.
To adapt a book or play pomeni spremeniti knjigo ali igro tako, da po njej lahko posnamejo film ali televizijsko oddajo.

seg.quote: Mortimer is adapting the novel for television.

sense.def: Someone who is adaptable is able to change their ideas or behaviour in order to deal with new situations.
Kdor je adaptable, je sposoben spremeniti svoje zamisli ali vedênje zato, da se sooči z novimi okoliščinami.

seg.quote: The rural areas are losing their brightest, most educated and adaptable members to the cities.
...adaptability to his environment.

sense.def: An adaptation of a story or novel is a play or film based on it.
An adaptation of a story or novel je igra ali film, ki je posnet po noveli ali romanu.

seg.quote: ...a new television adaptation of "A Tale of Two Cities".

sense.def: If something is adapted for a particular purpose, it is made so that it is especially suitable for it.
Kadar je nekaj adapted for a particular purpose, je izdelano tako, da je primerno za določen namen.

seg.quote: The cleaner is well adapted for use in the home and car.
...a Regency period residence, skilfully adapted to the needs of a modern hotel.

sense.def: If you add one thing to another, you put it with the other thing.
To add one thing to another pomeni dati eno stvar k drugi.

seg.quote: She added a tree to the picture.

sense.def: If you add numbers or amounts, you calculate their total.
To add numbers or amounts pomeni izračunati vsoto števil ali količin.

gramGrp.pos: VB with or without OBJ, with PREP "to"

sense.def: If one thing adds to another, it makes the other thing greater in degree or amount.
Kadar nekaj adds to something else, povzroči, da je druga stvar po stopnji ali količini večja.

seg.quote: He is given answers that only add to his confusion.
This process adds an extra £3 to the cost.
There are added complications.

sense.def: If you add something when you are speaking, you say something more.
Če človek med govorjenjem adds something, pove še nekaj.

seg.quote: He added that the fee would be £100.

sense.def: If you add up several numbers, you calculate their total.
To add up several numbers pomeni izračunati vsoto več števil.
If facts or events add up, they make you understand the true nature of the situation.
Če dejstva ali dogodki add up, zaradi njih dojamemo pravi značaj okoliščin.

seg.quote: It all added up. I became aware that Halliday was the thief.

sense.def: If amounts add up to a particular total, they result in that total when they are put together.
Če zneski add up to a particular total, pomeni, da jih seštejemo in dobimo rezultat.

seg.quote: This adds up to 75,000 miles of new streets.

sense.def: An addict is someone who cannot stop taking harmful drugs.
An addict je človek, ki se ne more odpovedati uporabi mamil.

seg.quote: ...a Swiss drug addict.

sense.def: An addict is also someone who is very keen about something.
An addict je tudi nekdo, ki je zelo vnet za določeno stvar.

seg.quote: ...a radio addict.

sense.def: Someone who is addicted to a harmful drug cannot stop taking it.
Kdor je addicted to a harmful drug, se ne more odpovedati uporabi škodljivega mamila.

seg.quote: He became addicted to drink.

sense.def: If you are addicted to something, you like it a lot.
Kadar je človek addicted to something, ima tisto zelo rad.

seg.quote: He was probably addicted to peppermints.

sense.def: Addiction is the condition of taking harmful drugs and being unable to stop.
Addiction je daljše uživanje mamil, ne da bi to lahko prekinili.

seg.quote: ...heroin addiction.

sense.def: An addiction to something is a very strong desire for it.
An addiction to something je močna želja po nečem.

seg.quote: ...an addiction to sweets.

sense.def: If a drug is addictive, people who start taking it find that they cannot stop.
Če je neka snov addictive, ljudje, ki jo začnejo uživati, ugotovijo, da je ne morejo več nehati uživati.
You use in addition to add to what you have already said.
Z izrazom in addition to povemo še nekaj poleg tistega, kar smo že rekli.

seg.quote: In addition, there were meetings with trade unionists.

sense.def: An addition to something is a thing or amount which is added to it.
An addition to something je predmet ali količina, ki jo damo zraven drugega predmeta ali količine.

seg.quote: They can also award a weekly addition for extra heating.

sense.def: The addition of something is also the fact or process of adding it as an extra.
The addition of something je tudi dejstvo ali postopek, ko se nekaj povečuje.

seg.quote: These houses have been improved by the addition of bathrooms.

sense.def: Addition is the process of calculating the total of two or more numbers.
Addition je proces izračunavanja vsote dveh ali več števil.
Additional things are extra things that are added to the ones that are already present.
Stvari, ki so additional, so dodane že obstoječim.

seg.quote: ...additional troops.

sense.def: You use additionally to introduce an extra fact.
Z besedo additionally napovemo dodatno dejstvo.

seg.quote: Additionally, there was a substantial bill.

sense.def: If something happens additionally, it happens to a greater extent than before.
Kadar se nekaj zgodi additionally, se zgodi v večji meri kot prejšnjikrat.

seg.quote: There was no point in additionally burdening her with this news.

sense.def: An additive is a substance which is added to food by the manufacturer for a particular purpose, such as colouring it.
An additive je snov, ki jo izdelovalec doda hrani, na primer za obarvanje.
Your address is the number of the house, the name of the street, and the town where you live.
One's address so podatki o hišni številki, imenu ulice in kraja, v katerem človek živi.

seg.quote: The address is 70 Brompton Road, London SW1.

sense.def: If a letter is addressed to you, your name and address are written on it.
Kadar je pismo addressed to someone, sta na njem napisana ime in naslov tistega človeka.
An address is also a formal speech.
An address je tudi uradni nagovor.

seg.quote: He gave an address to the Psychological Association.

sense.def: If you address a group of people, you give a speech to them.
To address a group of people pomeni govoriti skupini ljudi.

seg.quote: He addressed a meeting in Bristol.

sense.def: To address a problem means to deal with it.
Če človek addresses a problem, se z njim sooči ali spopade.

seg.quote: He has not addressed the issue of the strike.

sense.def: Someone who is adept at something does it well.
Kdor je adept at something, mu gre neka spretnost dobro od rok.

seg.quote: ...adept at filling in forms.

sense.def: Adequacy is the state of being great enough in amount.
Adequacy pomeni dovolj veliko količino.

seg.quote: ...the adequacy of resources.

sense.def: Adequacy is also the quality of being acceptable or usable.
Adequacy pomeni tudi, da je nekaj sprejemljivo ali uporabno.

seg.quote: ...proof of the adequacy of the principles.

sense.def: If an amount is adequate, there is just enough of it.
Količina nečesa je adequate, če je tistega ravno dovolj.

seg.quote: The pay was adequate.
...a country with adequate rainfall.
The children are not adequately fed.

sense.def: If something is adequate, it is good enough to be used or accepted.
Kadar je nekaj adequate, je dovolj dobro, da tisto lahko uporabimo ali sprejmemo.

seg.quote: She could not think of an adequate answer.
This has never been adequately explained.

sense.def: If a substance adheres to a surface or object, it sticks to it.
Kadar snov adheres to a surface or object, se oprime površine ali predmeta.

seg.quote: This helps the plaster to adhere to the wall.

sense.def: If you adhere to a rule or agreement, you act in the way that it says you should.
To adhere to a rule or agreement pomeni ravnati tako, kot določa pravilo ali dogovor.

seg.quote: The fire regulations have been adhered to.

sense.def: If you adhere to an opinion or belief, you support it.
To adhere to an opinion or belief pomeni podpirati neko mnenje ali prepričanje.

seg.quote: She has adhered to the view that it is my responsibility.

sense.def: Adherence is the fact of adhering to a particular rule or agreement.
Adherence je upoštevanje določenega pravila ali dogovora.

seg.quote: Do they question our adherence to the treaty?

sense.def: Adherence is also the fact of supporting a particular belief or opinion.
Adherence pomeni tudi podpiranje določenega prepričanja ali mnenja.

seg.quote: ...their adherence to democratic or totalitarian systems.

sense.def: An adhesive is a substance which is used to make things stick together.
An adhesive je snov, ki jo uporabljamo, da se predmeti sprimejo.

seg.quote: Make sure you stick them on with the correct adhesive.

sense.def: Something that is adhesive sticks firmly to something else.
Kar je adhesive, se trdno prime drugega predmeta.

seg.quote: ...adhesive plasters.

sense.def: An ad hoc arrangement takes place only because a situation has made it necessary and was not planned in advance.
Ureditev, ki je ad hoc, je nenačrtovana in se pojavi le, kadar tako zahtevajo okoliščine.

seg.quote: Rescue work continued on an ad hoc basis.
The men agreed to set up an ad hoc committee.

sense.def: If two things are adjacent, they are next to each other.
Kadar sta dva predmeta adjacent, sta drug poleg drugega.

seg.quote: The bench was adjacent to the court.
...the adjacent room.

sense.def: An adjective is a word such as "old", "red", or "ugly" which gives more information about a thing, such as its colour, size, or other qualities.
An adjective so besede, kot so "star", "rdeč" ali "grd", ki o nečem nekaj povedo, na primer o barvi, velikosti ali drugih lastnostih.
If one room, place, or object adjoins another, they are next to each other;
Če soba, kraj ali predmet adjoins something else, stoji poleg tistega;

seg.quote: Her bedroom adjoined Guy's room.
The adjoining room is Professor Marvin's office.

sense.def: If a meeting or trial adjourns, it is stopped for a short time.
Kadar sestanek ali sodna razprava adjourns, se za krajši čas prekine.

seg.quote: The trial would be adjourned until the next morning.
An adjournment was called.

sense.def: If you adjudicate on a dispute or problem, you make an official decision about it.
To adjudicate on a dispute or problem pomeni sprejeti uradno odločitev o nekem sporu ali problemu;

seg.quote: The boards adjudicate on the punishment of prisoners.
It should adjudicate individual grievances and complaints against all the broadcasting systems.

sense.def: An adjunct is something that is connected with a larger or more important thing.
An adjunct je nekaj, kar je povezano z nečim drugim, večjim ali pomembnejšim.

seg.quote: Duncan's survey was an adjunct to the current population survey.

sense.def: In grammar, an adjunct is one of the main elements of a clause which gives information about time, place, or manner.
V slovnici je an adjunct eden glavnih delov stavka in daje podatke o času, kraju ali načinu.
When you adjust to a new situation, you get used to it by changing your behaviour or your ideas.
Kadar človek adjusts to a new situation, se privadi novim okoliščinam, tako da spremeni svoje vedenje ali prepričanje.

seg.quote: Couples do not give themselves time to adjust to marriage before a baby arrives.
Foreign students have problems of adjustment to living in Britain.
Thousands of young marines have made the adjustment from combat.

sense.def: If you adjust something, you correct or alter its position or setting.
To adjust something pomeni popraviti ali spremeniti položaj ali nastavitev tistega.

seg.quote: He spent several minutes adjusting his tie.
I went to adjust the television set.
He spent weeks making repairs and adjustments.
Tappet adjustment has to be made with the engine cold.

sense.def: If something is adjustable, it can be changed to different positions.
Kadar je nekaj adjustable, je tistemu mogoče spremeniti položaj.

seg.quote: ...an adjustable spanner.

sense.def: A well adjusted person can control their behaviour and deal with the problems of life. A badly adjusted person cannot.
Kdor je well adjusted, zna obvladovati svoje vedênje in se spopadati z življenjskimi težavami. Kdor pa je badly adjusted, tega ne zmore.
If you ad-lib in a play or a speech, you say something which has not been prepared beforehand.
To ad-lib in a play or a speech pomeni reči v igri ali govoru nekaj, kar ni bilo predvideno.

seg.quote: They ad-libbed so much and broke down in chuckles so often.
I tried to ad-lib a joke I'd heard but my timing was completely wrong.
We discussed the result ad lib.

sense.def: To administer a country, company, or institution means to be responsible for managing it.
Kadar človek administers a country, company, or institution, je odgovoren za vodenje neke države, podjetja ali ustanove.

seg.quote: She had a huge department to administer.

sense.def: To administer something also means to ensure that it is done or carried out correctly.
Kadar človek administers something, poskrbi, da je tisto pravilno narejeno ali opravljeno.

seg.quote: Experts administer the tests and publish the results.
The prison officers helped to administer a sedative to him.

sense.def: The administration of a company, institution, or country is the group of people who organize and supervise it.
The administration of a company, institution, or country je skupina ljudi, ki organizira ali nadzoruje neko podjetje, ustanovo ali državo.

seg.quote: ...the University administration.
...the Reagan Administration.

sense.def: Administration is the range of activities connected with the organization or supervision of a company, institution, or country.
Administration je vrsta dejavnosti, povezanih z organizacijo ali nadzorom nekega podjetja, ustanove ali države.
