seg.quote: They need to spend less on administration.

sense.def: Administrative work involves organizing and supervising a country, company, or institution.
Delo, ki je administrative, je povezano z organizacijo in nadzorom neke države, podjetja ali ustanove.
An administrator is a person who manages and organizes a country, company, or institution.
An administrator je oseba, ki vodi in organizira neko državo, podjetje ali ustanovo.
An admirable quality or action deserves to be praised and admired.
Lastnost ali dejanje, ki je admirable, zaslužipohvalo in občudovanje.

seg.quote: The trains ran with admirable precision.
It fulfills its purpose admirably.

sense.def: An admiral is a naval officer of the highest rank.
An admiral je pomorski častnik z najvišjim činom.
Admiration is a feeling of great liking and respect.
Admiration je čustvo velike naklonjenosti in spoštovanja.

seg.quote: Benson had enormous admiration for them all.

sense.def: If you admire someone or something, you like and respect them.
To admire someone or something pomeni do nekoga ali nečesa čutiti naklonjenost in spoštovanje.

seg.quote: I admire courage.
They had been admired for their discipline.
She gave me one of her rare admiring looks.
Ralph glanced at them admiringly.

sense.def: You can also say you admire something when you look with pleasure at it.
Kadar človek admires something, na tisto stvar gleda z zadovoljstvom.

seg.quote: He went along the lane admiring the crocuses.

sense.def: A woman's admirers are the men who are attracted to her.
An admirer je moški, ki se mu zdi določena ženska privlačna.
If you are an admirer of someone, you like and respect them or their work.
Kadar je človek an admirer of someone, ima tistega človeka rad in ceni njega ali njegovo delo.

seg.quote: I am not myself an admirer of Hogarth.

sense.def: Admission is permission given to a person or group of people to enter a place or join an organization.
Admission je dovoljenje za vstop v prostor ali organizacijo, izdano osebi ali skupini oseb.

seg.quote: No admission allowed after 10 pm.
His Act tightened up the admission of immigrants into Britain.

sense.def: The admission fee is the amount of money you pay to enter a place.
The admission fee je znesek, ki ga plačamo za vstop.
An admission is a statement that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true.
An admission je izjava o resničnosti nečesa slabega, neprijetnega ali sramotnega.

seg.quote: He submitted his resignation, together with an admission of his guilt.

gramGrp.pos: REPORT VB or VB with -ING or PREP "to"

sense.def: If you admit something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing, you agree that it is true.
To admit something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing pomeni potrditi, da je nekaj slabega, neprijetnega ali sramotnega resnično.

seg.quote: "I don't know," he admitted.
The President admitted taking bribes.

sense.def: If someone is admitted to a place or organization, they are allowed to enter it or join it.
To be admitted to a place or organization pomeni, da nekomu dovolijo vstopiti ali se pridružiti organizaciji.

seg.quote: Junior members of staff are not admitted.

sense.def: If someone is admitted to hospital, they are kept there until they are well enough to go home.
To be admitted to hospital pomeni, da nekoga zadržijo v bolnišnici, dokler ni dovolj zdrav, da se lahko vrne domov.
Admittance is the act of entering a place or the right to enter it.
Admittance je vstop v neki prostor ali pravica, da vstopimo vanj.

seg.quote: How was he to gain admittance?

sense.def: You use admittedly when you say something which weakens your previous statement.
Z besedo admittedly povemo nekaj, kar ublaži našo prejšnjo izjavo.

seg.quote: Admittedly, economists often disagree among each other.

sense.def: If you admonish someone, you tell them sternly that they have done something wrong;
To admonish someone pomeni nekomu ostro povedati, da je storil nekaj narobe;

seg.quote: They are frequently admonished for their failure to act quickly.

sense.def: If you do something without further ado, you do it at once;
To do something without further ado pomeni tisto narediti takoj;
Adolescence is the period of your life in which you develop from being a child into an adult.
Adolescence je življenjsko obdobje, v katerem se otrok razvije v odraslega človeka.
An adolescent is a young person who is no longer a child but who is not yet an adult.
An adolescent je mlad človek, ki ni več otrok in še ni odrasla oseba.

seg.quote: ...a father with an adolescent son.

sense.def: If you adopt someone else's child, you take it into your own family and make it legally your own.
To adopt someone else's child pomeni sprejeti tujega otroka v svojo družino in ga uradno vzeti za svojega.

seg.quote: ...parents of adopted children.
...the shortage of children available for adoption.
...the commitment involved in the adoption of a child.

sense.def: If you adopt an attitude, position, or way of behaving, you begin to have it.
To adopt an attitude, position, or way of behaving pomeni, da zavzamemo nov odnos, stališče ali vedênje.

seg.quote: I had to adopt other methods of persuasion.
This would complicate the adoption of a rule.

sense.def: If you say that a child or animal is adorable, you feel great affection for them.
Otrok ali žival, ki je adorable, v nas zbuja veliko naklonjenost.

seg.quote: ...an adorable kitten.

sense.def: Adoration is a feeling of great admiration and love.
Adoration je čustvo velikega občudovanja in ljubezni.

seg.quote: He did not tell anyone of his adoration for her.

sense.def: If you adore someone, you love and admire them.
To adore someone pomeni tistega ljubiti in občudovati.

seg.quote: She adored her sister.

sense.def: If you adore something, you like it very much.
To adore something pomeni imeti tisto zelo rad.

seg.quote: People will adore this film.

sense.def: If you adorn something, you make it more beautiful by adding things to it;
To adorn something pomeni tistemu nekaj dodati, da postane lepše;

seg.quote: The container is adorned with semi-precious stones.

sense.def: If things adorn a place, they make it more attractive.
Kadar nekaj adorns a place, naredi tisti kraj privlačnejši in lepši.

seg.quote: Oil paintings adorned the walls.
...adornments such as make-up and jewellery.
Styles of adornment have changed over the centuries.

sense.def: Adrenalin is a substance produced by your body which makes your heart beat faster and gives you more energy.
Adrenalin je snov, ki jo izloča človeško telo, da srce hitreje bije in imamo več energije.
If a boat is adrift, it is floating on the water without being controlled.
Kadar je čoln adrift, brez nadzora plava na vodi.
Someone who is adroit is quick and skilful in their thoughts or actions;
Kdor je adroit, je hiter in prožen v mislih ali dejanjih;

seg.quote: Jamie was adroit at flattering others.
The young men picked up the papers adroitly.

sense.def: Adulation is very great and uncritical admiration and praise.
Adulation je zelo veliko in nekritično občudovanje in hvaljenje.

seg.quote: He was greeted with adulation.

sense.def: An adult is a mature, fully developed person or animal.
An adult je zrel, povsem razvit človek ali žival.

seg.quote: A happy home is one in which children and adults have equal rights.
...adult insects.

sense.def: Something that is adult is suitable for adult people.
Kar je adult, je primerno za odrasle ljudi.

seg.quote: Children can assist in adult work at an early age.

sense.def: If you adulterate drink or food, you make its quality worse by adding water to it.
To adulterate drink or food pomeni z dodajanjem vode poslabšati kakovost pijače ali hrane.

seg.quote: The champagne had been adulterated.

sense.def: If a married person commits adultery, they have sex with someone that they are not married to.
To commit adultery pomeni, da ima poročen človek spolne odnose z nekom, ki ni njegov zakonski partner.
Adulthood is the state of being an adult.
Adulthood je polnoletnost.

seg.quote: There is no reason why she shouldn't survive into healthy adulthood.

sense.def: To advance means to move forward.
To advance pomeni, da se nekaj giblje naprej.

seg.quote: She advanced on him, shouting and waving her ticket.
...rows of advancing enemy tanks.

sense.def: If you advance in something you are doing, you make progress in it.
To advance in something pomeni razvijati se pri tistem, kar počnemo.

seg.quote: This student has advanced in reading and writing.
...radical advances in computer design.

sense.def: If you advance someone a sum of money, you give it to them earlier than arranged.
To advance someone a sum of money pomeni tistemu človeku izročiti vsoto denarja vnaprej.

seg.quote: Axel advanced him the money for a suit.

sense.def: An advance is money which is lent or given to someone before they are due to receive it.
An advance je denar, ki ga nekomu posodimo ali damo vnaprej.

seg.quote: ...a twenty pound advance.

sense.def: Advance booking or warning is done or given before an event happens.
Rezervacija ali svarilo, ki sta advance, sta dana pred dogodkom samim.

seg.quote: There was no advance warning of the President's departure.

sense.def: If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event.
To do something in advance pomeni tisto opraviti pred določenim datumom ali dogodkom.

seg.quote: You should book well in advance, preferably six weeks before.

sense.def: An advanced student has learned the basic facts of a subject and is doing more difficult work.
Študent ali učenec, ki je advanced, zna začetno snov določenega predmeta in se je že lotil zahtevnejšega učenja.
A country that is advanced has reached a high level of industrial or technological development.
Država, ki je advanced, je dosegla visoko stopnjo industrijskega ali tehnološkega razvoja.
Advancement is promotion in your job, or to a higher social class.
Advancement je uspeh v službi ali premik v višji družbeni razred.

seg.quote: ...opportunity for personal advancement.

sense.def: The advancement of something is the process of helping it to progress.
The advancement of something je postopek, s katerim nečemu pomagamo k napredku.

seg.quote: ...the advancement of knowledge.

sense.def: An advantage is something that puts you in a better position than other people.
An advantage je nekaj, kar človeka postavi v ugodnejši položaj v primerjavi z drugimi.

seg.quote: As a scientist I have a slight advantage over him.

sense.def: An advantage is also a benefit that is likely to result from something.
An advantage je tudi prednost, ki iz nečesa izvira.

seg.quote: The advantages of electricity are the lack of fumes and the ease of distribution.

sense.def: If something is to your advantage, it will be useful for you or will benefit you.
Kadar je nekaj to one's advantage, bo za tistega človeka koristno ali ugodno.
If you take advantage of someone, you treat them unfairly for your own benefit.
To take advantage of someone pomeni s tisto osebo ravnati nepošteno zaradi svoje lastne koristi.
If you take advantage of something, you make good use of it while you can.
To take advantage of something pomeni tisto čim bolje izkoristiti, dokler imamo priložnost.
Something that is advantageous to you is likely to benefit you.
Kar je advantageous to someone, bo človeku najverjetneje koristilo.

seg.quote: Economic growth is inevitable and advantageous.

sense.def: The advent of something is the fact of it starting or coming into existence;
The advent of something pomeni, da se je nekaj začelo ali nastalo;

seg.quote: ...the advent of computers.

sense.def: An adventure is a series of events that you become involved in and that are unusual, exciting, and perhaps dangerous.
An adventure je vrsta dogodkov, v katere smo vpleteni in ki so nenavadni, vznemirljivi ali morda nevarni.

seg.quote: ...my Arctic adventures.
They were bored, and looking for adventure.

sense.def: An adventurer is a person who enjoys adventure.
An adventurer je človek, ki ima rad pustolovščine.
An adventurous person is willing to take risks and eager to have new experiences.
Kdor je adventurous, je pripravljen tvegati, ker je željan novih doživetij.
In grammar, an adverb is a word which gives more information about time, place, or manner.
V slovnici je an adverb beseda, ki dopolni podatke o času, kraju in načinu.
Your adversary is someone you are competing with, or arguing or fighting against.
One's adversary je človek, s katerim tekmujemo, se prepiramo ali bojujemo.

seg.quote: She had two potential political adversaries.

sense.def: Adverse decisions, conditions, or effects are unfavourable to you.
Odločitve, okoliščine ali učinki, ki so adverse, so za človeka neugodni.

seg.quote: Falling prices had an adverse effect on business.
...adverse weather conditions.
The majority of children are adversely affected.

sense.def: Adversity is a very difficult or unfavourable situation.
Adversity je zelo težaven ali neugoden položaj.

seg.quote: They continue to fight in the face of adversity.

sense.def: An advert is the same as an advertisement;
An advert pomeni isto kot an advertisement;

If you advertise a product, event, or job, you tell people about it publicly, for example in newspapers or on television, in order to encourage them to buy that product, go to that event, or apply for that job.

To advertise a product, event, or job pomeni ljudem javno dati vedeti za izdelek, dogodek ali delovno mesto, na primer v časopisu ali na televiziji, da bi jih spodbudili k nakupu, obisku ali vložitvi prošnje.

seg.quote: ...deodorants she had seen advertised on television.
...a leaflet advertising a fishing competition.

sense.def: If you advertise for something that you want or if you advertise for a person to do a job, you announce in a newspaper, on television, or on a notice board that you want that thing or want someone to do that job.

To advertise for something that you want ali to advertise for someone to do a job pomeni oznaniti v časopisu, na televiziji ali oglasni deski, da iščemo tisto stvar ali nekega človeka za določeno delo.

seg.quote: The Council advertised for accountants.

sense.def: An advertisement je javno oznanilo, na primer v časopisu ali na televiziji, ki ljudi obvešča o določenem izdelku, dogodku ali prostem delovnem mestu.

seg.quote: ...an advertisement for Adler shoes.

sense.def: An advertiser is a person or company that pays for something to be advertised on television, in a newspaper, or on posters.
An advertiser je oseba ali podjetje, ki plača, da nekaj objavijo na televiziji, v časopisu ali na plakatih.
Advertising is the activity of telling people about products, events, or job vacancies, and making them want to buy the products, go to the events, or apply for the jobs.

Advertising je dejavnost, pri kateri ljudi obveščamo o izdelkih, dogodkih ali prostih delovnih mestih zato, da si bodo zaželeli kupiti izdelek, obiskati dogodek ali se prijaviti na razpis za delovno mesto.
If you give someone advice, you tell them what you think they should do.
To give someone advice pomeni tistemu človeku povedati, kaj bi moral po našem mnenju storiti.

seg.quote: She promised to follow his advice.
They want advice on how to do it.

sense.def: If a course of action is advisable, it is sensible or is likely to achieve the result you want.
Kadar je določeno dejanje advisable, je pametno ali bo verjetno doseglo zaželeni učinek.

seg.quote: It's advisable to ring up first to make an appointment.

sense.def: If you advise someone to do something, you tell them what you think they should do.
To advise someone to do something pomeni nekomu povedati, kaj mislimo, da bi moral storiti.

seg.quote: He advised me not to buy it.
Their job involves advising people how to avoid this disease.
I would strongly advise you against it.

sense.def: If you advise people on a particular subject, you give them help and information on it.
To advise people on a particular subject pomeni ljudem posredovati podatke in pomoč pri določeni temi.

seg.quote: A panel of bishops has been appointed to advise on matters of religious policy.

sense.def: An adviser is someone who gives people help and information, especially on a particular subject.
An adviser je človek, ki drugim pomaga in jim daje podatke, največkrat o določeni temi.

seg.quote: ...an independent legal adviser.
...the President's advisers.

sense.def: Someone who has an advisory role gives people help and information, especially on a particular subject.
Človek, ki ima an advisory role, ljudem pomaga in jim daje podatke, največkrat o določeni temi.

seg.quote: Most of the advisory work is carried out over the phone.
...the National Women's Advisory Committee.

sense.def: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you support it publicly.
To advocate a particular action or plan pomeni javno podpirati določeno dejanje ali načrt.

seg.quote: He advocated that Britain should join the alliance.

sense.def: An advocate of a particular action or plan is someone who supports it publicly.
An advocate of a particular action or plan je človek, ki javno podpira določeno dejanje ali načrt.

seg.quote: ...the advocates of women's rights.
...a strong advocate of nuclear power.

sense.def: An advocate is a lawyer who speaks in favour of someone or defends them in a court of law;
An advocate je pravnik, ki govori v korist določenega človeka ali ga brani na sodišču;
You use aerial to describe things that are above the level of the ground or that happen in the air.
Z besedo aerial opisujemo tisto, kar je nad zemeljskim površjem ali se zgodi v zraku.

seg.quote: An aerial railway had been erected.
...aerial warfare.

sense.def: Aerial photographs are taken from aeroplanes of things on the ground.
Posnetki, ki so aerial, prikazujejo z letala posneto zemeljsko površje.
An aerial is a piece of wire that receives television or radio signals;
An aerial je kos žice, ki sprejema televizijske ali radijske signale;
sense.ref: glej slikovno prilogo CAR AND BICYCLE.

sense.def: Aerodynamic effects and principles are concerned with the way in which objects move through the air.
Učinki in načela, ki so aerodynamic, veljajo za gibanje po zraku.

seg.quote: ...aerodynamic improvements in design.

sense.def: An aeroplane is a vehicle with wings and engines that enable it to fly through the air;
An aeroplane je vozilo s krili in motorji, ki mu omogočajo letenje;
An aerosol is a pressurized container holding a liquid such as paint or deodorant. When you press a button, the liquid is forced out as a fine spray.
An aerosol je posoda pod pritiskom, ki vsebuje tekočino, na primer barvo ali deodorant. Ko pritisnemo na gumb, tekočina škropi ven v drobnem pršcu.
Aesthetic means involving beauty or art, and people's appreciation of beautiful things.
Kar je aesthetic, je povezano z lepoto ali umetnostjo in človeškim vrednotenjem lepih stvari.

seg.quote: ...a purely aesthetic appeal.
...aesthetically appealing products.

sense.def: From afar means from a long way away;
From afar pomeni z velike oddaljenosti;

seg.quote: ...visitors from afar.

sense.def: Someone who is affable is pleasant and friendly;
Kdor je affable, je ljubezniv in prijateljski;
You refer to an event as an affair when you are talking about it generally.
O dogodku rečemo, da je an affair, kadar o njem govorimo na splošno.

seg.quote: The wedding was a quiet affair.

sense.def: You can use affairs to refer to the important facts or activities connected with a particular subject;
Množinsko obliko affairs uporabljamo za pomembna dejstva ali dejavnosti, povezane z določeno temo;

seg.quote: ...a specialist in Eastern European affairs.
...affairs of state.

sense.def: Your affairs are your private and personal concerns.
One's affairs so človekove zasebne in osebne stvari.

seg.quote: What had induced her to meddle in his affairs?

sense.def: If you say to someone that something is their own affair, you mean that you do not want to want to know about or become involved in their activities.
Če nekomu rečemo, da je nekaj their own affair, hočemo povedati, da o tistem nočemo nič vedeti ali se nočemo vpletati v njegovo dejavnost.

cit.quote: ni moja stvar, meni nič mar

seg.quote: What went on behind that door was your own affair.

sense.def: If two people who are not married to each other are having an affair, they have a sexual relationship.
Če dva človeka, ki nista poročena, are having an affair, imata spolne odnose.
When one thing affects another, it influences it or causes it to change.
Kadar nekaj affects something else, na tisto vpliva ali povzroči spremembo tistega.

seg.quote: ...the ways in which computers can affect our lives.

sense.def: If a disease affects you, it causes you to become ill.
Kadar bolezen affects someone, povzroči, da človek zboli.

seg.quote: The disease primarily affected Jane's lungs.

sense.def: If you affect a particular characteristic, you pretend that it is natural for you;
To affect a particular characteristic pomeni delati se, kot da je določena lastnost za nas naravna;

seg.quote: She affected a lisp.
He affected to despise every Briton he met.

sense.def: An affectation is an attitude or type of behaviour that is not genuine, but which is intended to impress other people.
An affectation je drža ali vedênje, ki ni pristno, vendar želimo z njim narediti vtis na druge.

seg.quote: His film star affectations had disappeared.
...elegance without affectation.

sense.def: Someone who is affected behaves in an unnatural way that is intended to impress other people.
Kdor je affected, se vede nenaravno, da bi naredil vtis na druge.

seg.quote: He was affected and conceited.

sense.def: Affection is a feeling of fondness and caring that you have for another person.
Affection je čustvo vdanosti in privrženosti drugemu človeku.

seg.quote: She gazed with deep affection at him.

sense.def: If you are affectionate, you show your fondness for another person in your behaviour.
Kadar je človek affectionate, z vedênjem kaže svojo naklonjenost do drugega človeka.

seg.quote: They were an affectionate couple.
He stroked her affectionately.

sense.def: If you have an affinity with someone or something, you feel that you belong with them and understand them.
To have an affinity with someone or something pomeni čutiti, da sodimo k tistemu človeku in ga razumemo.

seg.quote: I had this tremendous sense of affinity with the place.

sense.def: If people or things have an affinity with each other, they are similar in some ways.
Če imajo ljudje ali stvari an affinity with each other, so si v določenih pogledih podobni.

seg.quote: In anatomical structure, Prehistoric Man has close affinities with modern humans.

sense.def: If you affirm a fact, you state that it is definitely true.
To affirm a fact pomeni jasno povedati, da je tisto dejstvo resnično.

seg.quote: I affirmed my innocence.

sense.def: If you affirm an idea or belief, you indicate clearly that you have this idea or belief.
To affirm an idea or belief pomeni jasno pokazati, da je neka zamisel ali prepričanje naše.

seg.quote: They affirm a policy of religious toleration.

sense.def: An affirmative word or gesture indicates that you agree with someone;
Beseda ali poteza, ki je affirmative, pokaže, da se z nekom strinjamo;
If pain, illness, or sorrow afflicts someone, it makes them suffer.
Kadar bolečina, bolezen ali žalost afflicts someone, pri tistem človeku povzroči trpljenje.

seg.quote: Cameron had been afflicted with blindness.

sense.def: An affliction is something which causes suffering.
An affliction je nekaj, kar povzroči trpljenje.

seg.quote: ...the horrors and afflictions of his time in prison.

sense.def: If you are affluent, you have a lot of money.
Kdor je affluent, ima veliko denarja.

seg.quote: ...affluent young professionals.
...the general affluence of a consumer society.

sense.def: If you can afford something, you are able to pay for it.
Kadar človek can afford something, zmore tisto plačati.

seg.quote: ...families who can afford cars.
I can't afford to rent this flat.

sense.def: If you cannot afford to allow something to happen, it would be harmful or embarrassing to you if it happened.
Če človek cannot afford to allow something to happen, pomeni, da bi bil tisti dogodek zanj škodljiv ali sramoten.

seg.quote: We can't afford another scandal.
He could not afford to be associated with them.

sense.def: If you are affronted by something, you feel insulted and hurt by it.
To be affronted by something pomeni, da nas tisto žali in boli.

seg.quote: They were deeply affronted by their abrupt dismissal.

sense.def: If something is an affront to you, it is an obvious insult to you.
Kadar je nekaj an affront to someone, ga odkrito žali.
If someone comes from far afield, they come from a long way away.
Kadar človek comes from far afield, pride zelo od daleč.

seg.quote: Groups from as far afield as Scotland have sent deputations.

sense.def: When someone or something is afloat, they remain partly above the surface of water and do not sink.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj afloat, ostane delno nad vodno gladino in se ne potopi.

seg.quote: By kicking constantly he could stay afloat.

sense.def: If you stay afloat or if you keep a business afloat, you have just enough money to run your business.
To stay afloat ali to keep a business afloat pomeni imeti ravno še dovolj denarja za poslovanje.

seg.quote: They have kept Vickers afloat during the recession.

sense.def: If a plan or scheme is afoot, it is already happening or being planned, often secretly.
Če je načrt ali naklep afoot, že teče ali je načrtovan, največkrat skrivaj.

seg.quote: There was a plan afoot to have her sent to a camp.

sense.def: Človek ali stvar, ki je aforementioned, je bil omenjen že prej;

seg.quote: ...the works of all the aforementioned writers.

sense.def: If you are afraid of someone or afraid to do something, you are frightened because you think that something horrible is going to happen.
Kadar je človek afraid of someone ali afraid to do something, se boji, ker misli, da se bo zaradi nekoga ali nečesa zgodilo nekaj strašnega.

seg.quote: They were afraid of you.
He was afraid even to turn his head.

sense.def: If you are afraid that something unpleasant will happen, you are worried that it may happen.
Kadar je človek afraid, da se bo zgodilo kaj neprijetnega, ga skrbi, da se bo tisto zgodilo.

seg.quote: She was afraid that I might be embarrassed.
He was terribly afraid of offending anyone.
Don't be afraid to ask questions.

sense.def: When you want to apologize to someone or to disagree with them in a polite way, you can begin by saying I'm afraid.
Če se želimo nekomu opravičiti ali vljudno povedati, da se z njim ne strinjamo, lahko stavek začnemo z izrazom I'm afraid.

seg.quote: I'm afraid I can't agree.

sense.def: If you do something afresh, you do it again in a different way.
To do something afresh pomeni tisto ponoviti drugače kot prejšnjikrat.

seg.quote: I'm too old to start afresh.

sense.def: African means belonging or relating to Africa.
African je tak, ki pripada Afriki ali je povezan z njo.

seg.quote: ...the African population of Johannesburg.

sense.def: An African is a person who comes from Africa.
An African je oseba, ki je po rodu iz Afrike.
If something happens after a particular date or event, it happens later than that date or event.
Kadar se nekaj zgodi after a particular date or event, se zgodi pozneje od tistega datuma ali dogodka.

seg.quote: She arrived just after breakfast.
Soon after, Faraday began his research into electricity.
He was ill after eating the meal.

sense.def: If you go after someone, or if you are after them, you follow or chase them.
To go after someone ali to be after someone pomeni tistega človeka zasledovati ali preganjati.

seg.quote: She ran after him into the courtyard.
The Germans were after him.

sense.def: If you are after something, you are trying to get it for yourself.
Kadar je človek after something, poskuša tisto pridobiti.

seg.quote: Those youngsters are after my job.

sense.def: To be named after someone means to be given the same name as them.
Kadar je človek named after someone, ima enako osebno ime kot druga oseba.

seg.quote: ...a street named after my grandfather.

sense.def: Americans use after to tell the time. For example, if they say it is ten after six, the time is ten minutes past six.
Američani z besedo after povedo, koliko je ura. Na primer: kadar rečejo, da je ten after six, je ura šest in deset minut.
If something happens day after day or year after year, it happens every day or every year.
Kadar se nekaj dogaja day after day ali year after year, se dogaja vsak dan ali vsako leto.

cit.quote: dan za dnem, leto za letom

seg.quote: Some jokes go round school year after year.

sense.def: The after-effects of an activity or event are the conditions which result from it.
The after-effects of an activity or event so razmere, ki nastanejo zaradi neke dejavnosti ali dogodka.

seg.quote: 100,000 died from the after-effects of radiation over the next few decades.

sense.def: The aftermath of an important event is the situation that results from it.
The aftermath of an important event je položaj, ki ga povzroči določen pomemben dogodek.

seg.quote: In the immediate aftermath of the accident, no one knew who had been hurt.

sense.def: The afternoon is the part of each day which begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock.
The afternoon je del dneva, ki se začne ob kosilu in konča okoli šestih zvečer.
An afterthought is a remark or action which you do or say as an addition to something else, but perhaps without careful thought.
An afterthought je pripomba, ki jo izrečemo, ali dejanje, ki ga storimo poleg drugega, čeprav morda brez posebnega premisleka.

seg.quote: After a while she said as an afterthought, "I could do that."

form.form: Uporabljamo tudi zapis afterward, zlasti v ameriški angleščini.

sense.def: If something is done or happens afterwards, it is done or happens later than a particular event or time that has already been described.
Kadar nekaj storimo ali se zgodi afterwards, tisto storimo ali se zgodi pozneje kot prej omenjeni dogodek ali čas.

seg.quote: Afterwards we all helped with the washing up.
She died soon afterwards.

sense.def: If you do something again, you do it once more.
To do something again pomeni tisto narediti še enkrat.

seg.quote: Try again in half an hour.
Let's do it, I may never have the chance again.

sense.def: When something is in a particular state or place again, it has returned to the state or place that it was before.
Če je nekaj v določenem stanju ali na določenem kraju again, se je vrnilo v tisto stanje ali na tisti kraj.

seg.quote: At last the assembly was silent again.

sense.def: When you are asking someone to repeat something that they have already told you, you can add again to the end of your question.
Če nekoga prosimo, naj ponovi, kar nam je že povedal, lahko na koncu pristavimo besedo again.

seg.quote: What's his name again?

sense.def: You can use again to emphasize a similarity between the subject you are talking about now and a previous subject.
Z besedo again lahko poudarimo podobnost med temo, o kateri govorimo, in prejšnjo temo pogovora.

seg.quote: My last question is again a personal one.

sense.def: If something is leaning or pressing against something else, it is touching it.
Kadar je nekaj leaning or pressing against something else, se na tisto naslanja ali pritiska.

seg.quote: Ralph leaned against a tree.
She was pressing her nose against the window.

sense.def: If you compete against someone in a game, you try to beat them.
To compete against someone in a game pomeni poskušati v igri nekoga premagati.

seg.quote: He played in the first Test Match against Australia.

sense.def: If you do something against someone or something, you do something that might harm them.
To do something against someone or something pomeni storiti nekaj, kar tistemu lahko škoduje.

seg.quote: They were not allowed to use arms against their enemies.

sense.def: If you are against an idea, policy, or system, you are opposed to it.
Kadar je človek against an idea, policy, or system, nasprotuje neki zamisli, politiki ali sistemu.

seg.quote: He was fanatically against American intervention in the war.

sense.def: Something that is against the law is forbidden by law.
Kar je against the law, je z zakonom prepovedano.
If you take action against a possible future event, you try to prevent it.
To take action against a possible future event pomeni poskusiti preprečiti možen prihodnji dogodek.

seg.quote: He has taken certain precautions against burglary.

sense.def: If you are moving against a current, tide, or wind, you are moving in the opposite direction to it.
To be moving against a current, tide, or wind pomeni premikati se v nasprotni smeri kot tok, plima ali veter.
The chances or odds against something happening are the chances or odds that it will not happen.
The chances or odds against something happening so možnosti ali upanje, da se tisto ne bo zgodilo.

seg.quote: The odds against another attack were astronomical.

sense.def: Your age is the number of years that you have lived.
One's age je število let, ki jih je človek preživel.

seg.quote: He is eighty years of age.
He died at the age of forty.

sense.def: Age is the state of being old.
Age je življenjsko obdobje, ko človek postane star.

seg.quote: Her age and frailty are giving him cause for concern.
...medals stained with age.

sense.def: When someone ages, they become or seem much older.
Kadar nekdo ages, postane ali je videti precej starejši kot prej.

seg.quote: She was dismayed to see how much he had aged.
The strain of looking after her had aged him.
...an ageing film star.

sense.def: An age is a period in history.
An age je zgodovinsko obdobje.

seg.quote: ...the great age of Greek sport.
...a detailed study of woman's role throughout the ages.

sense.def: You can say an age or ages to mean a very long time;
Z izrazom an age ali ages označimo zelo dolgo obdobje;

seg.quote: She took an age to dress.
I've known him for ages.

sense.def: Someone who is under age is not legally old enough to do something, for example to buy an alcoholic drink.
Človek, ki je under age, po zakonu ni dovolj star za kaj, na primer za kupovanje alkoholnih pijač.
When someone comes of age, they become legally an adult. In Britain, young people come of age when they are 18.
Kadar človek comes of age, po zakonu postane odrasel. V Veliki Britaniji mladi postanejo odrasli pri osemnajstih letih.

form.form: pri 1. pomenu besedo izgovarjamo /*e*IdZd/, pri 2. in 3. pa /*e*IdZI2d/.

sense.def: You use aged followed by a number to say how old someone is.
Z besedo aged, za katero stoji število, povemo, koliko let ima človek.

seg.quote: ...men aged 60 and over.

sense.def: Someone or something that is aged is very old.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj aged, to pomeni, da je zelo star.

seg.quote: ...his aged aunt.

sense.def: You can refer to all people who are very old as the aged.
Vse zelo stare ljudi lahko imenujemo the aged.
An agency is a business which provides services for another business.
An agency je podjetje, ki ponuja usluge drugemu podjetju.

seg.quote: ...an advertising agency.

sense.def: In the United States, an agency is an administrative organization run by a government.
V Združenih državah Amerike je an agency upravna organizacija pod okriljem vlade.

seg.quote: ...the Central Intelligence Agency.

sense.def: An agenda is a list of items to be discussed at a meeting.
An agenda je seznam točk, o katerih bo tekla razprava na seji.

seg.quote: What is on the agenda today?

sense.def: An agent is someone who arranges work or business for someone else, especially actors or musicians.
An agent je človek, ki priskrbi delo ali kupčijo drugemu človeku, navadno igralcu ali glasbeniku.

seg.quote: I phoned my agent in London about the job.

sense.def: An agent is also someone who works for a country's secret service.
An agent je tudi človek, ki dela v tajni vohunski službi neke države.

seg.quote: ...an enemy agent.

sense.def: You can refer to the cause of a particular effect as its agent.
An agent je tudi vzrok za določen učinek.

seg.quote: ...the agent of change.

sense.def: An age-old story, tradition, or connection has existed for a very long time.
Zgodba, tradicija ali povezava, ki je age-old, obstaja že zelo dolgo časa.
If you aggravate a situation, you make it worse.
To aggravate a situation pomeni povzročiti, da se določene razmere poslabšajo.

seg.quote: National poverty was aggravated by rapid population growth.

sense.def: To aggravate someone means to make them annoyed;
To aggravate someone pomeni, da nekoga vznejevoljimo;

seg.quote: Thomas had a great deal to aggravate him at present.

sense.def: An aggregate is an amount made up of several smaller amounts.
An aggregate je količina, sestavljena iz več manjših količin.

seg.quote: He had spent an aggregate of fifteen years in various jails.

sense.def: If you behave with aggression, you behave angrily or violently towards someone.
To behave with aggression pomeni obnašati se do nekoga jezno ali nasilno.

seg.quote: Barbara defended herself with a sudden new aggression.
...an act of aggression.

sense.def: Someone who is aggressive shows aggression.
Kdor je aggressive, kaže svojo bojevitost.

seg.quote: She was in a highly aggressive mood.
She strode aggressively into the office.

sense.def: If you are aggressive in your work or other activities, you behave in a forceful way because you are eager to succeed.
Kdor je pri delu ali drugih dejavnostih aggressive, se vede nasilno, ker želi uspeti.

seg.quote: ...aggressive businessmen.

sense.def: The aggressor is the person or country that starts a fight.
The aggressor je človek ali država, ki začne spopad.
If you feel aggrieved, you feel upset and angry because of the way you have been treated.
To feel aggrieved pomeni, da smo vznemirjeni in jezni zaradi ravnanja, ki smo ga bili deležni.
If you are aghast, you are filled with horror and surprise.
Kadar je človek aghast, je prestrašen in presenečen.
Someone who is agile can move with surprising ease and speed.
Kdor je agile, se zmore premikati s presenetljivo lahkoto in hitrostjo.

seg.quote: He was as agile as a monkey.
He leaped out of the car with surprising agility.

sense.def: If you have an agile mind, you think quickly and intelligently.
To have an agile mind pomeni hitro in pametno razmišljati.

seg.quote: ...tests of mental agility.

sense.def: If you agitate for something, you talk and campaign enthusiastically in order to get it.
To agitate for something pomeni o nečem navdušeno govoriti in se zavzemati, da bi tisto dosegli.

seg.quote: ...a group agitating against the use of chemical fertilizers.
...anti-imperialist agitation.

sense.def: If something agitates you, it worries you and makes you unable to think clearly.
Kadar nekaj agitates someone, mu povzroča skrbi in prepreči jasno razmišljanje.

seg.quote: I don't want to agitate him unduly.
He looked dishevelled and agitated.
I saw Peter glancing at his watch in some agitation.

sense.def: An agitator is someone who tries to bring about political or social change by making speeches and campaigning in public.
An agitator je človek, ki poskuša povzročiti politične ali družbene spremembe z govori in javno propagando.

seg.quote: ...political agitators.

sense.def: An agnostic believes that it is not possible to know whether God exists or not.
An agnostic je prepričan, da ni mogoče vedeti, ali bog obstaja ali ne.

seg.quote: She remained agnostic.

sense.def: You use ago to refer to past time. For example, if something happened one year ago, it is one year since it happened.
Z besedo ago povemo, da se je nekaj zgodilo v preteklosti. Na primer: če se je nekaj zgodilo one year ago, je od takrat minilo eno leto.

seg.quote: Five years ago, I went to the tropics.
How long ago was that?

sense.def: If you agonize over something, you feel anxious and spend a long time thinking about it.
To agonize over something pomeni biti zaradi nečesa v skrbeh in o tistem dolgo razmišljati.

cit.quote: mučiti se, trpeti, biti v agoniji

sense.def: Agonized describes something that you say or do when you are in great physical or mental pain.
Beseda agonized opisuje tisto, kar rečemo ali storimo, kadar trpimo hude telesne ali duševne bolečine.

seg.quote: ...agonised moans.

sense.def: Something that is agonizing causes you to feel great physical or mental pain.
Kar je agonizing, nam povzroča hude telesne ali duševne bolečine.

seg.quote: ...agonizing feelings of shame and guilt.
The sound was agonisingly painful.

sense.def: Agonizing decisions and choices are very difficult to make.
Odločitve ali izbire, ki so agonizing, so zelo težavne.
Agony is great physical or mental pain.
Agony so hude telesne ali duševne bolečine.

seg.quote: The blow made him scream in agony.

sense.def: If you agree with someone, you have the same opinion about something.
To agree with someone pomeni z nekom imeti enako mnenje o določeni stvari.

seg.quote: Do you agree with him about this?
People agree that the law is behind the times.

sense.def: If you agree to do something, you say that you will do it.
To agree to do something pomeni privoliti, da bomo nekaj storili.

seg.quote: She agreed to let us use her flat while she was away.

sense.def: If people are agreed about something, they have reached a decision about it.
To be agreed about something pomeni, da se več ljudi glede nečesa skupaj odloči.

seg.quote: Are we agreed, gentlemen?

sense.def: If you agree with an action or a suggestion, you approve of it.
To agree with an action or a suggestion pomeni podpirati neko dejanje ali predlog.

seg.quote: I agree with what they are doing.

sense.def: If two stories, accounts, or totals agree, they are the same as each other.
Kadar dve zgodbi, računa ali vsoti agree, sta enaki.

seg.quote: This bill doesn't agree with my calculations.

sense.def: If something is agreeable, it is pleasant.
Kar je agreeable, nam ugaja.

seg.quote: ...an agreeable sensation.

sense.def: If someone is agreeable, they are pleasant and try to please people.
Kdor je agreeable, je ljubezniv in se trudi, da bi ljudem ugajal.

seg.quote: She always made a point of being agreeable to them.

sense.def: If you are agreeable to something or if it is agreeable to you, you are willing to do it or to allow it.
Kadar je človek agreeable to something ali kadar je nekaj agreeable to someone, je pripravljen tisto storiti ali dovoliti.
An agreement is a decision that two or more people have reached together.
An agreement je odločitev, ki jo skupaj sprejmeta dve ali več oseb.

seg.quote: Half of the land was given away under the same agreement.

sense.def: Agreement is the act of reaching a decision, or of indicating that you will accept something.
Agreement je odločitev ali obljuba, da bomo nekaj sprejeli.

seg.quote: There was no general agreement on the timing.

sense.def: If you are in agreement with someone, you have the same opinion as they have.
Kadar je človek in agreement with someone, je z nekom enakih misli.
Agriculture is farming and the methods used to look after crops and animals.
Agriculture obsega kmetovanje in metode za pridelovanje poljščin in vzrejo živine.

seg.quote: ...modern agricultural methods.

sense.def: If something is ahead, it is in front of you.
Kadar je nekaj ahead, je pred nami.

seg.quote: The road ahead is foggy.
She stared ahead.

sense.def: If you are ahead of someone in your work or achievements, you have made more progress than they have.
Kadar je človek pri delu ali dosežkih ahead of someone, napreduje bolj kot nekdo drug.
If a person or a team is ahead in a competition, they are winning.
Kadar je človek ali moštvo na tekmovanju ahead, zmaguje.
If someone arrives at a place ahead of you, they arrive there before you.
Kadar človek nekam pride ahead of someone, pride tja pred tistim človekom.
If someone goes on ahead or is sent on ahead, they leave for a place before other people.
Kadar človek goes on ahead ali is sent on ahead, nekam odide ali je poslan prej kakor drugi.

seg.quote: Our parents had gone on ahead in father's car.

sense.def: Ahead also means in the future.
Ahead se nanaša tudi na prihodnost.

seg.quote: I haven't had time to think far ahead.

sense.def: Aid is money, equipment, or services that are provided for people in need.
Aid so denar, oprema ali usluge, ki jih dajemo ljudem v stiski.

seg.quote: ...food and medical aid.

sense.def: An aid is something that makes things easier to do.
An aid je nekaj, kar nam olajša delo.

seg.quote: ...a valuable aid to digestion.

sense.def: If you aid a person or an organization, you help them.
To aid a person or an organization pomeni pomagati nekemu človeku ali organizaciji.

seg.quote: He crossed the border aided by a priest.

sense.def: If an activity or event is in aid of a particular cause, it raises money for that cause.
Dejavnost ali dogodek, ki je in aid of a particular cause, nam pomaga zbrati denar za tisti namen.

seg.quote: ...a cricket match in aid of cancer relief.

sense.def: If you do something with the aid of a particular person or thing, they help you to do it.
To do something with the aid of a particular person or thing pomeni, da nam določen človek ali stvar pomaga pri delu.

seg.quote: The programmes had been prepared with the aid of various broadcasters.

sense.def: If you go to the aid of someone, you try to help them.
To go to the aid of someone pomeni truditi se, da bi nekomu pomagali.

seg.quote: They had rushed to her aid.

sense.def: An aide is an assistant to a person with an important job, especially in government or in the armed forces.
An aide je pomočnik človeka, ki ima pomembno nalogo, navadno v vladi ali vojski.
AIDS is an illness which destroys the natural system of protection that the body has against disease.
AIDS je bolezen, ki uniči naravni obrambni sistem telesa, da se ne more upirati bolezni.
If someone is ailing, they are ill and not getting better.
Kadar je človek ailing, je bolan in mu ne gre na bolje.
If an organization is ailing, it is in difficulty and is becoming weaker.
Kadar je neka organizacija ailing, ima težave in ji grozi propad.
An ailment is an illness, especially one that is not very serious.
An ailment je bolezen, navadno ne preveč huda.
If you aim a weapon or object at something, you point it in the direction of the thing.
To aim a weapon or object at something pomeni naperiti orožje ali predmet v neki cilj.

seg.quote: Roger picked up a stone, aimed it, and threw it at Henry.
He aimed at the far wall and squeezed the trigger.
He leaned against a tree to steady his aim.

sense.def: If you take aim at someone or something, you point a weapon or object at them, ready to shoot or throw.
To take aim at someone or something pomeni z orožjem ali predmetom pokazati na nekoga ali nekaj v pripravljenosti, da bomo streljali ali vrgli tisti predmet.
If you aim at something or aim to do it, you plan or hope to achieve it.
To aim at something ali to aim to do something pomeni načrtovati ali upati, da bomo dosegli svoj cilj.

seg.quote: We are aiming at a higher production level.
A good solid job is the thing to aim for.

sense.def: If an action or plan is aimed at achieving something, it is intended to achieve it.
Kadar je dejanje ali načrt aimed at achieving something, z njim nameravamo nekaj uresničiti.

seg.quote: ...policies aimed at securing mass support.

sense.def: An aim is the thing that an action or plan is intended to achieve.
An aim je tisto, kar želimo doseči z nekim dejanjem ali načrtom.

seg.quote: It is our aim to set up a workshop.

sense.def: If your action is aimed at a particular person, you intend it to affect and influence them.
Kadar je naše dejanje aimed at a particular person, hočemo z njim vplivati na določeno osebo.

seg.quote: This anti-smoking campaign is mainly aimed at young teenagers.

sense.def: A person or activity that is aimless has no clear purpose or plan.
Oseba ali dejavnost, ki je aimless, nima jasnega namena ali cilja.

seg.quote: ...drawing aimless doodles in the sand.
She wandered aimlessly along the beach.

sense.def: Ain't is used in some dialects of English instead of "am not", "aren't", or "isn't".
Ain't uporabljajo v nekaterih narečjih namesto am not, aren't, ali isn't.
Air is the mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.
Air je mešanica plinov, iz katerih je sestavljeno zemeljsko ozračje in ki jo dihamo.

seg.quote: She took a gulp of air.

sense.def: The air is the space around things that is above the ground.
The air je prostor okoli predmetov nad zemljo.

seg.quote: My dog was lying on the floor with its feet in the air.
The smell of cooking filled the air.

sense.def: Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft.
Beseda air se nanaša na potovanja z letalom.

seg.quote: The fare by air from London to Luxembourg is £145 return.
...air travel.

sense.def: If someone or something has a particular air, they give this general impression.
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj has a particular air, daje tak splošni vtis.

seg.quote: He has a faintly old-fashioned air.

sense.def: If you air your opinions, you make them known to people.
To air one's opinions pomeni seznaniti druge s svojim mnenjem.

seg.quote: He spoke on the radio, airing his views to the nation.

sense.def: If you air a room, you let fresh air into it.
To air a room pomeni v sobo spustiti svež zrak.
When you air clothing or when it airs, you put it somewhere warm so it becomes completely dry.
Kadar človek airs clothing ali kadar clothing airs, pomeni, da postavimo obleko na toplo, da se do kraja posuši.
To disappear into thin air means to disappear completely.
To disappear into thin air pomeni popolnoma izginiti.
To appear out of thin air means to appear suddenly and mysteriously.
To appear out of thin air pomeni prikazati se nenadoma in skrivnostno.

cit.quote: pojaviti se kot strela z jasnega, pasti z neba

sense.def: If someone is on the air, they are broadcasting on radio or television.
Kadar je človek on the air, nastopa na radiu ali televiziji.

cit.quote: na radiu ali televiziji, v etru

sense.def: Airborne means flying in the air or coming from the air.
Airborne pomeni leteč po zraku ali prihajajoč iz zraka.

seg.quote: ...airborne attacks.

sense.def: If a room is air-conditioned, the air in it is kept cool and dry by means of a special machine called an "air-conditioner".
Kadar je soba air-conditioned, je zrak v njej hlajen in sušen s klimatsko napravo.
An aircraft is a vehicle which can fly, for example an aeroplane or a helicopter.
An aircraft je motorno vozilo, ki leti po zraku, na primer letalo ali helikopter.
An airfield is a small area of ground where aircraft take off and land.
An airfield je majhno zemljišče, na katerem letala vzletajo in pristajajo.
An air force is the part of a country's military organization that is concerned with fighting in the air.
An air force je del državne vojaške organizacije, ki se ukvarja z bojevanjem v zraku.
If you give a room an airing, you let fresh air into it.
To give a room an airing pomeni v sobo spustiti svež zrak.
If you give clothing an airing, you put it somewhere warm so that it becomes completely dry.
To give clothing an airing pomeni postaviti obleko na toplo, da se popolnoma posuši.
If you give your opinions an airing, you make them known to people.
To give one's opinions an airing pomeni seznaniti druge s svojim mnenjem.
An airline is a company which provides regular services carrying people or goods in aeroplanes.
An airline je podjetje, ki omogoča reden prevoz ljudi in blaga z letali.
An airliner is a large aeroplane used for carrying passengers.
An airliner je veliko letalo za prevoz potnikov.
Airmail is the system of sending letters, parcels, and goods by air.
Airmail je način pošiljanja pisem, paketov in blaga po zraku.

seg.quote: She gave him a letter to post by airmail.

sense.def: An airplane is the same as an aeroplane;
An airplane pomeni isto kot an aeroplane;
An airport is a place where aircraft land and take off, usually with a lot of buildings and facilities.
An airport je kraj, kjer pristajajo in vzletajo letala; navadno je opremljen s stavbami in napravami.
An air raid is an attack by enemy aircraft in which bombs are dropped.
An air raid je napad sovražnega letalstva, med katerim spuščajo bombe.
A country's airspace is the part of the sky that is over that country and is considered to belong to the country.
A country's airspace je tisti del neba nad državo, ki je po zakonu njena last.

seg.quote: The plane crashed just after entering British airspace.

sense.def: An air terminal is a building at an airport where you check in and wait for your flight, or arrive after your flight.
An air terminal je stavba na letališču, kjer se prijavimo in počakamo na polet ali kamor pridemo s poleta.
If a container is airtight, its lid fits so tightly that no air can get in or out.
Posoda, ki je airtight, ima tako tesno prilegajoč se pokrov, da zrak ne more vanjo ali iz nje.
Airwaves are the radio waves used in radio and television broadcasting.
Airwaves so radijski valovi, ki jih uporabljamo za radijsko in televizijsko oddajanje.
If a building is airy, it is large and has plenty of fresh air inside.
Stavba, ki je airy, je velika in je v njej dovolj svežega zraka.

seg.quote: The church was airy and light inside.

sense.def: You can use airy to describe someone who is light-hearted and casual about things which should be taken seriously.
Z besedo airy lahko opišemo človeka, ki brezskrbno in malomarno obravnava zadeve, ki bi jih moral jemati resno.

seg.quote: He applied in an airy way for the job of assistant manager.
...talking airily of this and that.

sense.def: An aisle is a long narrow gap that people can walk along between rows of seats or between rows of shelves in a supermarket.
An aisle je dolg, ozek razmik med vrstami sedežev ali polic v samopostrežni prodajalni.
If a door is ajar, it is slightly open.
Kadar so vrata ajar, niso odprta na stežaj.

seg.quote: She left the door ajar.

sense.def: If one thing is akin to another, it is similar to it in some way;
Kadar je ena stvar akin to another, je v določeni meri podobna neki drugi;

seg.quote: She had answered with something akin to anger.

sense.def: -al is added to nouns to form adjectives indicating what something relates to or what kind of thing something is. Adjectives of this kind are often not defined but are treated with the related nouns.

Pripono -al dodamo samostalnikom, da iz njih tvorimo pridevnike, s katerimi označujemo, kaj predmet označuje ali kakšne vrste je. Takih pridevnikov v tem slovarju ponavadi ne razlagamo, temveč jih obravnavamo pri ustreznih samostalnikih.

seg.quote: ...agricultural workers.
...departmental running costs.

sense.def: If you do something with alacrity, you do it quickly and eagerly;
To do something with alacrity pomeni tisto storiti hitro in zavzeto;
Alarm is a sudden feeling of fear or anxiety.
Alarm je nenaden občutek strahu ali nemira.

seg.quote: She looked round in alarm.

sense.def: An alarm is an automatic device that warns you of danger.
An alarm je avtomatska naprava, ki nas posvari pred nevarnostjo.

seg.quote: The alarm went off.
...a burglar alarm.

sense.def: If you sound or raise the alarm, you warn people of danger.
To sound ali to raise the alarm pomeni opozoriti ljudi na nevarnost.
If something alarms you, it makes you suddenly afraid or anxious.
Kadar nekaj alarms someone, tisto človeka nenadoma prestraši ali razburi.

seg.quote: The sight of the school alarmed her.
She looked alarmed.

sense.def: An alarm clock is a clock that you can set so that it wakes you up at a particular time.
An alarm clock je ura, ki jo lahko nastavimo tako, da nas ob določeni uri zbudi.
Something that is alarming makes you worried or concerned.
Kar je alarming, nam povzroča skrbi ali nas vznemirja.

seg.quote: The world's forests are shrinking at an alarming rate.
Her sight had begun to deteriorate alarmingly.

sense.def: Alarmist means causing unnecessary alarm.
Alarmist je človek, ki po nepotrebnem povzroča vznemirjenje.

seg.quote: Don't be too alarmist.

sense.def: You use alas to say that you think that the facts you are talking about are sad, unfortunate, or regrettable;
Z besedo alas povemo, da so dejstva, o katerih govorimo, po našem mnenju žalostna, nesrečna ali obžalovanja vredna;

seg.quote: There was, alas, no shortage of assassinations.

sense.def: An albatross is a very large white sea bird.
An albatross je zelo velika, bela morska ptica.
You can use albeit to introduce a fact or comment which contrasts in some way with what you have just said;
Z besedo albeit predstavimo dejstvo ali pripombo, ki je v določenem nasprotju s pravkar povedanim;

seg.quote: It continues to publish, albeit irregularly, two journals.

sense.def: An albino is a person or animal with very white skin, white hair, and pink eyes.
An albino je človek ali žival, ki ima zelo svetlo kožo, bele lase ali dlako in rožnate oči.
An album is a record with about 25 minutes of music or speech on each side.
An album je plošča, ki ima na vsaki strani približno 25 minut posnete glasbe ali govora.
An album is also a book in which you put photographs, stamps, or other things that you have collected.
An album je tudi knjiga, v katero spravimo fotografije, znamke ali druge predmete, ki jih zbiramo.
Alcohol is drink such as beer, wine, and whisky that can make people drunk.
Alcohol je pijača, na primer pivo, vino in viski, od katere je človek lahko pijan.
Alcohol is also a colourless liquid which is found in drinks such as beer, wine, and whisky and which can be used as a solvent.
Alcohol je tudi brezbarvna tekočina, ki je v pijačah, kot so pivo, vino in viski, in ki jo lahko uporabimo kot topilo ali razredčilo.
An alcoholic drink contains alcohol.
Pijača, ki je alcoholic, vsebuje alkohol.
Someone who is an alcoholic is addicted to alcohol.
Človek, ki je an alcoholic, je zasvojen z alkoholom.
Alcoholism is a kind of poisoning caused by drinking too much alcohol over a long period of time.
Alcoholism je zastrupitev, ki v daljšem obdobju nastane zaradi prevelike količine zaužitega alkohola.
An alcove is a small area of a room which is formed when one part of a wall is built farther back than the rest of it.
An alcove je majhen del sobe, v katerem je zid umaknjen globlje kot preostala stena.
Ale is a kind of beer.
Ale je vrsta piva.
If you are alert, you are paying full attention to what is happening.
Kadar je človek alert, je zelo pozoren na tisto, kar se dogaja.

seg.quote: We have to be alert all the time and look for our opportunity.
The job requires constant alertness and vigilance.

sense.def: If you are alert to something, you are fully aware of it.
Kadar je človek alert to something, se tistega popolnoma zaveda.

seg.quote: They were both alert to the dangers.

sense.def: An alert is a situation in which people prepare themselves for danger.
An alert so okoliščine, v katerih se ljudje pripravijo na nevarnost.

seg.quote: The city centre was on a nuclear alert.

sense.def: If you are on the alert, you are ready to deal with anything that might happen.
Kadar je človek on the alert, je pripravljen soočiti se z vsem, kar bi se lahko zgodilo.
If you alert someone, you warn them of danger or trouble.
To alert someone pomeni opozoriti drugega človeka na nevarnost ali težave.

seg.quote: He pressed the horn of the vehicle to alert the squadron.

sense.def: An A level is a British educational qualification which schoolchildren take when they are seventeen or eighteen years old.
V britanskem izobraževalnem sistemu je an A level oznaka za izpit, ki ga šolarji opravljajo v starosti 17 ali 18 let.
Algebra is a type of mathematics in which letters are used to represent possible quantities.
Algebra je vrsta matematike, pri kateri s črkami označujemo možne količine.
An alias is a false name, especially one used by a criminal.
An alias je privzeto ime, kakršno največkrat uporabljajo zločinci.
You use alias when you mention someone's false name.
Besedo alias uporabimo, kadar omenimo nepravo ime nekega človeka.

seg.quote: ...Dr Christopher Pallis, alias Martin Grainger.

sense.def: If you have an alibi, you can prove that you were somewhere else when a crime was committed.
Kadar ima človek an alibi, lahko dokaže, da je bil v času, ko je bil storjen neki zločin, nekje drugje.
Something that is alien belongs to a different country, race, or group.
Kar je alien, sodi v drugo državo, raso ali skupino.

seg.quote: ...adjusting to an alien society.

sense.def: If you describe something as alien, you mean that it seems strange and perhaps frightening, because it is not part of your normal experience.
Kar je alien, je videti nenavadno in morda strašljivo, ker ne sodi med naše običajne izkušnje.

seg.quote: ...a totally alien and threatening environment.

sense.def: If something is alien to your normal feelings or behaviour, it is not the way you would normally feel or behave.
Kadar je nekaj alien to someone's normal feelings or behaviour, je drugačno od njegovih običajnih občutkov ali vedênja.

seg.quote: There were things about this new life that were not only alien to him, but horrifying.

sense.def: An alien is someone who is not a legal citizen of the country in which they live.
An alien je nekdo, ki uradno ni državljan države, v kateri živi.
An alien is also a creature from outer space.
An alien je tudi bitje iz vesolja.
If you alienate someone, you make them become unfriendly or unsympathetic towards you.
To alienate someone pomeni povzročiti, da tisti človek do nas postane neljubezniv ali brezčuten.

seg.quote: I managed to alienate Dennis, who earlier on had been so friendly.
...alienation on the part of many workers.

sense.def: If someone is alienated from something, they are emotionally or intellectually separated from it.
To be alienated from something pomeni biti čustveno ali razumsko ločen od tistega.

seg.quote: People have been alienated from their roots.
...a growing feeling of despair and alienation.

sense.def: If something is alight, it is burning.
Kadar je nekaj alight, gori.

seg.quote: The boats were set alight.

sense.def: If you describe someone's face or expression as alight, you mean that they look excited.
Človekov obraz ali izraz, ki je alight, je videti veselo vznemirjen.

seg.quote: She was looking at him, her eyes alight.

sense.def: If a bird or insect alights somewhere, it lands there.
Kadar ptica ali žuželka alights somewhere, nekje pristane.

seg.quote: It flew across to the tree and alighted on a branch.

sense.def: When you alight from a train or bus, you get out of it after a journey;
Kadar človek alights from a train or bus, na koncu potovanja stopi z vlaka ali avtobusa;
If you are aligned with a particular group, you support them in the same political aim.
To be aligned with a particular group pomeni podpirati politične cilje določene skupine.

seg.quote: They have avoided aligning themselves with any one political party.
...political alignments with foreign powers.

sense.def: If you align two objects, you place them in a particular position in relation to each other, usually parallel.
To align two objects pomeni postaviti dva predmeta v določeno razmerje, navadno vzporedno drugega z drugim.

seg.quote: He aligned his papers in geometrical patterns on his desk.
Something had slipped out of alignment.

sense.def: If two or more things are alike, they are similar.
Kadar sta dve ali več stvari alike, so videti enake.

seg.quote: They all look alike to me.

sense.def: Alike also means in a similar way.
Alike pomeni tudi na podoben način.

seg.quote: The children are all treated alike.

sense.def: You use alike after mentioning a group in order to emphasize that you are referring to the whole of it.
Besedo alike uporabimo potem, ko omenimo določeno skupino ljudi, če želimo poudariti, da mislimo na skupino v celoti.

seg.quote: The strike is damaging to managers and workers alike.

sense.def: Alimony is money that someone has to pay regularly to their former wife or husband after they have been divorced.
Alimony je denar, ki ga mora po ločitvi zakonec plačevati nekdanjemu partnerju.
If people or animals are alive, they have life.
Kadar so ljudje ali živali alive, je v njih življenje.

seg.quote: I think his father is still alive.

sense.def: If you describe someone as alive, you mean that they are lively and enjoy everything that they do.
Človek, ki je alive, je zelo dejaven in uživa ob vsem, kar počne.
If you describe an activity or situation as alive, you mean that it exists or is functioning well.
Dejavnost ali položaj, ki je alive, obstaja ali deluje dobro.

seg.quote: Theatre outside London is very much alive.

sense.def: If a place is alive with something, a lot of people or things are there and it seems busy or exciting.
Kadar je neki kraj alive with something, je tam navzočih veliko ljudi ali stvari, tako da je videti živahen ali vznemirljiv.

seg.quote: The ditches beside the fields were alive with frogs.

sense.def: If you are alive to a problem or situation, you are aware of it and realize its importance.
Kadar je človek alive to a problem or situation, se tistega problema ali položaja zaveda in pozna njegovo pomembnost.

seg.quote: As you can see, I am fully alive to the problems facing the industry.

sense.def: If a story or description comes alive, it becomes interesting, lively, or realistic.
Kadar zgodba ali opis comes alive, postane zanimiv, živahen ali realističen.
If people or places come alive, they start to be active or lively again.
Kadar ljudje ali kraji come alive, znova postanejo dejavni ali živahni.
An alkali is a substance with a pH value of more than 7.
An alkali je snov, katere pH vrednost je višja od 7.
You use all to indicate that you are referring to the whole of a group or thing.
Z besedo all povemo, da se povedano nanaša na vso skupino ali na celoten predmet.

seg.quote: All the girls think it's great.
They carried all the stuff into the hall.
All of the defendants were proved guilty.
They all live together.
All was quiet in the gaol.

sense.def: You also use all to emphasize the extent to which something happens or is true.
Z besedo all tudi poudarimo obseg, v katerem se nekaj zgodi ali za katerega nekaj velja.

seg.quote: He spilled coffee all over himself.
I'm all alone.

sense.def: You also use all when you are talking about an equal score in a game. For example, if the score is three all, both players or teams have three points.
Besedo all uporabimo, kadar govorimo o neodločenem izidu igre. Na primer: kadar je izid three all, imata oba igralca po tri točke.
You say above all to emphasize that a particular thing is more important than others.
Z izrazom above all poudarimo, da je neka stvar pomembnejša od druge.

seg.quote: Relax, and above all don't panic.

sense.def: You say after all to draw attention to something that other people might have forgotten or that you had not previously realized.
Izraz after all uporabimo, kadar želimo opozoriti na nekaj, kar so drugi morda pozabili ali česar prej nismo opazili.

seg.quote: Could it be true, after all, that money did not bring happiness?

sense.def: You use all in all to introduce a summary or generalization.
Z izrazom all in all uvedemo povzetek ali posplošitev.

seg.quote: All in all, I'm not in favour.
I don't know him all that well.

sense.def: All the more or all the better mean even more or even better than before.
All the more ali all the better pomeni veliko več ali bolje kakor prej.

seg.quote: You must work all the more quickly now.

sense.def: You use at all to emphasize a negative or a question.
Z izrazom at all poudarimo nikalnico ali vprašanje.

seg.quote: We didn't go there at all.
Haven't you got any at all?

sense.def: You use for all to say that a particular fact does not affect or contradict what you are saying, although you know that it may seem to do so.
Z izrazom for all povemo, da določeno dejstvo ne vpliva na tisto ali ne nasprotuje tistemu, kar pripovedujemo, čeprav vemo, da je videti drugače.

seg.quote: For all her sensitivity, she's extremely tough.

sense.def: In all means in total.
In all pomeni v celoti.

seg.quote: There were nine in all.

sense.def: You say in all seriousness or in all honesty to emphasize that you are being completely serious or honest.
Z izrazoma in all seriousness ali in all honesty poudarimo, da mislimo povsem resno ali odkrito.

seg.quote: I say this in all seriousness.

sense.def: You use of all to emphasize the words "first" or "last", or a superlative adjective or adverb.
Z izrazom of all poudarimo besedi first ali last, prislov, ali pa presežnik pridevnika.

seg.quote: I asked them first of all if they were Welsh.
This view is the best of all.

sense.def: Allah is the name of God in Islam.
Allah je ime za boga v islamski veri.
If you allay someone's fears or doubts, they stop feeling afraid or doubtful;
To allay someone's fears or doubts pomeni povzročiti, da se nekdo drug ne boji ali ne dvomi več;
An allegation is a statement suggesting that someone has done something wrong.
An allegation je trditev, s katero namigujemo, da je nekdo storil nekaj slabega.

seg.quote: ...allegations of improper business dealings.

sense.def: If you allege that something is true, you say it but do not prove it.
To allege that something is true pomeni trditi, da je nekaj resnično, čeprav tega ne moremo dokazati.

seg.quote: The reports alleged that the motive was financial.

sense.def: An alleged fact has been stated but not proved to be true.
An alleged fact je izraženo, a nedokazano dejstvo.

seg.quote: ...alleged police brutality.
...the crimes he had allegedly committed.

sense.def: Your allegiance to a group, person, or belief is your support for and loyalty to them.
One's allegiance to a group, person, or belief je človekova podpora ali privrženost tisti skupini, osebi ali prepričanju.

seg.quote: ...their traditional allegiances.

sense.def: An allegorical story, poem, or painting uses allegory.
An allegorical story, poem, or painting je zgodba, pesem ali slika, v kateri je uporabljena alegorija.
An allegory is a story, poem, or painting in which the characters and events are symbols of something else.
An allegory je zgodba, pesem ali slika, v kateri so osebe ali dogodki simboli nečesa drugega.
An allergy is an illness that you have when you eat, smell, or touch a substance which does not normally make people ill.
An allergy je bolezen, ki jo dobimo, kadar jemo, vdihavamo ali se dotaknemo snovi, zaradi katere ljudje navadno ne obolevajo.

seg.quote: He had an allergy to milk.
Are you allergic to dogs?

sense.def: If something alleviates pain or suffering, it makes it less severe.
Kadar nekaj alleviates pain or suffering, zmanjša bolečino ali trpljenje.

seg.quote: ...the alleviation of pain.

sense.def: An alley or alleyway is a narrow path or street.
An alley ali alleyway je ozka pot ali ulica.
An alliance is a relationship in which two or more people or groups work together for some purpose.
An alliance je odnos, pri katerem dva ali več ljudi ali skupin sodeluje z enakim ciljem.
Allied countries, political parties, or other groups are united by a political or military agreement.
Države, politične stranke ali druge skupine, ki so allied, so povezane s političnim ali vojaškim sporazumom.
Allied describes things that are related to other things because they have particular qualities or characteristics in common.
Z besedo allied opisujemo stvari, povezane z drugimi stvarmi zaradi skupnih lastnosti ali značilnosti.

seg.quote: The aircraft and allied industries were nationalized.

sense.def: An alligator is a large animal, similar to a crocodile.
An alligator je velika, krokodilu podobna žival.
If something is allocated to a person or for a purpose, it is given to that person or used for that purpose.
Kadar je nekaj allocated to a person or for a purpose, je dano določeni osebi ali cilju ali uporabljeno v določen namen.

seg.quote: You've been allocated room 426.
...the allocation of responsibilities.

sense.def: If something is allotted to someone, it is given to them as their share.
Kadar je nekaj allotted to someone, je nekomu dano kot delež.

seg.quote: All seats in the Public Gallery are allotted in advance by ticket.
...our allotted sum of money.

sense.def: An allotment is a small area of land which a person rents to grow vegetables on;
An allotment je majhen kos zemljišča, ki ga človek najame, da na njem goji zelenjavo;
An allotment of something is a share of it.
An allotment of something je del tiste stvari.
An all-out attack is aggressive and determined.
Napad, ki je all-out, je grob in silovit.
If you are allowed to do something, it is all right for you to do it.
To be allowed to do something pomeni, da je nekemu človeku omogočeno, da nekaj stori.

seg.quote: He agreed to allow me to take the course.

sense.def: If you are allowed something, you are given permission to have it or are given it.
To be allowed something pomeni dobiti dovoljenje, da tisto vzamemo ali dobimo.

seg.quote: Sometimes, we were allowed a special treat.

sense.def: If you allow something to happen, you do not prevent it.
To allow something to happen pomeni, da tistega dogodka ne preprečimo.

seg.quote: The further this process is allowed to go, the more difficult it will be to reverse it.

sense.def: If something allows a particular thing to happen, it makes it possible.
Kadar nekaj allows a particular thing to happen, omogoči, da se določen dogodek zgodi.

seg.quote: The creatures had warm blood, which allowed them to be active at night.

sense.def: If you allow that something is true, you admit that it is true;
To allow that something is true pomeni priznati, da je nekaj res;

seg.quote: He allowed that even world leaders could make mistakes.

sense.def: If you allow for certain problems or expenses, you include extra time or money in your planning in order to deal with them if they occur.
To allow for certain problems or expenses pomeni vračunati v načrt dodaten čas ali stroške, da jih bomo lahko pokrili, če bo treba.
If something is allowable, it is all right for you to do it.
Kadar je nekaj allowable, tisto človek sme storiti.

seg.quote: ...allowable departures from the norms of behaviour.

sense.def: An allowance is money that is given regularly to someone, to help them pay for things they need.
An allowance je denar, ki ga nekomu redno dajemo, da mu pomagamo plačati tisto, kar potrebuje.
If you make allowances for something, you take it into account in your plans or actions.
To make allowances for something pomeni nekaj upoštevati pri svojih načrtih ali dejanjih.
Someone or something that is all-powerful has a very great deal of power or influence.
Nekdo ali nekaj, kar je all-powerful, ima veliko moč ali vpliv.
If you say that something is all right, you mean that it is satisfactory or acceptable.
Kar je all right, je zadovoljivo ali sprejemljivo.

seg.quote: "Do you like this champagne?"—"It's all right."
He's getting on all right.

sense.def: If someone is all right, they are well or safe.
Kadar je človek all right, je zdrav, nepoškodovan ali na varnem.

seg.quote: Someone should see if she's all right.

sense.def: You say "all right" when you are agreeing to something.
Izraz "all right" uporabimo, kadar v nekaj privolimo.

seg.quote: "Can you help?"—"All right. What do you want me to do?"

sense.def: You also say "all right?" to someone when you are checking that they have understood what you have just said.
All right? rečemo človeku, kadar želimo preveriti, ali je razumel tisto, kar smo pravkar povedali.

seg.quote: If you feel dizzy again put your head in your hands, all right?

sense.def: An all-rounder is someone who has a lot of different skills or is good at many sports;
An all-rounder je človek številnih spretnosti ali tak, ki je dober v več športnih panogah;
If you allude to something, you mention it in an indirect way;
To allude to something pomeni nekaj omeniti samo posredno;

seg.quote: I have already alluded to the energy problem.

sense.def: The allure of something is a pleasing or exciting quality that it has.
The allure of something je prijetna ali vznemirljiva lastnost določene stvari.

seg.quote: ...the allure of foreign travel.

sense.def: Someone or something that is alluring is very attractive.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj alluring, je zelo privlačno.
An allusion to something is an indirect or vague reference to it.
An allusion to something je posredna ali nejasna omemba določene stvari.

seg.quote: ...allusions to Latin and Greek authors.

sense.def: An ally is a country, organization, or person that helps and supports another.
An ally je država, organizacija ali oseba, ki pomaga drugi ali jo podpira.

seg.quote: ...our European allies.

sense.def: If you ally yourself with someone, you support them.
To ally oneself with someone pomeni podpirati tistega človeka.
The Almighty is another name for God.
The Almighty je drugo ime za Boga.

seg.quote: ...the mercy of the Almighty.
...Almighty God.

sense.def: An almighty row, problem, or mistake is a very great or serious one;
Spor, problem ali napaka, ki je almighty, je zelo velika ali resna;

seg.quote: She made the most almighty fuss.

sense.def: An almond is a kind of pale oval nut.
An almond je svetel orešek podolgovate oblike.
Almost means very nearly, but not completely.
Almost pomeni blizu, vendar ne v celoti.

seg.quote: I spent almost a month in China.
He is almost blind.
I had almost forgotten about the trip.
In Oxford Street, you can buy almost anything.

sense.def: Something that is aloft is in the air or off the ground;
Kar je aloft, je v zraku ali nad zemljo;
When you are alone, you are not with any other people.
Kadar je človek alone, z njim ni drugih.

seg.quote: I wanted to be alone.
Barbara spent most of her time alone in the flat.

sense.def: A person who is alone is also someone who has no family or friends.
Kdor je alone, nima sorodnikov ali prijateljev.

seg.quote: I had never felt so alone and without hope in my life.

sense.def: If one person is alone with another, they are together, with nobody else present.
Kadar je človek alone with another, je skupaj še z nekom, ne da bi bil navzoč še kdo tretji.

seg.quote: I was alone with the attendant.
We'd never spent such a long time alone together.

sense.def: If you do something alone, you do it without help from other people.
To do something alone pomeni narediti tisto brez tuje pomoči.

seg.quote: I was left to bring up my two children alone.

sense.def: If you alone do something, you are the only person who does it.
Kadar človek alone does something, tisto stori samo on.

seg.quote: Simon alone knew the truth.

sense.def: If something consists of one idea or feature alone, nothing else is involved.
Kadar nekaj consists of one idea or feature alone, vsebuje le eno idejo ali lastnost.

seg.quote: Pride alone prevented her from giving up.

sense.def: If you move or look along something, you move or look towards one end of it.
To move or look along something pomeni gibati se ali gledati proti enemu koncu tiste stvari.

seg.quote: He was driving along a lane.
She glanced along the corridor.

sense.def: If something is situated along a road, river, or corridor, it is situated in it or beside it.
Kadar je nekaj along a road, river, or corridor, poteka vzdolž ceste, reke ali prehoda.

seg.quote: ...an old house along the Lanark Road.
Room 64 was half way along on the right.

sense.def: When someone or something moves along, they keep moving steadily.
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj moves along, se vztrajno premika.
