seg.quote: I put my arm around him as we walked along.

sense.def: If something is going along in a particular way, it is progressing in that way.
Kadar nekaj is going along na določen način, pomeni, da napreduje na tisti način.

seg.quote: It was going along nicely.

sense.def: If you take someone along when you go somewhere, you take them with you.
To take someone along pomeni nekoga vzeti s seboj, kadar nekam odhajamo.

seg.quote: Why don't you come along too?

sense.def: You use all along to say that something has existed or been the case throughout a period of time.
Z izrazom all along povemo, da je nekaj obstajalo ali bilo resnično v določenem obdobju.

seg.quote: Perhaps they had been mistaken all along.

sense.def: If you do something along with someone else, you both do it. If you take one thing along with another, you take both things.
To do something along with someone else pomeni narediti tisto skupaj z nekom. To take one thing along with another pomeni vzeti obe stvari hkrati.

seg.quote: Along with thousands of others, he fled the country.
The eggs were delivered along with the milk.

sense.def: If something is alongside something else, it is next to it.
Kadar je nekaj alongside something else, leži zraven nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: There was a butcher's shop alongside the theatre.
A car drew up alongside.

sense.def: If you work alongside other people, you are working in the same place and are co-operating with them.
To work alongside other people pomeni delati na istem kraju kot drugi in z njimi sodelovati.

seg.quote: The idea is to get them working on simple things alongside other people.

sense.def: If one thing exists alongside another, the two things are both present in a situation.
Kadar neka stvar exists alongside another, sta v določenih okoliščinah navzoči obe stvari.

seg.quote: I cannot imagine two political systems less likely to live at peace alongside each other.

sense.def: Someone who is aloof likes to be alone and does not talk much.
Kdor je aloof, je rad sam in ne govori veliko.
If you stay aloof from something, you do not become involved with it.
To stay aloof from something pomeni, da se v tisto ne vmešavamo.
When you speak or read aloud, you speak so that other people can hear you.
Kadar govorimo ali beremo aloud, govorimo tako, da nas drugi slišijo.

seg.quote: She read aloud to us from the newspaper.

sense.def: The alphabet is the set of letters in a fixed order which is used for writing the words of a language.
The alphabet je določeno zaporedje črk, ki jih uporabljamo za pisanje besed nekega jezika.
Alphabetical means arranged according to the normal order of the letters in the alphabet.
Alphabetical pomeni urejen po običajnem zaporedju črk v abecedi.

seg.quote: ...an alphabetical list.

sense.def: Alpine means existing in or relating to mountains.
Alpine pomeni tak, ki obstaja ali je povezan z gorami.

seg.quote: ...alpine meadows.

sense.def: If something has already happened, it has happened before the present time.
Kadar nekaj has already happened, se je že zgodilo.

seg.quote: I've had tea already, thank you.

sense.def: You also use already to indicate that something happened earlier than expected.
Besedo already uporabljamo tudi, kadar hočemo povedati, da se je nekaj zgodilo prej, kot smo pričakovali.

seg.quote: By the time he got home, Julie was already in bed.

sense.def: You use also when you are giving more information about a person or thing.
Besedo also uporabimo, kadar dajemo dodatne podatke o neki osebi ali stvari.

seg.quote: Tony Nuttall is Vice-Chancellor and also a Professor of English at Sussex.
...also available in blue and green.

sense.def: You can use also to say that the same fact applies to someone or something else.
Z besedo also lahko tudi povemo, da določen podatek velja še za nekoga ali nekaj drugega.

seg.quote: His first wife was also called Margaret.

sense.def: An altar is a holy table in a church or temple.
An altar je posvečen predmet v cerkvi ali svetišču.
If something alters or if you alter it, it changes.
Kadar nekaj alters ali če človek alters something, se tisto predrugači.

seg.quote: The weather could alter violently.
America must radically alter its economic policy.
It is not possible to make major alterations to existing arrangements.

sense.def: When you alternate between two things, you regularly do or use one thing and then the other.
Kadar človek alternates between two things, redno počne ali uporablja najprej prvo in potem drugo stvar.

seg.quote: They alternated between patronising us and ignoring us.

sense.def: When one thing alternates with another, the two things regularly occur in turn.
Kadar ena stvar alternates with another, se obe stvari redno dogajata druga za drugo.

seg.quote: The Third World suffers from an annual cycle of drought alternating with flood.
...an alternation of right-wing and left-wing governments.

sense.def: Alternate actions, events, or processes regularly occur after each other.
Dejanja, dogodki ali postopki, ki so alternate, se redno dogajajo drug za drugim.

seg.quote: ...the alternate contraction and relaxation of muscles.
Each piece of material is washed alternately in soft water and coconut oil.

sense.def: If something happens on alternate days, it happens on one day, then does not happen on the next day, then happens again on the day after it, and so on. In the same way, something can happen in alternate weeks or years.

Kadar se nekaj dogaja on alternate days, se na en dan zgodi, naslednji dan ne, potem se spet zgodi in tako naprej. Podobno se nekaj lahko dogaja in alternate weeks, torej v tednih, ali in alternate years, v letih.

seg.quote: We saw each other on alternate Sunday nights.

sense.def: An alternative is something that can exist or you can do instead of something else.
An alternative je nekaj, kar obstaja ali kar lahko storimo namesto nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: Are there alternatives to prison?
But still people try to find alternative explanations.

sense.def: Alternative is also used to describe something that is different from the usual things of its kind, especially when it is simpler or more natural, or not part of the establishment.
Besedo alternative uporabljamo tudi za opisovanje nečesa, kar je drugačno od navadnih primerkov svoje vrste, zlasti kadar je preprostejše, naravnejše ali ne sodi k ustaljeni praksi.

seg.quote: ...sources of alternative energy.

sense.def: You use alternatively to suggest or mention something different from what has just been mentioned.
Z besedo alternatively omenimo ali namignemo na nekaj, kar je drugačno od prej omenjenega.

seg.quote: Alternatively, you can use household bleach.

sense.def: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement that makes the main clause seem surprising.
Z besedo although začnemo odvisni stavek; v njem navedemo trditev, zaradi katere je glavni stavek videti presenetljiv.

seg.quote: Although he was late he stopped to buy a sandwich.
Gretchen kept her coat on, although it was warm in the room.

sense.def: Although also introduces a subordinate clause, often containing "not", that modifies the main clause and corrects a wrong impression that someone might get from it.
Z besedo although začnemo tudi odvisni stavek, ki pogosto vsebuje nikalnico not in spreminja pomen glavnega stavka ter popravi zgrešen vtis, ki bi ga morda lahko dobili.

seg.quote: I have a lot of my grandfather's features, although I'm not so tall as he was.

sense.def: If something is at a particular altitude, it is at that height above sea level.
Kadar je nekaj at a particular altitude, je na določeni višini nad morsko gladino.

seg.quote: ...flying at high altitude.

sense.def: An alto is a woman with a low singing voice.
An alto je ženska, ki poje z nizkim glasom.
An alto musical instrument has a range of musical notes of medium pitch.
Glasbeni inštrument, ki je alto, lahko oddaja tone srednje višine.
If something stops altogether, it stops completely.
Kadar nekaj stops altogether, povsem preneha.

seg.quote: He abandoned his work altogether.

sense.def: If one thing is altogether different from another, the two things are completely different.
Kadar je nekaj altogether different from another, je oboje povsem različno.

seg.quote: ...an altogether different kind of support.

sense.def: You can use altogether to summarize something you have been talking about.
Z besedo altogether povzamemo tisto, o čemer smo govorili.

seg.quote: Yes, it's quite a pleasant place altogether.

sense.def: You also use altogether to indicate that the amount you are mentioning is a total.
Z besedo altogether tudi povemo, da je količina, o kateri govorimo, celotna.

seg.quote: Altogether, he played in 44 matches.

sense.def: Altruism is unselfish concern for other people's happiness and welfare.
Altruism je nesebična skrb za srečo in blaginjo drugih.
Altruistic means unselfish and concerned for other people's happiness and welfare.
Altruistic pomeni nesebičen in v skrbi za srečo in blaginjo drugih.

seg.quote: My invitation was not completely altruistic.

sense.def: Aluminium is a lightweight metal used for making things such as cooking equipment and aircraft parts.
Aluminium je lahka kovina, iz katere izdelujejo na primer kuhinjsko posodo in letalske dele.
If you always do a particular thing, you do it all the time.
Če človek always naredi določeno stvar, to počenja ves čas.

seg.quote: I shall always love you.

sense.def: If something is always the case, it is the case all the time.
Kadar je nekaj always tako, je tako ves čas.

seg.quote: I had always been poor.

sense.def: If you say that someone can always take a particular course of action, you mean that they can try it if all other methods are unsuccessful.
Kadar nekdo can always ravna na določen način, lahko poskusi tako, če so vsi drugi načini neuspešni.

seg.quote: Oh well, I can always come back later.

sense.def: Am is the first person singular of the present tense of be.
Am je prva oseba ednine sedanjega časa pomožnega glagola to be.
a.m. after a number indicates that the number refers to a particular time between midnight and noon.
a.m. za številko pomeni, da se številka nanaša na natančno določen čas med polnočjo in poldnevom.
When two or more organizations amalgamate or are amalgamated, they become one large organization.
Kadar dve ali več organizacij amalgamate ali are amalgamated, postanejo ena sama velika organizacija.

seg.quote: ...the Variety Artists Federation, which has since amalgamated with Equity.
...the amalgamation of several large businesses.

sense.def: If you amass something such as money, you gradually get a lot of it.
To amass something, na primer denar, pomeni postopoma dobiti veliko tiste stvari.
An amateur is someone who does something as a hobby, not as a job.
An amateur je človek, ki nekaj počne iz veselja, za konjiček in ne za službo.

seg.quote: ...a good amateur viola player.

sense.def: Amateur can also mean the same as amateurish.
Amateur lahko pomeni tudi isto kot amateurish.
If you describe something as amateurish, you mean it is not skilfully made or done.
Kar je amateurish, ni narejeno ali opravljeno spretno.
If something amazes you, it surprises you very much.
Kadar nekaj amazes someone, človeka močno preseneti.

seg.quote: She was amazed that I was only twenty.
I saw her amazed look.

sense.def: Amazement is what you feel if you are very surprised by something.
Amazement je tisto, kar občutimo, kadar nas nekaj močno preseneti.

seg.quote: Her eyes were wide with amazement.

sense.def: If something is amazing, it is very surprising and makes you feel pleasure or admiration.
Kadar je nekaj amazing, je zelo presenetljivo in nam vzbudi občutek zadovoljstva ali občudovanja.

seg.quote: New York is an amazing city.
Our holiday was amazingly cheap.

sense.def: An ambassador is an important official living in a foreign country who represents his or her government.
An ambassador je pomemben uradnik, ki živi v neki tuji državi in zastopa svojo vlado.
Amber is a hard yellowish-brown substance used for making jewellery.
Amber je trda rumenkasto rjava snov, iz katere izdelujejo nakit.
Something that is amber in colour is orange or yellowish-brown.
Kadar je nekaj amber, je rumenkasto rjave barve.
The ambience of a place is its character and atmosphere;
The ambience of a place je značaj in razpoloženje nekega kraja;
You say that there is ambiguity when something can be understood in more than one way.
Kadar o nečem vlada ambiguity, je tisto mogoče razumeti na več kot en način.

seg.quote: ...a speech which was a masterpiece of ambiguity.

sense.def: Something that is ambiguous can be understood in more than one way.
Kar je ambiguous, lahko razumemo na več kot en način.

seg.quote: There was nothing ambiguous in the message.
The announcement was ambiguously worded.

sense.def: If you have an ambition to achieve something, you want very much to achieve it.
To have an ambition, da bi nekaj dosegli, pomeni, da si tisto zelo močno želimo doseči.

seg.quote: Her ambition was to be a teacher.

sense.def: If someone has ambition or ambitions, they want to be successful, rich, or powerful.
Kadar ima človek ambition ali ambitions, želi biti uspešen, bogat ali vpliven.

seg.quote: ...men of energy and ambition.

sense.def: Someone who is ambitious wants to be successful, rich, or powerful.
Kdor je ambitious, si želi biti uspešen, bogat ali vpliven.
An ambitious idea or plan is on a large scale and needs a lot of work to be successful.
Zamisel ali načrt, ki je ambitious, je obsežen in zahteva veliko dela, če hočemo, da bo uspešen.
If you are ambivalent about something, you have opposing feelings about it.
Kadar je človek ambivalent about something, ima do nečesa nasprotujoča si čustva.

seg.quote: ...an ambivalent attitude towards women.

sense.def: When you amble, you walk slowly and in a relaxed manner.
Kadar človek ambles, hodi počasi in sproščeno.

seg.quote: I ambled home through the village.

sense.def: An ambulance is a vehicle for taking people to and from hospital.
An ambulance je vozilo, s katerim vozimo ljudi v bolnišnico in iz nje.
If people ambush their enemies, they attack them after hiding and waiting for them.
Kadar ljudje ambush their enemies, se skrijejo, počakajo svoje sovražnike in šele potem napadejo.

seg.quote: Weyler's troops successfully ambushed a rebel force.
A whole battalion got caught in an ambush.

sense.def: Amen is said or sung by Christians at the end of a prayer.
Amen rečejo ali zapojejo kristjani ob koncu molitve.
If you are amenable to something, you are willing to do or accept it.
Kadar je človek amenable to something, je pripravljen nekaj storiti ali sprejeti.
If you amend something that has been written or said, you change it.
To amend something, kar je bilo zapisano ali izrečeno, pomeni tisto spremeniti.

seg.quote: Last year the regulations were amended to allow other awards to be made.

sense.def: If you make amends when you have harmed someone, you show you are sorry by doing something to please them.
To make amends, potem ko smo nekoga oškodovali, pomeni storiti nekaj, kar oškodovancu ugaja, da bi tako pokazali, da nam je žal.

cit.quote: odkupiti se za nekaj, poravnati, opravičiti se

sense.def: An amendment is a section that is added to a law or rule in order to change it.
An amendment je člen, dodan zakonu ali pravilu z namenom, da ju spremeni.

seg.quote: ...amendments to the Industrial Relations Bill.

sense.def: An amendment is also a correction to a piece of writing.
An amendment je tudi popravek nečesa, kar je napisano.

seg.quote: She made a few amendments to the letter.

sense.def: An amenity is something such as a shopping centre or sports facility that is provided for people's convenience or enjoyment.
An amenity je kraj ali prostor, ki je namenjen zabavi ali zadovoljevanju nekaterih človekovih potreb.
American means belonging or relating to the United States of America.
American je tak, ki pripada Združenim državam Amerike ali je povezan z njimi.
An American is a person who comes from the United States of America.
An American je oseba, ki je po rodu iz Združenih držav Amerike.
American also means belonging or relating to North, Central or South America.
American je tudi tak, ki pripada Srednji ali Južni Ameriki ali je povezan z njima.

seg.quote: ...the white man's treatment of the American Indian.
...the livelihoods of several Central American and South American states.

sense.def: Someone who is amiable is friendly and pleasant.
Kdor je amiable, je prijateljski in ljubezniv.

seg.quote: ...her amiable manner.
He chatted amiably with Dorothy.

sense.def: When people have an amicable relationship, they are pleasant to each other and solve their problems without quarrelling.
Kadar je odnos med ljudmi amicable, so ljubeznivi drug do drugega in rešujejo medsebojne težave brez sporov.

seg.quote: We hope to settle the dispute in an amicable way.
They parted amicably.

sense.def: If something happens amid other things, it happens while the other things are happening.
Kadar se nekaj zgodi amid other things, se zgodi, medtem ko se dogaja nekaj drugega.

seg.quote: Suddenly, amid the cries, I heard some words.

sense.def: If something is amid other things, it is surrounded by them;
Kadar je nekaj amid other things, to stvar obkrožajo druge stvari;

seg.quote: Tombstones stood amid the swaying grass.

sense.def: Amidst means the same as amid.
Amidst pomeni isto kot amid.
If you say that something is amiss, you mean there is something wrong.
Kadar je nekaj amiss, je pri tistem nekaj slabega.

seg.quote: I immediately sensed something amiss.

sense.def: If someone takes a remark amiss, they are offended and upset by it.
Kadar človek takes a remark amiss, ga neka pripomba užali in razburi.

seg.quote: You mustn't take anything I say amiss.

sense.def: If you say that something would not come amiss, you mean it would be welcome and useful.
Kadar rečemo something would not come amiss, hočemo povedati, da bi bilo nekaj dobrodošlo in koristno.

seg.quote: A little calm wouldn't come amiss.

sense.def: Ammonia is a colourless liquid or gas with a strong, sharp smell. It is used in making household cleaning substances.
Ammonia je brezbarvna tekočina ali plin z močnim, ostrim vonjem; uporablja se za izdelavo gospodinjskih čistil.
Ammunition is bullets and rockets that are made to be fired from guns ali pištolami.
Ammunition so krogle in rakete, namenjene streljanju s puškami.
Ammunition can also refer to information that may be used against someone.
Beseda ammunition se lahko nanaša tudi na podatke, ki jih lahko uporabimo proti nekemu človeku.

seg.quote: The letters might be used as ammunition by reactionary groups.

sense.def: If someone is suffering from amnesia, they have lost their memory.
Kadar človek suffers from amnesia, je izgubil spomin.
An amnesty is an official pardon granted to a prisoner by the state.
An amnesty je uradna pomilostitev državnega zapornika.
An amnesty is also a period of time during which people can confess to a crime or give up weapons without being punished.
An amnesty je tudi obdobje, v katerem človek lahko prizna zločin ali izroči orožje, ne da bi bil kaznovan.
A person or thing that is among a group of people or things is surrounded by them.
Osebo ali predmet, ki je among a group of people or things, obkroža skupina ljudi ali predmetov.

seg.quote: We stood there among piles of wooden boxes.

sense.def: If you are among a group of people, you are in their company.
Kadar je človek among a group of people, je v družbi drugih.

seg.quote: I was among friends.

sense.def: If you say that one person among others did something, you are saying that other people also did it, and not just that one person.
Kadar rečemo, da je neka oseba naredila nekaj among others, hočemo povedati, da so tisto storili tudi drugi in ne le ona.

seg.quote: Bluestone, among other union leaders, argued against a strike.

sense.def: If an opinion, or state exists among a group of people, they have it or experience it.
Kadar vlada mnenje ali stanje among a group of people, velja za skupino ljudi, ki ga imajo ali ga doživljajo.

seg.quote: He has always been popular among MPs.

sense.def: If something is divided among three or more people, they all get a part of it.
Kadar je nekaj razdeljeno among three or more people, vsaka od treh ali več oseb dobi svoj del.
Amongst means the same as among.
Amongst pomeni isto kot among .

seg.quote: They sat amongst monstrous cans of tomato soup.

sense.def: Someone who is amoral does not care whether what they do is right or wrong;
Kdor je amoral, mu je vseeno, ali je tisto, kar počne, prav ali narobe;
Amorous feelings and behaviour involve sexual desire.
Čustva ali vedênje, ki so amorous, kažejo spolno poželenje.
Something that is amorphous has no clear shape or structure.
Kar je amorphous, nima jasne oblike ali ustroja.
An amount of something is how much of it you have, need, or get.
An amount of something pove, koliko tistega imamo, potrebujemo ali dobimo.

seg.quote: ...the amount of potatoes that people buy.
I was horrified by the amount of work I had to do.

sense.def: If something amounts to a particular total, all the parts of it add up to that total.
Kadar nekaj amounts to a particular total, vsi sestavni deli pripomorejo k celoti.

seg.quote: ...very high fees which amount to £2,000.

sense.def: An amphibian is an animal such as a frog that can live both on land and in water.
An amphibian je žival, na primer žaba, ki lahko živi tako na kopnem kot v vodi.
An amphibious animal can live both on land and in water.
Žival, ki je amphibious, lahko živi tako na kopnem kot v vodi.
If there is an ample amount of something, there is enough of it and some extra.
Kadar imamo an ample amount of something, imamo nečesa dovolj in še malo več.

seg.quote: This leaves her ample time to prepare.
This has been amply demonstrated over the past few years.

sense.def: Ample also means large.
Ample pomeni tudi velik.

seg.quote: There was provision for an ample lawn.

sense.def: An amplifier is an electronic device in a radio or stereo system, which causes sounds or signals to become louder.
An amplifier je eletronski del v radijski ali stereo napravi; omogoča, da zvoki ali signali postanejo glasnejši.
If you amplify a sound, you make it louder.
To amplify a sound pomeni, da neki zvok naredimo glasnejši.

seg.quote: These signals are then amplified.

sense.def: If you amplify an idea, statement, or piece of writing, you explain it more fully.
To amplify an idea, statement, or piece of writing pomeni podrobneje razložiti neko idejo, izjavo ali pisanje.

seg.quote: His story needed confirmation and amplification.

sense.def: To amputate someone's arm or leg means to cut it off.
To amputate someone's arm or leg pomeni, da nekomu odrežemo roko ali nogo.

seg.quote: They had to amputate his leg.
Punishment for a thief was amputation of a hand.

sense.def: If something amuses you, it makes you want to laugh or smile.
Kadar nekaj amuses someone, se človek tistemu želi nasmehniti ali zasmejati.

seg.quote: He laughed as if the idea amused him.
I was highly amused by a comment Shaw made.

gramGrp.pos: REFL VB or VB with OBJ

sense.def: If you amuse yourself, or if someone amuses you, you do something in order to pass the time and not become bored.
To amuse oneself ali to amuse someone pomeni početi nekaj, da nam ali drugemu človeku čas mine in ni dolgčas.

seg.quote: Sam amused himself by throwing branches into the fire.

sense.def: Amusement is the feeling that you have when you think that something is funny.
Amusement je naše občutje ob misli, da je nekaj smešno.

seg.quote: She smiled in amusement.

sense.def: Amusement is the pleasure that you get from being entertained or from doing something interesting.
Amusement je užitek, ki ga občutimo, ko se zabavamo ali počnemo nekaj zanimivega.

seg.quote: Every kind of facility was laid on for their amusement.

sense.def: Amusements are ways of passing the time pleasantly.
Amusements so prijetni načini preživljanja časa.

seg.quote: What amusements have you found to keep a young boy out of mischief?

sense.def: Amusements are the games, rides, and other things that you can enjoy at a fairground or holiday resort.
Amusements so igre, vožnje in druga razvedrila, ob katerih lahko uživamo na sejmišču ali v letovišču.
Someone or something that is amusing makes you laugh or smile.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj amusing, nam izvabi nasmeh ali smeh.

seg.quote: There was an amusing story in the paper.
He talked lightly and amusingly.

sense.def: An is used instead of "a", the indefinite article, in front of words that begin with vowel sounds: see a.
An uporabljamo namesto nedoločnega člena a pred besedami, ki se začnejo s samoglasnikom: glej a.

cit.quote: en, ena, eno; neki, neka, neko

sense.def: You say that something is an anachronism when you think that it is old-fashioned.
Kadar rečemo, da je nekaj an anachronism, hočemo povedati, da je zastarelo.

seg.quote: The English public schools are an anachronism.
...a peculiarly anachronistic view of communism.

sense.def: If you have anaemia, you have too few red cells in your blood, so that you feel tired and look pale.
To have anaemia pomeni, da imamo v krvi premalo rdečih krvničk, zato smo utrujeni in bledi.
Someone who is anaemic suffers from anaemia.
Kdor je anaemic, ima anemijo.
An anaesthetic is a drug that stops you feeling pain, particularly during an operation.
An anaesthetic je snov, ki nam prežene bolečino, zlasti med operacijo.
An anaesthetist is a doctor who specializes in giving anaesthetics.
An anaesthetist je zdravnik specialist za dajanje anestezije.
To anaesthetize someone means to make them unconscious by giving them an anaesthetic.
To anaesthetize someone pomeni, da pri nekom z anestetikom povzročimo nezavest.
Anal means relating to the anus.
Anal pomeni povezan z zadnjikom.
If one thing is analogous to another, the two things are similar in some way.
Kadar je ena stvar analogous to another, obe v določenem pogledu spominjata druga na drugo.
If you make or draw an analogy between two things, you show that they are similar.
To make or draw an analogy med dvema stvarema pomeni pokazati, da sta sorodni.

seg.quote: He made an analogy between parental and judicial discipline.

sense.def: If you explain something by analogy, you explain it by describing something else that is similar.
To explain something by analogy pomeni, da tisto razložimo z opisovanjem nečesa drugega, sorodnega.

seg.quote: The models are meant to show, by analogy, how matter is built up.

sense.def: If you analyse something, you consider it or examine it in order to understand it or to find out what it consists of.
To analyse something pomeni tisto premisliti ali preučiti, da bi razumeli ali ugotovili, iz česa sestoji.
Analysis is the process of considering something in order to understand it or to find out what it consists of.
Analysis je postopek razmišljanja o nečem, da bi tisto razumeli ali ugotovili, iz česa je.

seg.quote: ...linguistic analysis.

sense.def: An analysis is an explanation that is the result of considering something.
An analysis je razlaga, ki je posledica razmišljanja o nečem.

seg.quote: He offers a calm analysis of the situation.

sense.def: You say in the final analysis or in the last analysis to indicate that the statement you are making is about the basic facts of a situation.
Z izrazom in the final analysis ali in the last analysis povemo, da naša izjava velja za osnovna dejstva v določenih okoliščinah.

seg.quote: In the final analysis power rested in the hands of one man.

sense.def: An analyst is a person whose job is to analyse a subject and give opinions about it.
An analyst je človek, čigar naloga je, da neko témo razčleni in prestavi svoje mnenje o njej.
An analyst is also someone who examines and treats people who are emotionally disturbed.
An analyst je tudi človek, ki pregleduje in zdravi čustveno motene ljudi.
Analytic means using logical reasoning.
Analytic pomeni v skladu z logičnim razmišljanjem.

seg.quote: ...an analytic process.

sense.def: Analytical means the same as analytic.
Analytical pomeni isto kot analytic.
Anarchism is the belief that the laws and power of governments should be replaced by people working together freely.
Anarchism je nazor ali gibanje, ki ne priznava avtoritete in družbene ureditve.

seg.quote: Anarchists oppose the organised violence of war.

sense.def: Anarchy is a situation where nobody obeys rules or laws;
Anarchy je položaj, v katerem se nihče ne drži pravil ali zakonov.

seg.quote: ...his will to reverse the drift into anarchy and economic chaos.
The system is economically inefficient and politically anarchic.

sense.def: Anatomical means relating to the structure of the bodies of people and animals.
Anatomical pomeni povezan z ustrojem človeškega in živalskega telesa.
Anatomy is the study of the structure of the bodies of people or animals.
Anatomy je preučevanje ustroja človeškega ali živalskega telesa.
An animal's anatomy is the structure of its body.
An animal's anatomy je ustroj živalskega telesa.

-ance and -ancy are added to adjectives, usually in place of "-ant", to form nouns. These nouns usually refer to states, qualities, or behaviour. Nouns of this kind are often not defined but are treated with the related adjectives.

Priponi -ance in -ancy dodamo pridevnikom, navadno namesto -ant, da nastanejo samostalniki. Ti se navadno nanašajo na stanje, lastnost ali vedênje. Takih samostalnikov v tem slovarju ponavadi ne razlagamo, temveč jih obravnavamo pri ustreznih pridevnikih.

seg.quote: ...his academic brilliance.
...the buoyancy of the economy.

sense.def: Your ancestors are the people from whom you are descended.
One's ancestors so ljudje, katerih potomec je tisti človek.
An ancestor of something modern is an earlier thing from which it developed.
An ancestor of something modern je predhodna oblika, iz katere se je razvilo nekaj sodobnega.

seg.quote: These creatures are the ancestors of modern man.

sense.def: Ancestral means relating to your family in former times.
Ancestral pomeni povezan s človekovo družino v preteklosti.
Your ancestry is the people from whom you are descended.
One's ancestry so ljudje, katerih potomec je tisti človek.

seg.quote: ...American citizens of Japanese ancestry.

sense.def: An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain to make the boat stay in one place.
An anchor je težak predmet s kavlji, ki ga na verigi spustimo v morje, da ladja ostane na istem mestu.
When a boat anchors or when you anchor it, its anchor is dropped into the water to make it stay in one place.
Kadar čoln anchors ali kadar človek anchors a boat pomeni, da spustimo sidro v vodo, da čoln ostane na istem mestu.
If you anchor an object, you prevent it from moving by, for example, tying it down.
To anchor an object pomeni preprečiti, da bi se neki predmet premikal, tako da ga, na primer, privežemo.

seg.quote: We anchored his wheelchair to a huge stone.

sense.def: You use ancient to describe things that belong to the distant past.
Z besedo ancient opisujemo stvari iz daljne preteklosti.

seg.quote: ...ancient Greece and Rome.

sense.def: You also use ancient to describe things that are very old or that have a long history.
Z besedo ancient opisujemo tudi predmete, ki so zelo stari ali imajo dolgo zgodovino.

seg.quote: He came from an ancient Catholic family.

sense.def: The ancillary workers in an institution are the people such as the cleaners, whose work supports the main work of the institution.
Delavci, ki so ancillary, v nekem podjetju s svojim delom podpirajo glavno dejavnost; mednje sodijo na primer čistilci.
You use and to link two or more words, groups, or clauses.
Z besedo and povežemo dve ali več besed, fraz ali odvisnikov.

seg.quote: ...my mother and father.
I came here in 1972 and have lived here ever since.

sense.def: You also use and to link two identical words or phrases to emphasize their degree or to suggest that something continues or increases over a period of time.
Z besedo and povežemo tudi dve enaki besedi ali zvezi, da poudarimo stopnjevanje ali namignemo, da se nekaj v določenem obdobju nadaljuje ali poveča.

seg.quote: He became more and more annoyed.

sense.def: And indicates that two numbers are to be added together.
Beseda and pove, da moramo obe števili sešteti.

seg.quote: Two and two is four.

sense.def: And links two statements about events which follow each other.
Beseda and povezuje izjavi o dveh zaporednih dogodkih.

seg.quote: He opened the car door and got out.

sense.def: You also use and to interrupt yourself in order to make a comment on what you are saying.
Besedo and uporabimo, da prekinemo svojo pripoved in vrinemo pripombo k tistemu, kar pripovedujemo.

seg.quote: Finally—and I really ought to stop in a minute—I wish to tell a little story.

sense.def: You use and in some numbers.
Besedo and uporabljamo v nekaterih številih.

seg.quote: ...three hundred and fifty people.

sense.def: Anecdotal speech or writing is full of anecdotes or is based on anecdotes.
Govor ali zapis, ki je anecdotal, je poln anekdot ali na njih temelji.

seg.quote: ...anecdotal evidence.

sense.def: An anecdote is a short, entertaining account of something that has happened.
An anecdote je kratka, zabavna zgodba o nečem, kar se je zgodilo.

seg.quote: She told him anecdotes about the hospital and the patients.

sense.def: If you do something anew, you do it again, often in a different way;
To do something anew pomeni, da tisto naredimo znova, pogosto ali drugače;

seg.quote: ...starting life anew in a fresh place.

sense.def: Angels are spiritual beings that some people believe are God's messengers and servants in heaven.
Angels so duhovna bitja, ki so po prepričanju nekaterih ljudi božji sli in služabniki v nebesih.
You can describe someone as angelic when they are very good, kind, and gentle.
Kadar za nekoga rečemo, da je angelic, se nam zdi zelo dober, ljubezniv in mil.
Anger is the strong emotion that you feel when you think someone has behaved in such an unfair, cruel, or insulting way that you want to express your feelings towards them in a forceful way.
Anger je močno čustvo, ki ga občutimo, kadar mislimo, da se je nekdo vedel tako krivično, kruto ali žaljivo, da mu želimo odločno pokazati svoja čustva.

seg.quote: "You're a fool."—žAm I?" he said, red with anger.

sense.def: If someone or something angers you, they make you angry.
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj angers somebody, ga spravi v jezo.

seg.quote: His hostile attitude angered her.

sense.def: An angle is the difference in direction between two lines or surfaces. Angles are measured in degrees.
An angle je razlika v smeri dveh črt ali ploskev; merimo jo v stopinjah.
An angle is the shape that is created where two lines or surfaces join together.
An angle je oblika, ki nastane, kadar se dotakneta dve črti ali ploskvi.
An angle is the direction from which you look at something.
An angle je smer, iz katere nekaj gledamo.

seg.quote: He held the vase close to his face, peering at it from all angles.

sense.def: You can refer to a way of presenting something, for example in a newspaper, as a particular angle.
Način predstavitve nečesa, na primer v časopisu, lahko opišemo kot določeni angle.

seg.quote: The play's pacifist angle had a great appeal.

sense.def: If you angle for something, you try to make someone offer it to you without asking for it directly.
To angle for something pomeni poskusiti nekoga pripraviti do tega, da nam tisto ponudi, ne da bi ga prosili naravnost.

seg.quote: He got the invitation to Washington he had been angling for.

sense.def: An angler is someone who fishes with a fishing rod as a hobby.
An angler je človek, ki ljubiteljsko lovi ribe z ribiško palico.
Angling is the activity of fishing with a fishing rod.
Angling je lovljenje rib z ribiško palico in trnkom.
Anglo- is added to adjectives indicating nationality to form adjectives describing something which involves relations between Britain and another country.
Anglo- dodajamo pridevnikom, ki označujejo narodnost, in tako tvorimo pridevnike, s katerimi opisujemo nekaj, kar je povezano z odnosi med Veliko Britanijo in kakšno drugo državo.

seg.quote: ...the 1921 Anglo-Irish treaty.

sense.def: When you are angry, you feel strong emotion about something that you consider unfair, cruel, or insulting.
Kadar je človek angry, ima silovita čustva o nečem, kar se mu zdi krivično, kruto ali žaljivo.

seg.quote: He was angry at Sally for accusing him.
The story was angrily denied by the dead man's family.

sense.def: Anguish is great mental or physical suffering.
Anguish je huda duševna ali telesna bolečina.

seg.quote: ...a quarrel which caused her intense unhappiness and anguish.

sense.def: Anguished means feeling or showing great mental or physical suffering.
Kdor je anguished, čuti ali kaže veliko duševno ali telesno bolečino.

seg.quote: The anguished cries continued.

sense.def: Angular things have shapes that seem to contain a lot of straight lines and sharp points.
Kar je angular, ima obliko, za katero so značilne ravne linije in ostri koti.

seg.quote: ...his angular face.

sense.def: An animal is a living creature such as a dog, or horse, rather than a bird, fish, insect, or human.
An animal je živo bitje, na primer pes ali konj, v primerjavi s pticami, ribami, žuželkami ali človekom.

seg.quote: They used to hunt wild animals.

sense.def: An animal is also any living thing that is not a plant, including people.
An animal je tudi vsako živo bitje, ki ni rastlina, tudi človek.

seg.quote: Man is a very weak animal.
...the animal kingdom.

sense.def: Animal qualities or feelings relate to your physical nature and instincts rather than your mind.
Lastnosti ali čustva, ki so animal, so povezana s telesnostjo in nagoni, ne pa z mišljenjem.

seg.quote: Animal instinct warned me to tread carefully.

sense.def: Something that is animate has life, in contrast to things like stones and machines which do not.
Kar je animate, ima v sebi življenje, v nasprotju s predmeti, kot so kamni ali stroji, ki ga nimajo.
Someone or something that is animated is lively and interesting.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj animated, je živo in zanimivo.

seg.quote: The conversation was animated.

sense.def: An animated film has been filmed by means of animation.
Film, ki je animated, je posnet z animacijo.

seg.quote: ...an animated cartoon.

sense.def: Animation is the process of making films in which drawings or puppets appear to move.
Animation je postopek snemanja filmov, pri katerem je videti, kot da se premikajo risbe ali lutke.
Someone with animation behaves in a lively way.
Človek, za katerega je značilna animation, se vede živahno.
Animosity is a feeling of strong dislike and anger.
Animosity je občutek močnega odpora in jeze.
Your ankle is the joint where your foot joins your leg.
One's ankle je sklep, ki veže stopalo z golenjo.
An annex is a building which is joined to or is next to a larger main building.
An annex je stavba, dodana večji glavni stavbi ali postavljena poleg nje.
If a country annexes another country or an area of land, it seizes it and takes control of it.
Kadar neka država annexes another country or an area of land, zavzame drugo državo ali pokrajino in v njej prevzame oblast.

seg.quote: ...the annexation of Hawaii.

sense.def: If something is annihilated, it is destroyed completely.
Kadar je nekaj annihilated, je popolnoma razdejano.

seg.quote: What would happen if the human race should be annihilated?
...threatening the total annihilation of the planet.

sense.def: An anniversary is a date which is remembered or celebrated because a special event happened on that date in a previous year.
An anniversary je datum, ki se ga spominjamo in ga praznujemo, ker se je v enem od prejšnjih let na isti dan nekaj zgodilo.

seg.quote: ...his wedding anniversary.

sense.def: If you announce something, you tell people about it publicly or officially.
To announce something pomeni javno in uradno obvestiti ljudi o tisti stvari.

seg.quote: Mr Heath announced his decision.

sense.def: If you announce something, you say it in a deliberate and rather aggressive way.
To announce something pomeni tisto povedati odločno in precej napadalno.

seg.quote: "I am Mrs Jones," she announced.

sense.def: An announcement is a public statement which gives information about something that has or will happen.
An announcement je javna izjava, ki vsebuje podatke o nečem, kar se je ali se bo zgodilo.

seg.quote: The Government announcement gave details of small increases in taxes.

sense.def: The announcement of something is the act of telling people about it.
The announcement of something je obveščanje ljudi o neki stvari.

seg.quote: ...the events which follow the announcement of your resignation.

sense.def: An announcer is someone who introduces programmes on radio or television.
An announcer je oseba, ki napoveduje oddaje na radiu ali televiziji.
If someone annoys you, they make you fairly angry and impatient.
Kadar človek annoys someone, v tistem človeku izzove jezo in nepotrpežljivost.

seg.quote: You're just saying that to annoy me.

sense.def: Annoyance is the feeling that you get when someone annoys you.
Annoyance je občutek, ki ga imamo, ko nas nekdo nadleguje.
If you are annoyed, you are fairly angry about something.
To be annoyed pomeni biti zaradi nečesa precej slabe volje.

seg.quote: She shook her head, annoyed with herself for forgetting.

sense.def: An annoying person or action makes you feel fairly angry and impatient.
Oseba ali dejanje, ki je annoying, v človeku izzove jezo ali neučakanost.

seg.quote: It was annoying to be corrected by him all the time.

sense.def: Annual means happening or done once every year.
Annual pomeni tak, ki se dogaja ali opravi enkrat na leto.

seg.quote: ...her annual holiday.
Independence day is celebrated annually.

sense.def: Annual means calculated over a period of one year.
Annual pomeni preračunan za obdobje enega leta.

seg.quote: ...an annual income of twelve thousand dollars.
They import 500 million tonnes of crude oil annually.

sense.def: An annual is a book or magazine that is published once a year.
An annual je knjiga ali revija, ki izide enkrat na leto.
If a contract or marriage is annulled, it is declared invalid, so that legally it is considered never to have existed.
Kadar je pogodba ali zakon annulled, velja za neveljavnega, kot da ni nikoli zakonito obstajal.
Something that is anomalous is different from what is normal;
Kar je anomalous, se razlikuje od tistega, kar je normalno;

seg.quote: These calculations have given anomalous results.

sense.def: If something is an anomaly, it is different from what is normal or usual;
Kadar je nekaj an anomaly, se razlikuje od tistega, kar je normalno ali običajno;
Anon. means anonymous; often written after poems or other writing whose author is not known.
Anon. je okrajšava za anonymous; pogosto jo srečamo za pesmimi ali drugimi pisnimi izdelki, katerih avtor ni znan.
Anonymity is the state of not having your name or identity known.
Anonymity je stanje, ko človekovo ime ali identiteta nista znana.

seg.quote: ...a benefactor who insisted on anonymity.

sense.def: The anonymity of something is the fact that it hides your identity.
The anonymity of something je dejstvo, da nekaj skriva svojo identiteto.

seg.quote: ...the anonymity of life in big cities.

sense.def: The anonymity of a place is its lack of interesting features.
The anonymity of a place pomeni, da tisti kraj nima zanimivih posebnosti.

seg.quote: ...the anonymity of a hotel room.

sense.def: If you remain anonymous when you do something, you do not let people know that you were the person who did it.
To remain anonymous pomeni, da ne dopustimo ljudem izvedeti, da smo nekaj storili mi.

seg.quote: ...anonymous letters.
Anyone who wanted to make a complaint could do so anonymously.

sense.def: Something that is anonymous does not reveal who you are.
Kar je anonymous, ne razkrije, za kaj gre.

seg.quote: A taxi is anonymous. Nobody knows who's inside.

sense.def: Something that is anonymous has no interesting features.
Kar je anonymous, nima zanimivih značilnosti.

seg.quote: ...an anonymous little town.

sense.def: An anorak is a warm waterproof jacket, usually with a hood.
An anorak je topel, nepremočljiv jopič, največkrat s kapuco.
Another means additional.
Another pomeni dodaten.

seg.quote: We walked another hundred metres.

sense.def: Another can also be used to mean a different thing or person from the one just mentioned.
Another lahko pomeni tudi drugačno stvar ali človeka od tistega, ki smo ga pravkar omenili.

seg.quote: Parents say one thing and do another.

sense.def: You use one another to indicate that each member of a group does something to or for the other members.
Z izrazom one another povemo, da vsak član skupine počne nekaj drugim članom skupine ali zanje.

seg.quote: Members usually meet in one another's homes.

gramGrp.pos: VB with or without OBJ, or REPORT VB

sense.def: When you answer someone who has asked you something, you say something back to them.
Kadar človek answers someone, ki ga je nekaj vprašal, tistemu človeku nekaj odvrne.

seg.quote: "Did he win?"—žNo," I answered.
He answered that the price would be three pounds.

sense.def: If you answer a letter or advertisement, you write to the person who wrote it.
To answer a letter or advertisement pomeni odpisati osebi, ki nam je poslala pismo ali oglas.
An answer is something that you say or write when you answer someone.
An answer je nekaj, kar rečemo ali napišemo, kadar nekomu odgovarjamo.

seg.quote: The answer to your question is no!

sense.def: When you answer the telephone, you pick it up when it rings. When you answer the door, you open it when you hear a knock or the bell.
Kadar človek answers the telephone, dvigne telefonsko slušalko, ko zazvoni. Kadar človek answers the door, odpre vrata, kadar zasliši trkanje ali zvonjenje.

seg.quote: I rang the doorbell, but there was no answer.

sense.def: An answer to a problem is a possible solution to it.
An answer to a problem je možna razrešitev problema.
The answer to a question in a test is something that a student writes or says in an attempt to give the facts.
The answer to a question na izpitu je nekaj, kar študent napiše ali pove v želji, da bi navedel podatke.
When you answer a question in a test, you give the answer to it.
Kadar človek answers a question v vprašalniku ali na izpitu, nanj da odgovor.

seg.quote: You have to answer four questions.

sense.def: If someone, especially a child, answers you back or answers back, they speak rudely to you when you speak to them.
Kadar človek, zlasti otrok, answers someone back ali answers back, nesramno odgovori, kadar ga ogovorimo.
If you are answerable to someone, you have to report and explain your actions to them.
Kadar je človek answerable to someone, se mora nekomu javiti in mu pojasniti svoja dejanja.
If you are answerable for your actions or for someone else's actions, you are considered to be responsible for them.
Kadar je človek answerable for his actions, mora prevzeti odgovornost za svoja dejanja ali dejanja nekoga drugega.
Ants are small crawling insects that live in large groups.
Ants so drobne, gomazeče žuželke, ki živijo v velikih skupinah.
Antagonism is hatred or hostility.
Antagonism je sovraštvo ali nasprotovanje.
Your antagonist is your opponent or enemy.
One's antagonist je človekov nasprotnik ali sovražnik.
Someone who is antagonistic shows hostility towards you.
Kdor je antagonistic, do nas kaže sovražno razpoloženje.

seg.quote: Many of them are antagonistic towards the President.

sense.def: If you antagonize someone, you make them feel angry or hostile towards you.
To antagonize someone pomeni pri nekom izzvati jezo ali sovražnost.
An antecedent of something is a similar thing that happened or existed before it.
An antecedent of something je tisto, kar je podobno nečemu, kar se je že zgodilo.

seg.quote: ...the prehistoric antecedents of the horse.

sense.def: Your antecedents are your ancestors.
One's antecedents so sorodniki, ki so živeli pred nami.
An antelope is an animal like a deer with long legs and horns.
An antelope je žival, podobna srni, z dolgimi nogami in rogovi.

form.usg: Pri 2. pomenu je množina običajno antennas.

sense.def: The antennae of an insect are the two long, thin parts attached to its head that it uses to feel things with.
The antennae pri žuželki sta dva dolga, tanka izrastka na glavi, s katerima žival tipa.
An antenna is also an aerial;
An antenna je tudi radijska ali televizijska antena;
An anthem is a song or hymn written for a special occasion.
An anthem je pesem ali hvalnica, napisana za posebno priložnost.
An anthology is a collection of writings by different writers published together in one book.
An anthology je zbirka zapisov različnih avtorjev, objavljenih skupaj v eni knjigi.
Anthropology is the study of people, society, and culture.
Anthropology je preučevanje ljudi, družbe in kulture.

seg.quote: ...an English anthropologist, Colin Turnbull.

sense.def: Anti- is used to form adjectives that describe people as opposing something such as a group of people or a practice.
S predpono anti- tvorimo pridevnike, s katerimi opisujemo nasprotovanje posameznikov neki skupini ljudi ali neki dejavnosti.

seg.quote: ...the anti-apartheid movement.

sense.def: Anti- is also used to form words that mean intended to prevent something from happening or to destroy something harmful.
Anti- uporabljamo tudi za tvorjenje besed, ki opisujejo nekaj, kar naj bi preprečilo dogodek ali uničilo nekaj škodljivega.

seg.quote: ...anti-aircraft guns.
...anti-freeze.

sense.def: Antibiotics are drugs that are used in medicine to kill bacteria and to cure infections.
Antibiotics so snovi, ki jih uporabljamo v medicini za uničevanje bakterij in zdravljenje okužb.
If you anticipate an event, you realize in advance that it may happen and you are prepared for it.
To anticipate an event pomeni vnaprej ugotoviti, da se nekaj lahko zgodi, in se na dogodek pripraviti.

seg.quote: The Secretary had anticipated the question.
Petrol coupons were issued in anticipation of rationing.

sense.def: If you anticipate something pleasant or exciting that is going to happen, you look forward to it with pleasure.
To anticipate something pomeni z veseljem pričakovati, da se bo zgodilo nekaj prijetnega ali vznemirljivega.

seg.quote: She had often pleasurably anticipated the moment when she would hand in her resignation.
"Please!" the children cried, jumping up and down in anticipation.

sense.def: If something is an anticlimax, it disappoints you because it is not as exciting as you expected, or because it happens after something that was very exciting.
Kadar je nekaj an anticlimax, nas razočara, ker ni tako vznemirljivo, kot smo pričakovali, ali ker se je zgodilo za nečim zelo razburljivim.

seg.quote: Polling day was a bit of an anticlimax.
...a sense of anticlimax.

sense.def: When something moves anti-clockwise, it moves in a circle in the opposite direction to the hands of a clock;
Kadar se nekaj premika anti-clockwise, se premika v nasprotni smeri urinega kazalca;

cit.quote: na levo, v nasprotni smeri urinega kazalca

sense.def: Antics are funny, silly or unusual ways of behaving.
Antics je smešno, neumno ali nenavadno vedênje.
An antidote is a chemical substance that controls the effect of a poison.
An antidote je kemijska snov, ki ustavi delovanje strupa.
An antidote to a difficult situation is something that helps you to deal with the situation.
An antidote to a difficult situation je nekaj, kar nam pomaga razrešiti težaven položaj.

seg.quote: Work is a wonderful antidote to misery.

sense.def: Antipathy is a strong feeling of dislike or hostility.
Antipathy je močno čustvo odpora ali sovražnosti.
Antiquated things seem very old or old-fashioned.
Kar je antiquated, je videti zelo staro ali staromodno.
An antique is an old object which is valuable because of its beauty or rarity.
An antique je star predmet, ki je zaradi svoje lepote ali redkosti dragocen.

seg.quote: ...antique furniture.

sense.def: Antiquity is the distant past, especially the time of the ancient Egyptians, Greeks, and Romans.
Antiquity je daljna preteklost, zlasti čas starih Egipčanov, Grkov in Rimljanov.

seg.quote: ...the great lost paintings of antiquity.

sense.def: Antiquities are interesting old things, such as buildings and statues, that you can go and see.
Antiquities so zanimivi stari predmeti, na primer stavbe ali kipi, ki si jih gremo lahko ogledat.
Anti-Semitism is prejudice against Jewish people.
Anti-Semitism je predsodek do židovskega ljudstva.
Antiseptic is a substance that kills harmful bacteria.
An antiseptic je snov, ki uničuje škodljive bakterije.
Someone who is anti-social is unwilling to meet and be friendly with other people.
Kdor je anti-social, se ne želi srečevati ali biti prijazen z drugimi.
Anti-social behaviour is annoying or upsetting to other people.
Vedênje, ki je anti-social, jezi ali vznemirja druge.
The antithesis of something is its exact opposite;
The antithesis of something je nekaj, kar je tisti stvari nasprotno;
A male deer's antlers are the branched horns on its head.
Antlers so razvejeni rogovi na jelenovi glavi.
A person's anus is the hole between their buttocks, from which faeces leave their body;
Pri človeku je the anus luknja med ritnicama, skozi katero blato zapusti telo;
An anvil is a heavy iron block on which hot metals are beaten into shape.
An anvil je težak železen podstavek, na katerem tolčemo razbeljeno kovino, da dobi zaželeno obliko.
Anxiety is a feeling of nervousness or worry.
Anxiety je občutek skrbi ali zaskrbljenosti.

seg.quote: "What do you think?" asked the Belgian with a touch of anxiety.

sense.def: An anxiety is something which causes you to feel nervous or worried.
An anxiety je nekaj, zaradi česar postanemo živčni ali zaskrbljeni.

seg.quote: ...major financial anxieties.

sense.def: If you are anxious, you are nervous or worried about something.
Kadar je človek anxious, je zaradi nečesa živčen ali v skrbeh.

seg.quote: She was anxious about her job.
"I'm not boring you?" she asked anxiously.

sense.def: An anxious time or situation is one during which you feel nervous and worried.
Čas ali okoliščine, ki so anxious, povzročijo, da smo živčni ali v skrbeh.

seg.quote: You must have had an anxious day.

sense.def: If you are anxious to do something or anxious that something should happen, you very much want to do it or want it to happen.
Kadar je človek anxious to do something ali anxious that something should happen, si močno želi nekaj storiti ali pa si želi, da bi se tisto zgodilo.

seg.quote: She's anxious to go abroad.

sense.def: You use any in negative statements, for example with žnot" or žnever", to mean none of a particular thing.
Besedo any uporabljamo v nikalnicah, na primer z not ali never, da poudarimo odsotnost tistega, o čemer govorimo.

seg.quote: I don't like any of this.

sense.def: You use any in questions and conditional clauses to ask if there is some of a particular thing or to suggest that there might be.
Besedo any uporabljamo v vprašanjih in pogojnih odvisnikih, kadar vprašamo po delu določene stvari ali namignemo, da bi je lahko kaj bilo.

seg.quote: Were you in any danger?
They will retaliate if any of their ships are attacked.

sense.def: You use any in positive statements when you are referring to something or someone without saying exactly what, who, or which kind you mean.
Besedo any uporabljamo v trdilnih stavkih, kadar govorimo o nečem ali nekom, ne da bi natančno povedali, za koga ali kaj gre.

seg.quote: Any big tin container will do.
...things that any man might do under pressure.

sense.def: You can also use any to emphasize a comparative adjective or adverb in a negative statement.
Z besedo any lahko tudi poudarimo prislov ali primernik pridevnika v nikalnem stavku.

seg.quote: I couldn't stand it any longer.

sense.def: Anyhow means the same as anyway.
Anyhow pomeni isto kot anyway.
If you do something anyhow, you do it in a careless or untidy way.
To do something anyhow pomeni, da tisto naredimo nemarno ali neurejeno.

seg.quote: They were all shoved in anyhow.

sense.def: Anymore means the same as "any more": see more.
Anymore pomeni isto kot any more: glej more.
You use anyone or anybody in negative statements, for example with žnot" or žnever", to say that nobody is present or involved in an action.
Besedo anyone ali anybody uporabljamo v nikalnih stavkih, na primer z not ali never, kadar hočemo povedati, da nihče ni navzoč ali vpleten v določeno dejanje.

seg.quote: There wasn't anyone there.

sense.def: You use anyone or anybody in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about whether someone is present or doing something.
Besedi anyone ali anybody uporabljamo v vprašalnih ali pogojnih stavkih, kadar sprašujemo ali govorimo o tem, ali je nekdo navzoč ali nekaj počenja.

seg.quote: Was there anyone behind you?
If anyone asks where you are I'll say you've just gone out.

sense.def: You also use anyone and anybody to refer to a person or to people in general, when you do not want to say which particular person or people you are referring to.
Besedi anyone in anybody se lahko nanašata tudi na osebo ali ljudi na splošno, kadar ne želimo povedati, o kateri osebi ali ljudeh govorimo.

seg.quote: He took longer than anybody else.

sense.def: You use anything in negative statements, for example with žnot" or žnever", to say that nothing is present or an action or event does not happen.
Besedo anything uporabljamo v nikalnih stavkih, na primer z not ali never, kadar želimo povedati, da ni nič navzoče ali da se nekaj ne zgodi.

seg.quote: I did not say anything.

sense.def: You use anything in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about whether something is present or happening.
Besedo anything uporabljamo v vprašalnih ali pogojnih stavkih, kadar vprašamo ali govorimo o tem, ali je nekaj navzoče ali se dogaja.

seg.quote: I've told her to come to you if she wants anything.

sense.def: You can use anything to refer to a thing, an event, or an idea without saying exactly which one you mean.
Beseda anything se lahko nanaša na predmet, dogodek ali idejo, ne da bi morali natančno povedati, za kateri predmet, dogodek ali idejo gre.

seg.quote: Lemon gives a fresh flavour to almost anything.

sense.def: You can use anything for emphasis, when you are saying that something is not at all like something else.
Besedo anything lahko uporabimo za poudarjanje, kadar hočemo povedati, da nekaj sploh ni podobno nečemu drugemu.

cit.quote: prav nič podobno, niti približno takšno

seg.quote: It didn't taste anything like soup.
The total wasn't anything near what we'd expected.

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous point.
Z besedo anyway ali anyhow pokažemo, da določena izjava pojasnjuje ali podpira prejšnjo.

seg.quote: We ought to spend less on the defence missiles, which I reckon are pretty useless anyway.

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to suggest that a statement is true or relevant in spite of other things that have been said.
Z besedo anyway ali anyhow nakažemo, da je neka izjava resnična ali pomembna kljub vsemu drugemu, kar je bilo povedano.

seg.quote: "I can give you a lift."—žNo, I'll walk. Thanks, anyway."

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to correct or modify a statement, for example to limit it to what you definitely know to be true.
Z besedo anyway ali anyhow popravimo ali spremenimo izjavo; omejimo jo na primer na tisto, za kar smo prepričani, da je res.

seg.quote: "All of them?" I asked. "Some, anyway."

sense.def: You use anyway or anyhow to change the topic or return to a previous topic.
Z besedo anyway ali anyhow spremenimo témo ali se vrnemo k prejšnji témi.

seg.quote: What are you phoning for, anyway?
Anyway, I'll see you later.

sense.def: You can use anywhere in negative statements, questions, and conditional clauses to refer to a place without saying exactly where you mean.
Besedo anywhere lahko uporabimo v nikalnih, vprašalnih in pogojnih stavkih, kadar govorimo o nekem kraju, pa ne povemo natanko, o katerem.

seg.quote: Is there an ashtray anywhere?

sense.def: You can use anywhere in positive statements to emphasize an expression that refers to a place or area.
Besedo anywhere lahko uporabimo v trdilnih stavkih, da poudarimo izraz, ki se nanaša na določen kraj ali območje.

seg.quote: They are the oldest rock paintings anywhere in North America.

sense.def: When something is apart from something else, there is a space between them.
Kadar je nekaj apart from something else, je vmes praznina.

seg.quote: I was sitting apart from the rest.

sense.def: If two things are a particular distance apart, they are that distance from each other.
Kadar sta dva predmeta za določeno razdaljo apart, sta za toliko oddaljena drug od drugega.

seg.quote: Their faces were a couple of inches apart.

sense.def: If two things move apart or are pulled apart, they move away from each other.
Kadar se dve stvari premakneta apart ali ju nekaj potegne apart, se odmakneta druga od druge.
If two people are apart, they are not living together or spending time together.
Če sta dve osebi apart, ne živita skupaj in se ne srečujeta.
If you take something apart, you separate it into the pieces that it is made of. If it comes or falls apart, its parts separate from each other.
To take something apart pomeni tisto razdeliti na dele, iz katerih je sestavljeno. To come or fall apart pa pomeni, da se sestavni deli tiste stvari ločijo ali razpadejo.
If something such as an organization or relationship falls apart, it can no longer continue because it has serious difficulties.
Kadar nekaj, na primer organizacija ali zveza, falls apart, ne more več obstajati, ker ima hude težave.

seg.quote: Their marriage began to fall apart.

sense.def: If you can't tell two people or things apart, they look exactly the same to you.
Kadar človek can't tell two people or things apart, sta dve osebi ali stvari zanj videti popolnoma enaki.

seg.quote: He couldn't tell the boys apart.

sense.def: You use apart from when you are giving an exception to a general statement.
Z izrazom apart from nekaj ločimo od sicer posplošujoče izjave.

seg.quote: Apart from Ann, the car was empty.

sense.def: You use apart from to say that you want to ignore one aspect of a situation so that you can talk about another aspect.
Z izrazom apart from povemo, da se nočemo ozirati na en vidik okoliščin, zato da lahko govorimo o nekem drugem vidiku.

seg.quote: Quite apart from the expense, I don't think I would want to fly anyway.

sense.def: Apartheid is a political system in South Africa in which people of different races are kept apart by law.
Apartheid je bil politični režim v Južni Afriki, ki je z zakonom ločeval pripadnike različnih ras.
An apartment is a flat, especially in America.
An apartment je stanovanje; besedo uporabljajo zlasti v Ameriki.
An apartment is one of a set of large rooms used by an important person such as a king, queen, or president.
An apartment je več velikih sob, ki jih uporablja pomembna oseba, na primer kralj, kraljica ali predsednik.

seg.quote: ...splendid apartments of state.

sense.def: Someone who is apathetic is not interested in anything.
Kdor je apathetic, ga nič ne zanima.
Apathy is a state of mind in which you are not interested in or enthusiastic about anything.
Apathy je razpoloženje, v katerem nas nič ne zanima ali se za nič ne navdušujemo.
Apes are animals such as chimpanzees or gorillas.
Apes so živali, na primer šimpanzi ali gorile.
If you ape someone's speech or behaviour, you imitate it.
To ape someone's speech or behaviour pomeni posnemati govor ali vedênje nekega človeka.
An aperture is a narrow hole or gap, for example the opening in a camera through which light passes into it.
An aperture je ozka reža ali špranja, na primer odprtina v fotoaparatu, skozi katero vanj prihaja svetloba.
The apex of something is its pointed top or end.
The apex of something je zašiljen vrh ali konec nečesa.
If people have a particular number of things apiece, they have that number each;
Če imajo ljudje določeno število predmetov apiece, jih ima vsak od njih tolikšno število;

seg.quote: He gave his daughters £200 apiece.

sense.def: If you do something with aplomb, you do it with great confidence.
To do something with aplomb pomeni tisto narediti z veliko gotovostjo.
Someone who is apolitical is not interested in politics.
Kdor je apolitical, ga politika ne zanima.
If you are apologetic, you show or say that you are sorry that you have hurt someone or caused trouble for them.
Kadar je človek apologetic, pokaže ali pove, da mu je žal, ker je nekoga prizadel ali mu povzročil težave.

seg.quote: He had been apologetic about his behaviour at dinner.
He smiled apologetically.

sense.def: When you apologize to someone, you say that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them.
Kadar človek apologizes to someone, izjavi, da mu je žal, ker je nekoga prizadel ali mu povzročil težave.

seg.quote: I apologise for my late arrival.

sense.def: An apology is something that you say or write in order to tell someone that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them.
An apology je tisto, kar rečemo ali napišemo, kadar želimo nekomu povedati, da nam je žal, ker smo ga prizadeli ali mu povzročili težave.

An apostrophe is a mark written to indicate that one or more other letters have been omitted from a word, as in žcan't" and žhe'll". An apostrophe is also written before or after an žs" at the end of a word to indicate that what follows belongs or relates to the word, as in žthe cat's whiskers" and žthe players' entrance".

An apostrophe je znamenje, s katerim pokažemo, da je bila ena ali več črk v besedi izpuščenih, na primer v can't in he'll. An apostrophe napišemo tudi pred ali za s na koncu besede in tako označimo, da tisto, kar sledi, sodi k prejšnji besedi ali se nanaša nanjo, na primer v the cat's whiskers in the players' entrance.

form.form: v ameriški angleščini pišemo appall in appalls.

sense.def: If something appals you, it shocks and disgusts you because it is so bad.
Kadar nekaj appals someone, ga presune ali ogorči, ker je tako slabo.

seg.quote: The levels of ignorance appalled me.
I was absolutely appalled at the quality of the reporting.

sense.def: Something that is appalling is so bad that it shocks you.
Kar je appalling, je tako slabo, da nas presune.

seg.quote: These people live in appalling conditions.
The situation has deteriorated appallingly since 1951.

sense.def: Apparatus is the equipment which is used to do a particular job or activity.
Apparatus je priprava, ki jo uporabljamo za opravljanje določene naloge ali dejavnosti.
The apparatus of an organization is its structure and method of operation.
The apparatus of an organization sta ustroj in metoda delovanja tiste organizacije.

seg.quote: ...the whole apparatus of the welfare state.

sense.def: An apparent situation, quality, or feeling seems to exist, although you cannot be certain that it exists.
Okoliščine, kakovost ali čustva, ki so apparent, na videz obstajajo, čeprav o tem ne moremo biti prepričani.

seg.quote: ...the apparent success of their marriage.

sense.def: If something is apparent to you, it is clear and obvious to you.
Kadar je nekaj apparent to someone, tisti jasno vidi, da je tako.

seg.quote: It was becoming increasingly apparent to me that he disliked me.

sense.def: You use apparently to refer to something that seems to be the case although it may not be.
Z besedo apparently opišemo nekaj, kar se vidi, čeprav mogoče ni res.

seg.quote: She was standing by the window, apparently quite calm and relaxed.

sense.def: An apparition is something that you think you see but that is not really there.
An apparition je nekaj, kar mislimo, da vidimo, vendar tistega v resnici ni.
If you appeal for something that you need, you make a serious and urgent request for it.
To appeal for something pomeni, da resno in nujno zahtevamo nekaj, kar potrebujemo.

seg.quote: He was appealing for funds to build a new school.

sense.def: An appeal is a serious and urgent request.
An appeal je resna in nujna prošnja.

seg.quote: A radio appeal asking for money for cancer research, raised £75,000.

sense.def: If you appeal to someone's reason or feelings, you suggest that they should do what you ask if they want to seem reasonable or compassionate.
To appeal to someone's reason or feelings pomeni nekomu predlagati, naj stori tisto, za kar ga prosimo, če hoče dajati vtis, da je razumen ali sočuten.

seg.quote: They are confident they can appeal to her sense of duty.
...an appeal to her maternal feelings.

sense.def: If you appeal to someone in authority against a decision, you formally ask them to change it.
To appeal to someone na visokem položaju proti neki odločitvi pomeni uradno prositi za njeno spremembo.
An appeal is a formal request for a decision to be changed.
An appeal je uradna zahteva po spremembi odločitve.

seg.quote: The Supreme Court turned down our appeal.

sense.def: If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.
Kadar nekaj appeals to someone, je tisto zanj privlačno ali zanimivo.

seg.quote: The idea appealed to him.
She had an appealing sense of humour.

sense.def: The appeal of something is a quality that it has which people find attractive or interesting.
The appeal of something je lastnost nekega predmeta, ki je za ljudi privlačna ali zanimiva.
When something appears, it moves into a position where you can see it.
Kadar nekaj appears, se premakne tja, kjer se vidi.

seg.quote: A glow of light appeared over the sea.

sense.def: When something new appears, it begins to exist or becomes available.
Kadar nekaj novega appears, začne obstajati ali postane dostopno.

seg.quote: His second novel appeared under the title "Getting By".

sense.def: When someone appears in a play or show, they take part in it.
Kadar človek appears in a play or show, sodeluje v drami ali predstavi.
When someone appears before a court of law, they go there to answer charges or to give information.
To appear before a court of law pomeni iti na sodišče, da bi odgovarjali za obtožbe ali dali podatke.

gramGrp.pos: VB with TO-INF or COMPLEMENT, or REPORT VB

sense.def: If you say that something appears to be the way that you describe it, you mean that you believe it to be that way.
Kadar nekaj appears to be takšno, kot opisujemo, da je, hočemo povedati, da mi tako mislimo.

seg.quote: Their offer appears to be the most attractive.

sense.def: The appearance of someone in a place is their arrival there, especially when it is unexpected.
The appearance of someone in a place je prihod človeka na neki kraj, zlasti če je nepričakovan.

seg.quote: The fight was soon stopped, thanks to the prompt appearance of the police.

sense.def: Someone or something's appearance is the way that they look to people.
Someone or something's appearance je videz, ki ga nekdo ali nekaj kaže ljudem.

seg.quote: I had ceased to worry about my appearance.

sense.def: The appearance of something new is its coming into existence or into use.
The appearance of something new je dejstvo, da nekaj novega začne obstajati ali pride v rabo.

seg.quote: With the appearance of credit cards more people got into debt.

sense.def: When someone makes an appearance in a play or show, they take part in it.
Kadar človek makes an appearance in a play or show, sodeluje v drami ali predstavi.

seg.quote: She has made several television appearances recently.

sense.def: If you put in an appearance at an event, you go to it for a short time but do not stay.
To put in an appearance at an event, pomeni, da gremo na tisto prireditev za kratek čas, vendar ne ostanemo do konca.
If something is true to all appearances or by all appearances, it seems from what you know about it that it is true.
Kadar je nekaj resnično to all appearances ali by all appearances, kaže, da je tako po tistem, kar o stvari vemo.

seg.quote: To all appearances he doesn't work hard.

sense.def: If you try to appease someone, you try to stop them being angry by giving them what they want;
To try to appease someone pomeni truditi se, da bi preprečili jezo nekega človeka tako, da mu ustrežemo s tistim, kar želi;

seg.quote: He had to do something to appease the Republicans.
...a policy of appeasement.

sense.def: Appendicitis is an illness in which your appendix is infected and painful.
Appendicitis je bolezen, pri kateri imamo vnet in boleč slepič.
Your appendix is a small closed tube inside your body at the end of your digestive system.
One's appendix je kratek, na enem koncu zaprt začetni del debelega črevesa.
An appendix to a book is extra information that is placed at the end of it.
An appendix to a book so dodatni podatki na koncu knjige.
Your appetite is your desire to eat.
One's appetite je človekova želja po jedi.

seg.quote: All that work has given me an appetite.
...his loss of appetite.

sense.def: If you have an appetite for something, you have a strong desire for it.
To have an appetite for something pomeni, da si tisto močno želimo.

seg.quote: ...the appetite for power.

sense.def: Food that is appetizing looks and smells nice, so that you want to eat it.
Hrana, ki je appetizing, je videti in diši lepo, tako da si jo želimo jesti.
When a group of people applaud, they clap their hands in order to show approval, for example when they have enjoyed a play.
Kadar skupina ljudi applauds, udarjajo z rokami, da pokažejo odobravanje, na primer kadar jim je bila predstava všeč.
When an action or attitude is applauded, people praise it.
Kadar je dejanje ali pristop applauded, ga ljudje hvalijo.
Applause is an expression of praise or appreciation by a group of people, in which they clap their hands.
Applause je izraz hvale ali odobravanja med ljudmi, pri katerem ploskajo z rokami.
An apple is a round fruit with a smooth skin and firm white flesh.
An apple je okrogel sadež z gladko lupino in čvrstim, belim mesom.
An appliance is a device or machine that does a particular job in your home, for example a vacuum cleaner or a washing machine.
An appliance je naprava, ki doma opravlja določeno delo, na primer sesalec za prah ali pralni stroj.
Something that is applicable to a particular situation is relevant to it.
Kar je applicable to a particular situation, se nanaša na določene okoliščine.

seg.quote: The following special regulations are applicable to overseas students.

sense.def: An applicant for a job is someone who formally asks to be given it.
An applicant for a job je človek, ki uradno prosi, naj mu dodelijo določeno delo.
An application for a job or a place at a college is a formal written request to be given it.
An application for a job or a place at a college je uradna pisna zahteva po dodelitvi službe ali mesta na šoli.
The application of a rule or piece of knowledge is the use of it in a particular situation.
The application of a rule or piece of knowledge je upoštevanje nekega pravila ali znanja v določenih okoliščinah.

seg.quote: Do the results have any practical application?

sense.def: Application is hard work and concentration on what you are doing.
Application je trdo delo in zbranost pri tistem, kar počnemo.
An applied subject of study is practical rather than theoretical.
Strokovno področje, ki je applied, je praktično, ne teoretično.

seg.quote: ...applied psychology.

sense.def: If you apply to have something or to do something, you write asking formally to be allowed to have it or do it.
To apply to have something or to do something pomeni uradno pisno prositi, da nam nekaj dovolijo imeti ali storiti.

seg.quote: I've applied for another job.

gramGrp.pos: REFL VB or VB with OBJ

sense.def: If you apply yourself to something, you concentrate hard on it.
To apply oneself to something pomeni močno se osredotočiti na tisto.

seg.quote: He tried to apply his mind to Rose's problems.

sense.def: If something applies to a person or a situation, it is relevant to the person or situation.
Kadar nekaj applies to a person or a situation, je povezano s tisto osebo ali okoliščinami.
If you apply a rule, system, or skill, you use it in a situation or activity.
To apply a rule, system, or skill pomeni v določenih okoliščinah ali pri neki dejavnosti uporabljati neko pravilo, sistem ali spretnost.

seg.quote: ...the capacity to develop and apply technology.

sense.def: If you apply a name to someone or something, you refer to them by that name.
To apply a name to someone or something pomeni s tistim imenom imenovati neko osebo ali predmet.
If you apply something to a surface, you put it onto the surface or rub it into it;
To apply something to a surface pomeni nekaj položiti na površino ali vtreti vanjo;

seg.quote: Apply a little liquid wax polish.

sense.def: If you appoint someone to a job or post, you formally choose them for it.
To appoint someone to a job or post pomeni nekoga uradno izbrati za neko delo ali položaj.
If you appoint a time or place for something to happen, you decide when or where it will happen;
To appoint a time or place, ko naj bi se nekaj zgodilo, pomeni skleniti, kdaj ali kje se bo tisto zgodilo;

seg.quote: I arrived at the appointed time.

sense.def: The appointment of a person to do a particular job is the choice of that person to do it.
The appointment of a person to do a particular job je izbira neke osebe za opravljanje določenega dela.
An appointment is a job or position of responsibility.
An appointment je odgovorno delo ali položaj.
If you have an appointment with someone, you have arranged to see them at a particular time.
To have an appointment with someone pomeni, da smo se z nekom dogovorili za srečanje ob določenem času.

seg.quote: The doctor's appointment was for 11 am.

sense.def: If you make an appraisal of something, you consider it carefully and form an opinion about it.
To make an appraisal of something pomeni o tistem pazljivo razmisliti in si ustvariti sodbo.
If you appraise something, you consider it carefully and form an opinion about it.
To appraise something pomeni o tistem pazljivo razmisliti in si ustvariti sodbo.
An appreciable amount or effect is large enough to be important or clearly noticed.
An appreciable amount or effect je dovolj velika količina ali učinek, da je pomemben ali jasno viden.

seg.quote: There had been appreciable progress recently.
The following week it was appreciably colder.

sense.def: If you appreciate something, you like it because you recognize its good qualities.
To appreciate something pomeni, da nam nekaj ugaja, ker v tistem prepoznavamo dobre lastnosti.
If you appreciate a situation or problem, you understand it and know what it involves.
To appreciate a situation or problem pomeni razumeti položaj ali problem in vedeti, za kaj gre.

seg.quote: I appreciate that this is not a fair comparison.

sense.def: If you say that you appreciate what someone has done for you, you mean that you are grateful to them for it.
Z izrazom appreciate nekemu človeku izrazimo hvaležnost za tisto, kar je storil za nas.
If something appreciates over a period of time, its value increases.
Kadar nekaj appreciates, se njegova vrednost v določenem časovnem obdobju poveča.

seg.quote: These diamonds should appreciate in value.

sense.def: Appreciation of something is recognition and enjoyment of its good qualities.
Appreciation of something je priznanje in užitek ob dobri kakovosti nečesa.

seg.quote: He had little appreciation of great plays.
