sense.def: If you show your appreciation for something that someone has done for you, you express your gratitude for it.
To show one's appreciation for something pomeni pokazati, da smo hvaležni za tisto, kar je nekdo storil za nas.
An appreciation of someone such as an artist is a discussion and evaluation of their achievements.
An appreciation of someone, na primer umetnika, je razprava in ocenjevanje njegovih dosežkov.
An appreciative reaction or expression shows pleasure or gratitude.
Odziv ali izraz, ki je appreciative, izraža veselje ali hvaležnost.

seg.quote: ...appreciative laughter.
"Thank you," I said, flashing him an appreciative smile.
"Want a lift?" she asked. I nodded appreciatively.

sense.def: Apprehension is a feeling of fear that something terrible may happen;
Apprehension je občutek strahu, da se bo morda zgodilo nekaj strašnega;

seg.quote: His mother trembled with apprehension.

sense.def: Someone who is apprehensive is afraid that something terrible may happen.
Kdor je apprehensive, se boji, da se bo zgodilo nekaj strašnega.

seg.quote: I felt a bit apprehensive at first.
She looked up apprehensively.

sense.def: An apprentice is a young person who works with someone in order to learn their skill.
An apprentice je mlad človek, ki z nekom sodeluje, da bi se naučil njegove spretnosti.
A young person's apprenticeship is a fixed period of time during which they work with someone in order to learn their skill.
An apprenticeship je obdobje, v katerem mora mlad človek z nekom sodelovati, da se nauči njegove spretnosti.
When someone approaches you, they come nearer to you.
Kadar nekdo approaches someone, mu pride bliže.

seg.quote: He opened the car door for her as she approached.
The dogs began to bark as if aware of our approach.

sense.def: An approach to a place is a road or path that leads to it.
An approach to a place je cesta ali pot, ki pelje k določenemu kraju.
If you approach someone about something, you speak to them about it for the first time.
Če človek approaches someone about something, prvič govori z nekom o neki stvari.

seg.quote: They had approached us about working with their party.

sense.def: When you approach a situation or problem in a particular way, you think about it or deal with it in that way.
Kadar človek approaches a situation or problem, na neki način razmišlja o nekem položaju ali problemu ali pa ga tako obravnava.

seg.quote: Governments must approach the subject of disarmament in a new spirit.

sense.def: An approach to a situation or problem is a way of thinking about it or of dealing with it.
An approach to a situation or problem je način, kako o okoliščinah ali problemu razmišljamo ali ukrepamo.

seg.quote: We need a new approach to this problem.

sense.def: When a future event or date approaches or when you approach it, it gradually becomes nearer.
Kadar prihodnji dogodek ali datum approaches ali kadar človek approaches a future event or date, ta postopoma prihaja bliže.

seg.quote: We are approaching the day of the race.
...the approach of winter.

sense.def: If something approaches a particular level or state, it almost reaches that level or state.
Kadar nekaj approaches a particular level or state, skoraj doseže tako raven ali stanje.

seg.quote: These rocket planes approached speeds of 4000 mph.

sense.def: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.
Kar je appropriate, je v določenih okoliščinah ustrezno ali sprejemljivo.

seg.quote: It seemed appropriate to end with a joke.
He reminded himself to thank Louis appropriately.

sense.def: If you appropriate something which does not belong to you, you take it for yourself;
Če človek appropriates something, vzame nekaj, kar ni njegova last;

seg.quote: The materials are exported and other countries appropriate the profits.

sense.def: If a plan or request gets approval, someone agrees to allow it.
Če zahteva ali načrt gets approval, se z njim nekdo strinja ali ga dovoli.

seg.quote: I was given McPherson's approval for the plan.

sense.def: Approval also means admiration.
Approval pomeni tudi občudovanje.

seg.quote: Oliver looked at Simon with approval.

sense.def: If you approve of an action, event, or suggestion, you are pleased about it.
Kadar človek approves of an action, event, or suggestion, je zadovoljen s tistim dejanjem, dogodkom ali predlogom.

seg.quote: My grandfather did not approve of my father's marriage.

sense.def: If you approve of someone or something, you like and admire them.
Kadar človek approves of someone or something, mu je neki predmet ali oseba všeč in ga občuduje.

seg.quote: He doesn't approve of me.

sense.def: If someone in authority approves a plan or idea, they formally agree to it.
Kadar človek na visokem položaju approves a plan or idea, se uradno strinja z načrtom ali zamislijo.
An approved method or course of action is generally or officially accepted as appropriate.
Metoda ali postopek, ki je approved, je na splošno ali uradno sprejet za primernega.
Someone who is approved in a particular position has been formally accepted by people in authority.
Kdor je approved in a particular position, je bil uradno sprejet pri pooblaščenih ljudeh.

seg.quote: ...lists of approved candidates.

sense.def: An approving reaction or expression shows support for something, or satisfaction with it.
Z odzivom ali izrazom, ki je approving, pokažemo podporo ali zadovoljstvo z nečim.

seg.quote: There were a few approving nods and smiles.
His wife watched approvingly.

sense.def: An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.
Število, čas ali položaj, ki je approximate, je blizu pravilnemu, vendar ni točen.

seg.quote: She gave me some approximate figures.
We have approximately 40 pupils.

sense.def: If something approximates to something else, it is similar to it but not exactly the same.
Kadar nekaj approximates to something else, je tistemu podobno, vendar ne enako.

seg.quote: ...social conditions approximate those of the early thirties.
...stories which vaguely approximated to the truth.

sense.def: An approximation is a fact, object, or description which is similar to something else but not exactly the same.
An approximation je dejstvo, predmet ali opis, ki je podoben nečemu drugemu, vendar ne enak.

seg.quote: ...an approximation to the truth.

sense.def: An approximation is also a number, calculation, or position that is not exact.
An approximation je tudi število, izračun ali položaj, ki ni natančen.
An apricot is a small, soft, round fruit with yellowish-orange flesh and a stone inside.
An apricot je majhen, mehak, okrogel sadež z rumenkasto oranžnim mesom in koščico v sredini.
April is the fourth month of the year in the Western calendar.
April je četrti mesec v letu.
An apron is a piece of clothing that you put on over the front of your normal clothes to prevent them from getting dirty.
An apron je kos oblačila, ki si ga nadenemo čez navadno obleko, da se ne umažemo.
Apt means suitable.
Apt pomeni primeren.

seg.quote: ...a very apt description.
...the aptly named village of Cold Weston.

sense.def: If someone is apt to behave in a particular way, they often behave in that way.
Kadar je človek apt to behave in a particular way, se pogosto vede na določen način.

seg.quote: I was apt to fidget during a long performance.

sense.def: If you have an aptitude for something, you are able to learn it quickly and do it well.
Kadar ima človek an aptitude for something, se je sposoben tistega hitro naučiti in dobro delati.
An aquarium is a glass tank filled with water, in which people keep fish.
An aquarium je steklena posoda, napolnjena z vodo; v njej ljudje gojijo ribe.
An aquarium is also a building, often in a zoo, where fish and underwater animals are kept.
An aquarium je tudi stavba, pogosto v živalskem vrtu, kjer živijo ribe in vodne živali.
Aquatic means existing or happening in water.
Aquatic pomeni tak, ki živi ali se dogaja v vodi.

seg.quote: ...aquatic plants.
...aquatic sports.

sense.def: An Arab is a member of a people who live in the Middle East and North Africa.
An Arab je pripadnik ljudstva, ki živi na Bližnjem Vzhodu ali v severni Afriki.

seg.quote: ...his early life among the Arabs.
The Ambassadors of several Arab countries were invited.

sense.def: Arabian means belonging or relating to Arabia, especially to Saudi Arabia.
Arabian pomeni pripadajoč ali povezan z Arabijo, zlasti s Saudovo Arabijo.
Arabic is a language spoken in the Middle East and in parts of North Africa.
Arabic je jezik, ki ga govorijo na Bližnjem Vzhodu in nekaterih območjih severne Afrike.
Something that is Arabic belongs or relates to the language, writing, or culture of the Arabs.
Kar je Arabic, pripada ali je povezano z jezikom, pisanjem ali kulturo Arabcev.
An Arabic numeral is one of the written figures, such as 1, 2, 3, or 4.
Arabic je ena od oblik zapisa števil, na primer 1, 2, 3 ali 4.
Arable is used to describe things relating to growing crops.
Z besedo arable opisujemo tisto, kar je povezano s pridelovanjem poljščin.

seg.quote: ...arable farming.

sense.def: An arbiter is a person or institution that judges and settles a quarrel between people or groups;
An arbiter je oseba ali ustanova, ki razsoja in ureja spore med ljudmi ali skupinami ljudi;
An arbitrary decision or action is not taken for any particular reason.
Odločitev ali dejanje, ki je arbitrary, se zgodi brez pravega razloga.

seg.quote: ...the brutal and arbitrary expulsion of immigrants.
The victim has almost always been arbitrarily arrested.

sense.def: When someone arbitrates between two people who are in dispute, they consider all the facts and decide who is right.
Kadar nekdo arbitrates med dvema sprtima osebama, pretehta vsa dejstva in odloči, katera ima prav.

seg.quote: ...arbitration between employers and unions.

sense.def: An arc is a smoothly curving shape or line of movement.
An arc je krivulja ali enakomerno ukrivljena oblika nečesa.
In mathematics, an arc is a section of the circumference of a circle.
V matematiki je an arc del kroga.
An arcade is a covered passageway where there are shops.
An arcade je pokrit prehod; v njem so trgovine.
An arch is a structure that has a curved roof or top supported on either side by a pillar or wall.
An arch je stavba z ukrivljeno streho ali vrhnjim delom, ki jo na vsaki strani podpira steber ali zid.

seg.quote: ...a house beneath the railway arches.

sense.def: When something arches, it forms a curved shape or line.
Kadar nekaj arches, oblikuje ukrivljen lik ali črto.

seg.quote: Trees arched over the sidewalks.
He arched his back.

sense.def: An arch look is mysterious and mischievous;
Pogled, ki je arch, je skrivnosten in ironičen;
Archaeology is the study of the past by examining the remains of things such as buildings and tools.
Archaeology je preučevanje preteklosti z raziskovanjem predmetov, na primer stavb ali orodja.

seg.quote: ...the most dramatic archaeological discovery of this century.
Archaeologists date the fragment between 4650 and 4500.

sense.def: Things that are archaic are very old or very old-fashioned.
Predmeti, ki so archaic, so zelo stari ali zastareli.
An archbishop is a bishop of the highest rank, who is in charge of all the bishops and priests in a region.
An archbishop je škof z najvišjimi pooblastili, pristojen za vse škofe in duhovnike na določenem območju.
An arched roof, window, or doorway has a curved top.
Streha, vrata ali vhod, ki je arched, ima zaobljen vrhnji del.
An archer is someone who shoots with a bow and arrow.
An archer je človek, ki strelja z lokom in puščico.
Archery is a sport in which people shoot at a target with a bow and arrow.
Archery je šport, pri katerem z lokom in puščico streljajo v tarčo.
The archetype of a kind of person or thing is a perfect example of it.
The archetype of a kind of person or thing je popoln primerek določen vrste človeka ali predmeta.

seg.quote: He is said to be the archetype of the modern journalist.
...the archetypal romantic heroes: Beethoven and Byron.

sense.def: An archipelago is a group of small islands.
An archipelago je vrsta majhnih otokov.
An architect is a person who designs buildings.
An architect je človek, ki načrtuje stavbe.
The architect of an idea or event is the person who invented it or made it happen.
The architect of an idea or event je oseba, ki si je izmislila neko idejo ali dogodek ali poskrbela za nastanek zamisli ali dogodka.

seg.quote: He was the real architect of the country's independence.

sense.def: Architecture is the art of designing and constructing buildings.
Architecture je umetnost načrtovanja in graditve stavb.

seg.quote: ...architectural drawings.

sense.def: The architecture of a building is the style in which it is constructed.
The architecture of a building je slog, v katerem je neka stavba zgrajena.
Archives are collections of documents and records that contain information about the history of an organization or group of people.
Archives so zbirke listin in zapiskov, v katerih so podatki o zgodovini neke organizacije ali skupine ljudi.
Someone who is ardent about something is very enthusiastic or passionate about it.
Kdor je ardent about something, je za tisto zelo navdušen ali vnet.

seg.quote: ...an ardent socialist.
No woman desired more ardently to educate her sons.

sense.def: Ardour is an intense and passionate feeling of love or enthusiasm.
Ardour je močno in strastno čustvo ljubezni ali navdušenja.
Something that is arduous is tiring and involves a lot of effort.
Kar je arduous, je utrudljivo in zahteva veliko truda.

seg.quote: ...a long and arduous journey.

sense.def: Are is the plural and the second person singular of the present tense of be.
Are je druga oseba ednine in množina sedanjega časa glagola to be.
An area is a particular part of a city, a country, or the world.
An area je določen del mesta, države ali sveta.

seg.quote: ...a dry area that gets only a few months of rain a year.
...the Brighton area.

sense.def: A particular area of a room or other place is a part that is used for a particular activity.
A particular area of a room or other place je del sobe ali prostora, ki ga uporabljamo za določeno dejavnost.

seg.quote: ...an outdoor play area.

sense.def: The area of a shape or piece of land is the amount that it covers, expressed in a measurement such as square metres or hectares.
The area of a shape or piece of land je del lika ali zemljišča, izražen v merah, na primer v kvadratnih metrih ali hektarih.
An area of knowledge or activity is a particular subject or kind of activity.
An area of knowledge or activity je določeno področje znanja ali vrsta dejavnosti.

seg.quote: His special interest lies in the area of literature.

sense.def: An arena is a place where sports and other public events take place. It has seats around it where people sit and watch.
An arena je kraj za športne in druge javne prireditve. Na njem so sedeži, s katerih gledalci spremljajo dogajanje.
Aren't is the usual spoken form of "are not".
Aren't navadno izgovorimo namesto are not.

seg.quote: We aren't ready.
They are coming, aren't they?

sense.def: Aren't is used instead of žam not" in negative questions.
Aren't uporabljamo v vprašalni obliki nikalnic namesto am not.

seg.quote: I'm right, aren't I?

sense.def: An idea, point, or comment that is arguable is not obviously true or correct and should be questioned.
Če je ideja, poanta ali pripomba arguable, na prvi pogled ni resnična ali pravilna in bi morali o njej podvomiti.

seg.quote: Whether he was right or not is arguable.

sense.def: If you say that it is arguable that something is true, you mean that there are good reasons for thinking that it is true.
To be arguable that something is true pomeni, da obstajajo dobri razlogi za misel, da nekaj ni resnično.

seg.quote: It is arguable that western civilisation was saved by his actions.
Deforestation is arguably the most serious environmental issue of our time.

sense.def: If you argue with someone, you say things which show that you disagree with them, sometimes speaking angrily.
Če človek argues with someone, z besedami, včasih tudi jeznimi, pokaže, da se ne strinja z njim.

seg.quote: Don't argue with me, George, just do as you're told.
They were arguing about who should sit in front.

sense.def: If you argue that something is the case, you say that you think it is the case and give reasons why.
Če človek argues, da je nekaj tako, kot trdi, pove, da je po njegovem mnenju tako in navede razloge.

seg.quote: There are those who argue that the existence of nuclear weapons has helped to maintain peace.

sense.def: If you argue for or argue against something, you give reasons why it should or should not happen.
Če človek argues for ali argues against something, navede razloge, zakaj bi se tisto moralo ali ne smelo zgoditi.

seg.quote: Some politicians argued against giving women the vote.

sense.def: An argument is a disagreement between two or more people, sometimes resulting in them shouting at each other.
An argument je nesoglasje med dvema ali več osebami, ki se včasih konča z vpitjem.

seg.quote: He and David had been drawn into a ferocious argument.
Wrangling, argument, and law suits followed.

sense.def: An argument is also a set of statements that you use to try to convince people that your opinion is correct.
An argument je tudi vrsta izjav, s katerimi poskušamo prepričati druge, da je naše mnenje pravilno.

seg.quote: There are strong arguments against these measures.

sense.def: Someone who is argumentative is always ready to disagree.
Kdor je argumentative, je vedno pripravljen nasprotovati.
Land that is arid is so dry that very few plants can grow on it.
Zemlja, ki je arid, je tako suha, da na njej lahko uspevajo le redke rastline.
When something such as an opportunity, problem, or new state of affairs arises, it begins to exist.
Kadar priložnost, problem ali nove okoliščine arise, začnejo obstajati.

seg.quote: A serious problem has arisen.

sense.def: The aristocracy is a class of people in some countries who have a high social rank and special titles.
V nekaterih državah je the aristocracy družbeni razred, ki ima visok položaj in posebne nazive.
An aristocrat is someone whose family has a high social rank, especially someone with a title.
An aristocrat je človek, čigar družina ima visok družbeni položaj, zlasti če ima tudi plemiški naziv.
Aristocratic means belonging to the aristocracy, or typical of them.
Aristocratic pomeni pripadajoč plemstvu ali značilen zanj.

seg.quote: ...young aristocratic girls.

sense.def: Arithmetic is the part of mathematics that deals with the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of numbers.
Arithmetic je del matematike, ki obravnava seštevanje, odštevanje, množenje in deljenje števil.
Your arms are the two long parts of your body that are attached to your shoulders and that have your hands at the end.
One's arms sta podolgovati telesni okončini, prirasli na ramena, ki imata na spodnjem koncu dlan s prsti.
The arms of a chair are the parts on which you rest your arms.
The arms of a chair so deli stola, na katere naslonimo roke.
An arm of an organization is a section of it.
An arm of an organization je del organizacije.

seg.quote: ...the political arm of a trade union movement.

sense.def: Arms are weapons that are used in a war.
Arms imenujemo orožje, ki ga uporabljamo za vojskovanje.
If you are walking arm in arm with someone, your arm is linked through their arm.
Kadar človek hodi arm in arm with someone, se s tistim človekom držita za roke.
If you welcome an event or change with open arms, you are very pleased about it.
Če spremembo ali dogodek sprejmemo with open arms, smo ga zelo veseli.
If you hold something at arm's length, you hold it as far as possible from your body.
Če nekaj držimo at arm's length, tisto držimo tako daleč od telesa, kot je mogoče.
If you keep someone at arm's length, you avoid becoming too friendly or involved with them.
Če človek keeps someone at arm's length, se izogiba temu, da bi se s tistim človekom preveč spoprijateljil ali zapletel.

cit.quote: varovati se koga, ne pustiti ga blizu

sense.def: If someone is up in arms about something, they are protesting strongly about it.
Kadar je človek up in arms about something, tistemu ostro ugovarja.
Armaments are weapons and military equipment belonging to an army or country.
Armaments imenujemo orožje in vojaško opremo, ki pripada določeni vojski ali državi.
An armchair is a comfortable chair with a support on each side for your arms.
An armchair je udoben stol, ki ima na obeh straneh naslonila za roke.
Someone who is armed is carrying a weapon.
Kdor je armed, nosi orožje.

seg.quote: He was seized by armed men.

sense.def: An armed attack or conflict involves people fighting with guns.
Pri napadu ali sporu, ki je armed, se ljudje bojujejo s strelnim orožjem.
If you are armed with something useful such as information or a skill, you have it.
To be armed with something useful, na primer s podatki ali spretnostjo, pomeni, da tisto imamo.

seg.quote: Armed with secretarial skills, she will easily find a job.

sense.def: The armed forces of a country are its army, navy, and air force.
The armed forces of a country je kopenska vojska, mornarica in letalstvo tiste države.
An armful of something is the amount that you can carry in one or both of your arms.
An armful of something je količina ali breme, ki ga lahko nesemo z eno ali obema rokama.
An armistice is an agreement between countries who are at war to stop fighting and to discuss ways of making a peaceful settlement.
An armistice je sporazum med vojskujočimi se državami, da bodo prekinile boj in se dogovorile o mirni poravnavi.
Armour is the metal clothing that soldiers used to wear for protection.
Armour je kovinsko oblačilo, ki ga vojaki uporabljajo za zaščito.
Armour is also a hard covering that protects some animals from attack.
Armour je tudi trd pokrov, ki nekatere živali varuje pred napadalci.

seg.quote: ...an armour of horny scales.

sense.def: An armoured vehicle has a metal covering that protects it from gunfire and other missiles.
Vozilo, ki je armoured, ima trd oklep, ki potnike varuje pred morebitnimi streli in izstrelki.
Your armpit is the area under your arm where your arm joins your shoulder.
An armpit je del pod človekovo ramo, kjer je roka prirasla na trup.
An army is a large organized group of people who are armed and trained to fight.
An army je velika, organizirana skupina oboroženih, za boj izurjenih ljudi.
An army of people, animals, or things is a large number of them together.
An army of people, animals, or things je veliko število oseb, živali ali stvari skupaj.

seg.quote: ...an army of ants.

sense.def: An aroma is a strong, pleasant smell.
An aroma je močan, prijeten vonj.
A plant or food that is aromatic has a strong, pleasant smell.
Rastlina ali hrana, ki je aromatic, ima močan, prijeten vonj.
Arose is the past tense of arise.
Arose je preteli čas glagola to arise.
Around can be an adverb or preposition, and is often used instead of round as the second part of a phrasal verb. Examples of these uses of around are explained at round.
Around je lahko prislov ali predlog in ga v glagolskih izrazih pogosto uporabljamo namesto round. Primeri take rabe besede around so opisani pri besedi round.
If someone or something is around, they are present or available.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj around, obstaja ali je na voljo.

seg.quote: It's a gadget which has been around for years.

sense.def: Around also means approximately.
Around pomeni tudi približno.

seg.quote: He owns around 200 acres.

sense.def: If something causes the arousal of a feeling, it causes people to have this feeling.
Kadar nekaj causes the arousal of a feeling, pri ljudeh povzroči tisto čustvo.

seg.quote: ...the arousal of interest.

sense.def: If something arouses a feeling in you, it causes you to have this feeling.
Kadar nekaj arouses a feeling in someone, povzroči, da tisti tako čuti.

seg.quote: It may arouse his interest in the subject.

sense.def: If something arouses people, it makes them angry.
Kadar nekaj arouses someone, v človeku povzroči jezo.
If something arouses you from sleep, it wakes you up;
Kadar nekaj arouses someone from sleep, človeka zbudi;
If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.
Če človek arranges dogodek ali srečanje, naredi načrte zanj.

seg.quote: They arrange holidays in Eastern Europe.

sense.def: If you arrange with someone to do something, you make plans together to do it.
Če človek arranges with someone to do something, skupaj načrtujeta, da bosta tisto storila.

seg.quote: I've arranged with somebody else to go there.
We had arranged to meet in the street outside.

sense.def: If you arrange something for someone, you make it possible for them to have it or to do it.
Če človek arranges something for someone, omogoči, da tisti človek to dobi ali stori.

seg.quote: We can arrange loans.

sense.def: If you arrange a number of objects, you put them in a particular position or order.
Če človek arranges vrsto predmetov, jih postavi v določeno zaporedje ali položaj.

seg.quote: ...four chairs arranged around the table.

sense.def: In an arranged marriage, the parents choose the person who their son or daughter will marry.
Kadar je poroka arranged, starši izberejo zakonca za hčer ali sina.
Arrangements are plans and preparations which you make so that something will happen or be possible.
Arrangements so načrti in priprave za to, da se bo nekaj zgodilo ali bo omogočeno.

seg.quote: I've made all the arrangements for the conference.

sense.def: An arrangement of things, for example flowers or furniture, is a group of them displayed in a particular way.
An arrangement of things, na primer rož ali pohištva, je več takih predmetov, razpostavljenih na določen način.

seg.quote: There was an arrangement of books in the window.

sense.def: An array of different things is a large number of them.
An array of different things je večje število različnih predmetov.

seg.quote: Sutherland studied the array of sandwiches on the tray.

sense.def: Arrears are amounts of money that someone owes.
Arrears so vsote denarja, ki jih človek dolguje.
If someone is in arrears, they have not paid the regular amounts of money that they should have paid.
Kadar je človek in arrears, ni plačal rednih obrokov denarja takrat, ko bi jih moral.
If you are paid in arrears, your wages are paid to you at the end of the period of time in which you earned them.
Če je delavec plačan in arrears, mu je denar za delo izplačan ob koncu časovnega roka, v katerem ga je zaslužil.
When the police arrest someone, they catch them and take them somewhere in order to decide whether they should be charged with an offence.
Kadar policija arrests someone, človeka ujame in ga nekam odpelje, preden ga preda sodišču.
When the police make an arrest, they arrest someone.
Kadar policija makes an arrest, človeka pripre.

seg.quote: A number of arrests were made.

sense.def: If someone is under arrest, they have been caught by the police and are not allowed to go free.
Kadar je človek under arrest, ga je policija prijela in ne sme na prostost.
To arrest something means to stop it happening;
To arrest something pomeni preprečiti, da bi se nekaj zgodilo;

seg.quote: He tried to arrest the course of destruction.

sense.def: Your arrival at a place is the act of arriving there.
One's arrival at a place je prihod nekoga nekam.

seg.quote: I apologise for my late arrival.

sense.def: If you talk about the arrival of something new, you are referring to the fact that it has begun to exist or happen.
The arrival of something new pomeni, da je nekaj novega začelo obstajati ali se dogajati.

seg.quote: Industry has been revolutionized by the arrival of the computer.

sense.def: The arrival of a baby is its birth.
The arrival of a baby je rojstvo dojenčka.
An arrival is someone who has just arrived at a place.
An arrival je človek, ki je pravkar nekam prišel.

seg.quote: One of the new arrivals at the college was an old friend.

sense.def: When you arrive at a place, you reach it at the end of a journey, or you come to it for the first time in order to stay or live there.
Kadar človek arrives at a place, doseže neki kraj na koncu poti ali prvič pride tja z namenom, da bi tam ostal ali živel.

seg.quote: He arrived back at his hotel.
Since arriving in England in 1979, she has established herself as a major writer.

sense.def: When a letter or piece of news arrives, it reaches you.
Kadar pismo ali novica arrives, človeka doseže.
When you arrive at an idea, decision, or conclusion, you reach it or decide on it.
Kadar človek arrives at an idea, decision, or conclusion, v njem dozori neka misel, odločitev ali sklep.
When a baby arrives, it is born.
Kadar dojenček arrives, se rodi.
When a time or event that you have been waiting for arrives, it happens.
Kadar čas ali dogodek, ki smo ga čakali, arrives, se zgodi.
Someone who is arrogant behaves in a proud, unpleasant way because they believe they are more important than other people.
Kdor je arrogant, se vede ponosno in domišljavo, ker je prepričan, da je pomembnejši od drugih.

seg.quote: They are arrogant and aggressive people.
They regarded me arrogantly.
...a reputation for arrogance.

sense.def: An arrow is a long, thin weapon with a sharp point at one end which is shot from a bow.
An arrow je dolgo, tanko orožje z ostro konico na enem koncu, ki ga izstrelimo z lokom.
An arrow is also a written sign which points in a particular direction to indicate where something is.
An arrow je tudi zapisano znamenje, ki kaže v določeno smer, da nas obvesti, kje tisto je.
Arsenic is a very strong poison which can kill people.
Arsenic je zelo močan strup, ki človeka lahko ubije.
Arson is the crime of deliberately setting fire to a building.
Arson je zločin, pri katerem namenoma zažgemo stavbo.
Art is the making of paintings, drawings, and sculpture which are beautiful or which express an artist's ideas.
Art je ustvarjanje slik, risb in kipov, ki so estetski ali podajajo umetnikove zamisli.

seg.quote: ...the development of post-war American art.

sense.def: Art is also used to refer to the paintings, drawings, and sculpture produced by artists.
Z besedo art tudi opisujemo slike, risbe in kipe, ki jih ustvarjajo umetniki.

seg.quote: ...a great art collection.

sense.def: The arts refers to the creation or performance of drama, music, poetry, or painting, especially in a particular country or region.
Izraz the arts se nanaša na ustvarjanje ali poustvarjanje dramatike, glasbe, poezije ali slik, največkrat v določeni državi ali deželi.

seg.quote: How much will they spend on sport, how much on the arts?

sense.def: Arts is used to refer to subjects such as history or languages in contrast to scientific subjects.
Z besedo arts označujemo učne predmete, na primer zgodovino ali jezike, v nasprotju z znanstvenimi predmeti.

seg.quote: ...an arts degree.

sense.def: You describe an activity as an art when it requires a lot of skill.
Z besedo an art opišemo neko dejavnost, ki zahteva veliko spretnosti.

seg.quote: ...the art of camouflage.

sense.def: An artefact is an ornament, tool, or other object made by a human being.
An artefact je okrasek, orodje ali kak drug predmet, ki ga izdela človek.
Your arteries are the tubes that carry blood from your heart to the rest of your body.
One's arteries so žile, po katerih teče kri iz srca po telesu.
Someone who is artful is clever and skilful, often in a cunning way.
Kdor je artful, je spreten in prebrisan ter pogosto zvit.

seg.quote: They became the most artful of all the hunters.
The lighting was artfully arranged to flatter people's faces.

sense.def: A person who is arthritic has arthritis.
Kdor je arthritic, ima artritis.
Arthritis is a condition in which the joints in someone's body are swollen and painful.
Arthritis je bolezen, pri kateri so sklepi v človekovem telesu vneti, otekli in boleči.
An artichoke or a globe artichoke is a round, green vegetable with fleshy leaves, of which you eat the bottom part.
An artichoke ali a globe artichoke je zelenjava z okroglimi, zelenimi, mesnatimi cvetnimi glavami; pri njej jemo osrednji del.
An artichoke or a Jerusalem artichoke is a small, yellowish-white vegetable that grows underground and looks like a potato.
An artichoke ali a Jerusalem artichoke je rumenkasto bela zelenjava, ki je podobna krompirju.
An article is a piece of writing in a newspaper or magazine.
An article je pisni sestavek v časopisu ali reviji.
You can use article to refer generally to an object.
Z besedo article lahko tudi na splošno govorimo o določeni stvari.

seg.quote: He was ordered to pay for the articles he had stolen.

sense.def: An article of a formal document is a section dealing with a particular point.
An article of a formal document je del uradne listine, ki obravnava določeno témo.

seg.quote: The invasion contravened article 51 of the UN charter.

sense.def: If you are articulate, you are able to express yourself well.
Kdor je articulate, se zna spretno izražati.

seg.quote: He was the most articulate among them.

sense.def: When you articulate your ideas or feelings, you say in words what you think or feel;
Kadar človek articulates his ideas or feelings, z besedami pove, kakšne zamisli ima ali kako se počuti;
An articulated vehicle is made in two sections which are joined so that the vehicle can turn corners more easily.
Vozilo, ki je articulated, je sestavljeno iz dveh delov, da laže zavija.
The articulation of an idea or feeling is its expression in words;
The articulation of an idea or feeling je podajanje zamisli ali občutkov z besedami;

seg.quote: ...the articulation of an alternative housing policy.

sense.def: The articulation of a sound or word is the way it is spoken.
The articulation of a sound or word je način oblikovanja zvoka ali besede z govorom.
An artificial state or situation is not natural and exists because people have created it.
Stanje ali položaj, ki je artificial, ni naravno; obstaja zato, ker ga je ustvaril človek.

seg.quote: These results appear only in very artificial conditions.
The government keeps prices artificially high.
There was a strong element of artificiality in this movement.

sense.def: Artificial objects or materials do not occur naturally and are created by people.
Predmeti ali snovi, ki so artificial, ne nastanejo naravno, temveč jih izdela človek.

seg.quote: ...artificial flowers.

sense.def: An artificial arm or leg is made of metal or plastic and is fitted to someone's body when their own arm or leg has been removed.
Roka ali noga, ki je artificial, je izdelana iz kovine ali plastike in prilagojena telesu človeka, ki so mu ta ud odrezali.
If someone's behaviour is artificial, they are pretending to have attitudes and feelings which they do not really have.
Človek, čigar vedênje je artificial, hlini razpoloženje in čustva, ki jih v resnici nima.

seg.quote: They jumped at the suggestion with artificial enthusiasm.

sense.def: Artillery consists of large, powerful guns which are transported on wheels and used by an army.
Artillery sestavljajo veliki, močni topovi, ki se premikajo na kolesih in jih uporablja vojska.
An artist is someone who draws, paints, or produces other works of art.
An artist je človek, ki ustvarja risbe, slike ali kakšna drugačna umetniška dela.
You can refer to a musician, actor, dancer, or other performer as an artist.
Izraz an artist uporabljamo tudi za glasbenike, igralce, plesalce in druge nastopajoče.

seg.quote: She has acted with great artists like Edith Evans.

sense.def: An artiste is a professional entertainer, for example a singer or dancer.
An artiste je poklicni zabaviščnik, na primer pevec ali plesalec.
You say that someone is artistic when they can produce good paintings or other works of art, although they may not be a professional artist.
Za človeka rečemo, da je artistic, kadar zna ustvarjati dobre slike ali druge umetnine, čeprav morda ni poklicni umetnik.

seg.quote: Artistic people are in a tiny minority in this country.
She was artistically gifted.

sense.def: Artistic also means relating to art or artists.
Artistic je tudi tak, ki se nanaša na umetnost ali umetnike.

seg.quote: ...artistic freedom.

sense.def: A design or arrangement that is artistic is attractive.
Oblika ali postavitev, ki je artistic, je privlačna.
Artistry is the great skill with which something is done.
Artistry je velika spretnost, s katero je nekaj narejeno.

seg.quote: He acted the final scenes with superb artistry.

sense.def: If something happens as something else happens, it happens at the same time.
Kadar se nekaj zgodi as something else happens, se zgodi hkrati z nečim drugim.

seg.quote: She wept bitterly as she told her story.

sense.def: You use the structure as...as when you are comparing things.
Izraz as ... as uporabljamo pri primerjanju.

seg.quote: I'm as good a cook as she is.

sense.def: You use as to introduce a prepositional phrase referring to something's appearance or function.
Z besedo as uvajamo izraz, ki opisuje videz ali delovanje nečesa.

seg.quote: You regard the whole thing as a joke.
Hydrogen gas can be used as a fuel.
Over the summer she worked as a waitress.

sense.def: You use as when you are saying how something is done.
Z besedo as povemo, kako je nekaj narejeno.

seg.quote: I like the freedom to organize my day as I want to.

sense.def: You can also use as to mean "because".
Besedo as lahko uporabimo tudi v enakem pomenu kot because.

seg.quote: She bought herself an iron, as she felt she couldn't keep borrowing Anne's.

sense.def: You use as if and as though when you are comparing one situation to another.
Z izrazoma as if in as though primerjamo dva položaja ali stanji.

seg.quote: The furniture looked as though it had come out of somebody's attic.
He looked at me as if I were mad.

sense.def: You use as for to introduce a slightly different subject.
Z izrazom as for napovemo malce drugačno témo od prejšnje.

seg.quote: That's the answer. As for the cause, how do I know?

sense.def: You use as to to indicate what something refers to;
Z izrazom as to pokažemo, na kaj se nekaj nanaša;

seg.quote: John had been given no directions as to what to write.

sense.def: You say as it were in order to make what you are saying sound less definite.
Izraz as it were uporabimo zato, da tisto, kar govorimo, zveni manj določno.

seg.quote: That was as it were part of the job.

sense.def: Asbestos is a grey material which does not burn.
Asbestos je siva negorljiva snov.
If something ascends, it goes upwards.
Kadar nekaj ascends, se premika navzgor.
If you ascend a hill or a staircase, you go up it;
To ascend a hill or a staircase pomeni iti po hribu ali stopnišču navzgor;
If someone or something is in the ascendant, they are increasing in power, influence, or popularity.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj in the ascendant, povečuje svojo moč, vpliv ali priljubljenost.

seg.quote: His party was now in the ascendant.

sense.def: If a group of things is arranged in ascending order, each thing is higher in position or greater in amount or importance than the thing before it.
Če je skupina predmetov urejena in ascending order, je vsak predmet po položaju više ali po pomenu večji kot predmet pred njim.
An ascent is a steep upward slope, or a journey up a steep slope.
An ascent je strmo pobočje ali pot navzgor po njem.

seg.quote: The final ascent took an hour.

sense.def: If you ascertain that something is the case, you find out that it is the case;
To ascertain that something is the case pomeni ugotoviti, da nekaj drži;

seg.quote: I ascertained that Lo was still sound asleep.

sense.def: People who are ascetic have a way of life that is simple and strict, usually because of their religious beliefs.
Kdor je ascetic, živi preprosto in strogo, navadno zaradi verskega prepričanja.

seg.quote: ...a Christian ascetic.

sense.def: If you ascribe an event or state of affairs to a particular factor, you consider that it is caused by that factor.
To ascribe an event or state of affairs to a particular factor pomeni sklepati, da je tisti dejavnik povzročil določen dogodek ali stanje.

seg.quote: ...headaches which may be ascribed to stress.

sense.def: If you ascribe a quality to someone, you consider that they have it.
To ascribe a quality to someone pomeni sklepati, da tisti človek to lastnost ima.

seg.quote: Husbands are often mistaken in the virtues they ascribe to their wives.

sense.def: Ash is the grey powder-like substance that is left after something is burnt.
Ash je siv prah, ki ostane, kadar nekaj zgori.

seg.quote: ...cigarette ash.
Ashes blew into Ralph's face from the dead fire.

sense.def: An ash is a kind of tree.
An ash je vrsta drevesa.
If you are ashamed of something you have done, you feel embarrassed or guilty because of it.
Kadar je človek ashamed of something, kar je storil, ima zaradi tistega dejanja občutek zadrege ali krivde.

seg.quote: She was ashamed of her tears.

sense.def: If you are ashamed to do something, you do not want to do it because you feel embarrassed about it.
Kadar je človek ashamed to do something, tistega ne želi storiti, ker mu je nerodno.

seg.quote: I bet that's what happened, and you're ashamed to admit it.

sense.def: If you are ashamed of someone you are connected with, you feel embarrassed because of their behaviour.
Kadar je človek ashamed of someone, s katerim je povezan, je v zadregi zaradi njegovega vedênja.

seg.quote: He was ashamed of her for writing such lies.

sense.def: Something that comes ashore comes from the sea onto the shore.
Kadar nekaj comes ashore, pride iz morja na obalo.

seg.quote: He managed to swim ashore.

sense.def: An ashtray is a small dish in which people put the ash from their cigarettes and cigars.
An ashtray je majhna posoda; vanjo ljudje otresajo pepel cigar in cigaret.
Asian means belonging or relating to Asia.
Asian je tak, ki pripada Aziji ali je povezan z njo.
An Asian is a person who comes from India, Pakistan, or some other part of Asia.
An Asian je oseba, ki je po rodu iz Indije, Pakistana ali kakega drugega dela Azije.
If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you.
To move something aside pomeni tisto odmakniti stran od sebe.

seg.quote: He threw the manuscript aside.

sense.def: If you take someone aside, you take them away from a group of people in order to talk to them in private.
To take someone aside pomeni tistega človeka odpeljati proč od skupine ljudi, da bi se na samem pogovorili z njim.
If you move aside, you get out of someone's way.
To move aside pomeni, da gremo drugemu človeku s poti.

gramGrp.pos: VB with OBJ or REPORT VB

sense.def: If you ask someone something, you say something in the form of a question because you want some information.
To ask someone something pomeni nekomu reči nekaj v obliki vprašanja, ker želimo izvedeti kak podatek.

seg.quote: I asked him what he wanted.
"Why?" he asked.
He started asking questions.

sense.def: If you ask someone to do something, you say to them that you want them to do it.
To ask someone to do something pomeni tistemu človeku izraziti svojo željo, naj tisto stori.

seg.quote: He asked her to marry him.

sense.def: If you ask someone's permission or forgiveness, you try to obtain it.
To ask someone's permission or forgiveness pomeni poskusiti od nekoga dobiti dovoljenje ali odpuščanje.

seg.quote: I asked permission to leave.

sense.def: If you ask someone somewhere, you invite them there.
To ask someone somewhere pomeni tistega človeka prositi, naj gre tja.

seg.quote: She asked me in.

sense.def: If something is yours for the asking, you can have it simply by saying that you would like it.
Kadar je nekaj od nekoga ali nekje for the asking, tisto lahko dobimo že, če le izrazimo to željo.
You can say "if you ask me" to emphasize that you are stating your personal opinion.
Kadar rečemo "if you ask me", poudarimo, da izražamo svoje lastno mnenje.

seg.quote: The whole thing's stupid if you ask me.

sense.def: If you ask after someone, you ask how they are.
To ask after someone pomeni vprašati, kako tistemu človeku gre.
If you ask for someone, you say that you would like to speak to them.
To ask for someone pomeni reči, da bi radi govorili s tistim človekom.

seg.quote: He rang the office and asked for Cynthia.

sense.def: If you ask for something, you say that you would like it.
To ask for something pomeni reči, da bi tisto radi imeli.
Something that is askew is not straight or level.
Kar je askew, ni ravno ali vodoravno.
Someone who is asleep is sleeping.
Kdor je asleep, spi.
When you fall asleep, you start sleeping.
Kadar človek falls asleep, začne spati.
Someone who is fast asleep or sound asleep is sleeping deeply.
Kdor je fast asleep ali sound asleep, močno spi.
Asparagus is a vegetable with green shoots that you cook and eat.
Asparagus je zelenjava z zelenimi poganjki, ki jih kuhamo in jemo.
An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.
An aspect of something je del narave ali značaja nečesa.

seg.quote: The most terrifying aspect of nuclear bombing is radiation.

sense.def: A room or a window with a particular aspect faces in that direction;
Soba ali okno, ki ima določeni aspect, je obrnjeno v tisto smer;

seg.quote: ...an office with a south-west aspect.

sense.def: Asphalt is a black substance used to make surfaces on things such as roads and playgrounds.
Asphalt je črna snov, ki jo uporabljajo za izdelavo površinskih plasti, na primer na cestah ali igriščih.
If someone is asphyxiated by smoke or a poisonous gas, they breathe it in and die.
To be asphyxiated by smoke or a poisonous gas pomeni vdihovati dim ali strupen plin in zato umreti.
Someone's aspirations are their ambitions to achieve something.
One's aspirations so človekove želje, da bi nekaj dosegel.
If you aspire to something such as an important job, you have a strong desire to have it.
To aspire to something pomeni, da si nekaj, na primer pomemben položaj v službi, močno želimo.

seg.quote: Edward has always aspired to leadership.
...an aspiring concert pianist.

sense.def: Aspirin is a mild drug which reduces pain and fever. It is sold in the form of tablets called aspirins.
Aspirin je blago zdravilo, ki lajša bolečino in znižuje vročino; prodajajo ga v obliki tablet, imenovanih aspirins.
An ass is an animal similar to a horse but smaller and with long ears.
An ass je žival, podobna konju, le da je manjša in ima dolga ušesa.
If you are assailed by unpleasant thoughts or problems, you are greatly troubled by a lot of them;

seg.quote: They are assailed by doubts.

sense.def: Someone's assailant is a person who physically attacks them;
One's assailant je oseba, ki nekega človeka telesno napade;
An assassin is a person who assassinates someone.
An assassin je človek, ki nekoga umori.
When someone important is assassinated, they are murdered as a political act.
Kadar je pomemben človek assassinated, ga ubijejo zaradi politike.

seg.quote: The president was assassinated as he left the building.
...the assassination of Martin Luther King.

sense.def: An assault by an army is a strong attack made against an enemy.
An assault by an army je oster napad na sovražnika.
An assault on a person is a physical attack.
An assault on a person je telesni napad na tisto osebo.

seg.quote: There have been several assaults recently.
They arrested him for assault.

sense.def: To assault someone means to attack them physically.
To assault someone pomeni nekoga napasti.

seg.quote: She was found guilty of assaulting a police officer.

sense.def: An assault on someone's beliefs is a strong criticism of them.
An assault on someone's beliefs je ostra kritika človekovega prepričanja.

seg.quote: ...an all-out assault on racism.

sense.def: When people assemble, they gather together in a group, usually for a particular purpose.
Kadar ljudje assemble, se zberejo v skupino, navadno z določenim namenom.

seg.quote: The witnesses would assemble in the Detective Sergeant's room.
She announced to the assembled relatives that she intended to move abroad.

sense.def: If you assemble something, you fit its parts together.
To assemble something pomeni nekaj narediti iz sestavnih delov.

seg.quote: Tractors are being assembled.

sense.def: If you assemble a number of objects or facts, you bring them together.
To assemble a number of objects or facts pomeni spraviti skupaj več predmetov ali dejstev.

seg.quote: She began to assemble her belongings.
His job was to assemble the facts.

sense.def: An assembly is a large number of people gathered together, especially a group of people who meet regularly to make laws.
An assembly je večje število zbranih ljudi, zlasti če gre za skupino, ki se redno sestaja in sprejema zakone.

seg.quote: The assembly was shocked into silence.

sense.def: Assembly is the gathering together of people for a particular purpose.
Assembly je zbiranje ljudi z določenim namenom.

seg.quote: They are demanding rights of assembly.

sense.def: The assembly of a machine or device is the process of fitting its parts together.
The assembly of a machine or device je postopek sestavljanja delov v stroj ali napravo.
An assembly line is an arrangement of workers and machines in a factory where the product passes from one worker to another until it is finished.
An assembly line je razporeditev delavcev in strojev v tovarni, kjer izdelek potuje od enega delavca do drugega, dokler ni dokončan.
If someone gives their assent to something that has been suggested, they agree to it.
To give one's assent to something, kar je bilo predlagano, pomeni v tisto privoliti.
To assent to something means to agree to it;
To assent to something pomeni, da se z nečim strinjamo;

seg.quote: They all assented to the proposition.

sense.def: If you assert a fact or belief, you state it firmly.
To assert a fact or belief pomeni odločno izpovedati neko dejstvo ali prepričanje.

seg.quote: The protesters asserted their right to be heard.
I challenge that assertion.

sense.def: If you assert your authority, you make it clear that you have it.
To assert one's authority pomeni jasno pokazati, da imamo glavno besedo.

seg.quote: He wished to assert his authority in his own house.
...an assertion of power.

sense.def: If you assert yourself, you speak and act in a forceful way so that people take notice of you.
To assert oneself pomeni govoriti in ravnati tako prepričljivo, da nas ljudje upoštevajo.
Someone who is assertive speaks and acts in a forceful way so that people take notice of them.
Kdor je assertive, govori in ravna tako prepričljivo, da ga ljudje upoštevajo.
When you assess a person, feeling, or situation, you consider them and make a judgement about them.
Kadar človek assesses a person, feeling, or situation, razmisli o njih in si ustvari svojo sodbo.

seg.quote: They meet monthly to assess the current political situation.
...the assessment of his academic progress.

sense.def: When you assess the amount of money that something is worth or that should be paid, you calculate or estimate it.
Kadar človek assesses an amount of money, oceni vrednost nečesa ali določi vsoto denarja, ki bi jo bilo vredno za nekaj plačati.

seg.quote: She looked the house over and assessed its rough market value.
...assessments made by the tax man.

sense.def: If something that you have is an asset, it is useful to you.
Kadar je nekaj, kar človek ima, an asset, je zanj koristno.

seg.quote: He was a great asset to the committee.

sense.def: The assets of a company or a person are all the things that they own.
The assets of a company or a person je vse premoženje nekega podjetja ali osebe.
Someone who is assiduous works hard.
Kdor je assiduous, trdo dela.

seg.quote: ...an assiduous student.
He kept on painting assiduously.

sense.def: If you assign a task or function to someone, you give it to them.
To assign a task or function to someone pomeni nekomu dati nalogo ali funkcijo.

seg.quote: She kept calling him up to assign some new task to him.
Mother and father play out the roles assigned to them.

sense.def: If you are assigned to a place or group, you are sent to work in the place or with the group.
To be assigned to a place or group pomeni, da nas pošljejo delat v določen kraj ali skupino.

seg.quote: She was assigned to the men's wards.

sense.def: An assignation is a secret meeting with someone, especially a lover;
An assignation je skriven sestanek z nekim človekom, ponavadi ljubimcem;
An assignment is a piece of work that you are given to do, as part of your job or studies.
An assignment je delo, ki ga moramo opraviti kot del službe ali študija.
You can refer to someone being given a task or job as their assignment to the task or job.
An assignment to a task or job je določilo, naj neki človek opravi neko nalogo ali delo.
If you assimilate ideas, customs, or methods, you learn them and make use of them.
To assimilate ideas, customs, or methods pomeni naučiti se določenih idej, navad ali metod in jih uporabljati.

seg.quote: He was quick to assimilate new ideas.
...the rapid assimilation of new techniques in industry.

sense.def: When immigrants are assimilated into a community, they become an accepted part of it.
Kadar so priseljenci assimilated into a community, postanejo sestavni del skupnosti.

seg.quote: ...the assimilation of the new arrivals.

sense.def: If you assist someone, you help them.
To assist someone pomeni, da nekomu pomagamo.

seg.quote: We may be able to assist with the tuition fees.
He was asked to assist in keeping the hotel under surveillance.

sense.def: If something assists you with a task, it makes it easier for you.
Kadar nekaj assists someone with a task, mu nalogo olajša.
If you give someone assistance, you help them.
To give someone assistance pomeni, da nekomu pomagamo.

seg.quote: He thanked me for my assistance.

sense.def: Someone or something that is of assistance to you is helpful or useful to you.
Kadar je nekdo ali nekaj of assistance to someone, mu pomaga ali je koristno.
Someone's assistant is a person who helps them in their work.
One's assistant je človek, ki drugemu pomaga pri delu.
Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director.
Naziv assistant uporabljamo pred uradnimi ali službenimi nazivi, da nakažemo malo nižji položaj. Na primer: an assistant director je za stopničko niže kot režiser.
An assistant or a shop assistant is a person who sells things in a shop.
An assistant ali a shop assistant je oseba, ki prodaja v trgovini.
If you associate one thing with another, the two things are connected in your mind.
To associate one thing with another pomeni, da sta obe stvari v naših mislih povezani.

seg.quote: Dignity is the quality which I associate mostly with her.
Zuse worked on problems associated with aircraft design.

sense.def: If you are associated with an organization, cause, or point of view, or if you associate yourself with it, you support it publicly.
To be associated with an organization, cause, or point of view, ali kadar človek associates himself with it, javno podpira določeno organizacijo, načelo ali stališče.
If you associate with a group of people, you spend a lot of time with them.
To associate with a group of people pomeni preživeti veliko časa z določeno skupino ljudi.
Your associates are your business colleagues.
One's associates so človekovi poslovni sodelavci.
An association is an official group of people with a common occupation, aim, or interest.
An association je uradna skupina ljudi z enakim poklicem, ciljem ali zanimanjem.

seg.quote: ...the British Medical Association.

sense.def: Your association with a person, group, or organization is the connection that you have with them.
One's association with a person, group, or organization je človekova povezanost z določeno osebo, skupino ali organizacijo.
If someone does something in association with someone else, they do it together.
Kadar človek does something in association with someone else, nekaj stori skupaj z drugim človekom.
If something has a particular association for you, it is connected in your mind with a particular memory or feeling.
Kadar ima nekdo določeno association for someone, je v njegovih mislih povezan z nekim spominom ali čustvom.
A group of assorted things of a particular kind have different sizes, colours, or qualities.
A group of assorted things je določena skupina predmetov različne velikosti, barve ali kakovosti.

seg.quote: ...a bunch of assorted wild flowers.

sense.def: An assortment is a group of similar things that have different sizes, colours, or qualities.
An assortment je skupina podobnih predmetov različne velikosti, barve ali kakovosti.

seg.quote: ...an assortment of plastic bags.

gramGrp.pos: REPORT VB or VB with OBJ and TO-INF

sense.def: If you assume that something is true, you suppose that it is true, sometimes wrongly.
To assume that something is true pomeni sklepati, da je nekaj res, včasih tudi zmotno.

seg.quote: I assume you don't drive.
I was mistakenly assumed to be a Welshman.

sense.def: If someone assumes power or responsibility, they begin to have power or responsibility.
Kadar človek assumes power or responsibility, začenja imeti vpliv ali odgovornost.
If you assume a particular expression, quality, or way of behaving, you start to look or behave in this way.
To assume a particular expression, quality, or way of behaving pomeni, da smo od takrat videti ali se vedemo tako.
You use assuming or assuming that when you are supposing that something is true, so that you can think about what the consequences would be.
Izraz assuming ali assuming that uporabimo, kadar sklepamo, da je nekaj res, in razmišljamo o možnih posledicah.

seg.quote: Keep your goods (assuming that you have any) separate from his.

sense.def: If you make an assumption, you suppose that something is true, sometimes wrongly.
To make an assumption pomeni misliti, da je nekaj res, včasih tudi zmotno.

seg.quote: His suggestions are based on an assumption that the system is out of date.

sense.def: Someone's assumption of power or responsibility is their taking of it.
One's assumption of power or responsibility je dejstvo, da neki človek dobi moč ali odgovornost.
If you give someone an assurance about something, you say that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, in order to make them less worried.
To give someone an assurance about something pomeni nekomu reči, da je tisto vsekakor res ali se bo zgodilo, da bi mu olajšali skrbi.

seg.quote: One must be content with assurances that progress is being made.
...the assurance of full employment.

sense.def: If you do something with assurance, you do it with confidence and certainty.
To do something with assurance pomeni, da tisto storimo z zaupanjem in gotovostjo vase.

seg.quote: "She'll like that," said Lally with assurance.

sense.def: Assurance is also insurance that provides for events which are certain to happen, such as death.
Assurance je tudi jamstvo, ki nam omogoči odškodnino v primeru nekaterih dogodkov, na primer smrti.
If you assure someone that something is true or will happen, you tell them that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, to make them less worried.
To assure someone that something is true or will happen pomeni nekemu človeku povedati, da je nekaj vsekakor res ali se bo zgodilo, da bi mu olajšali skrbi.

seg.quote: Kurt assured me that he was an excellent climber.

gramGrp.pos: VB with OBJ and OBJ or "of"

sense.def: If you are assured of something, you will definitely get it.
To be assured of something pomeni, da bomo tisto vsekakor dobili.

seg.quote: This film had assured him a place in movie history.

sense.def: Someone who is assured is very confident and feels at ease.
Kdor je assured, je sproščen in zelo prepričan vase.
If something is assuredly true, it is definitely true.
Kadar je nekaj assuredly true, je vsekakor res.
An asterisk is the sign *7C.
An asterisk je znak *7C.
Asthma is an illness which affects the chest and makes breathing difficult.
Asthma je bolezen, ki prizadene pljuča in oteži dihanje.
Someone who is asthmatic suffers from asthma.
Kdor je asthmatic, ima astmo.
If something astonishes you, it surprises you very much.
Kadar nekaj astonishes someone, ga močno preseneti.

seg.quote: He used to astonish me with the clarity of his recollections.

sense.def: If you are astonished, you are very surprised about something.
Kdor je astonished, je zaradi nečesa močno presenečen.

seg.quote: They were astonished at the extraordinary beauty of the pictures.

sense.def: Something that is astonishing is very surprising.
Kar je astonishing, je zelo presenetljivo.

seg.quote: The shape of their bodies changes with astonishing speed.
Birth rates there are astonishingly high.

sense.def: Astonishment is a feeling of great surprise.
Astonishment je občutek velikega presenečenja.

seg.quote: John stared at him in astonishment.

sense.def: If something astounds you, you are amazed by it.
Kadar nekaj astounds someone, ga preseneti.

seg.quote: The sheer volume of work astounds us.
It seemed an astounding decision.

sense.def: If you lead someone astray, you make them behave in a bad or foolish way.
To lead someone astray pomeni poskrbeti, da se tisti človek vede grdo ali neumno.
If something goes astray, it gets lost.
Kadar nekaj goes astray, se izgubi.
If you sit or stand astride something, you sit or stand with one leg on each side of it.
To sit ali to stand astride something pomeni sedeti ali stati tako, da imamo nogi vsako na drugi strani tistega.

seg.quote: Karen sat astride a large white horse.

sense.def: An astringent is a substance that makes your skin less greasy or stops it bleeding.
An astringent je snov, zaradi katere je koža manj mastna ali ki ustavi krvavitev.

cit.quote: astringent, sredstvo za oženje por ali za strjevanje krvi

seg.quote: ...an astringent lotion.

sense.def: Astringent comments are forceful and critical.
Pripomba, ki je astringent, je ostra in kritična.
An astrologer is a person who uses astrology to tell you things about your character and future.
An astrologer je oseba, ki nam s pomočjo astrologije opisuje značaj in prihodnost.
Astrology is the study of the movements of the planets, sun, moon, and stars in the belief that they can influence people's lives.
Astrology je preučevanje gibanja planetov, Sonca, Lune in zvezd v prepričanju, da lahko vplivajo na človekovo življenje.
An astronaut is a person who travels in a spacecraft.
An astronaut je oseba, ki potuje v vesoljski ladji.
An astronomer is a scientist who studies the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.
An astronomer je znanstvenik, ki preučuje zvezde, planete in naravne pojave v vesolju.
If you describe a value, price, or amount as astronomical, you mean that it is very large indeed.
Vrednost, znesek ali cena, ki je astronomical, je izjemno velika.
Astronomical also means relating to astronomy.
Astronomical pomeni tudi tak, ki je povezan z astronomijo.
Astronomy is the scientific study of the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.
Astronomy je znanstveno preučevanje zvezd, planetov in naravnih pojavov v vesolju.
Someone who is astute is clever and skilful at understanding behaviour and situations.
Kdor je astute, zna bistro in spretno razumeti vedênje in okoliščine.
An asylum is a mental hospital.
An asylum je bolnišnica za duševno prizadete.
Asylum is protection given to foreigners who have left their own country for political reasons.
Asylum je zaščita, ki jo dobijo tujci, če zapustijo domovino zaradi političnih razlogov.
Something that is asymmetrical has two sides or halves that are different.
Kar je asymmetrical, ima dve različni plati ali polovici.
You use at to say where something happens or is situated.
Z besedo at povemo, kje se nekaj zgodi ali leži.

seg.quote: The play takes place at a beach club.
There was a knock at his door.

sense.def: If you look at something or someone, you look towards them. If you direct something at someone, you direct it towards them.
To look at something or someone pomeni pogledati v smer, kjer nekaj ali nekdo je. To direct something at someone pomeni nekaj nameriti proti tistemu človeku.

seg.quote: They were staring at a garage roof.
Supporters threw petals at his car.

sense.def: You use at to say when something happens.
Z besedo at povemo, kdaj se nekaj zgodi.

seg.quote: She leaves her house every day at 11 a.m.

sense.def: You use at to say how quickly or regularly something happens.
Z besedo at povemo, kako hitro ali pogosto se nekaj dogaja.

seg.quote: He hurtles through the air at 600 miles per hour.
The high technology companies have grown at an astonishing rate.

sense.def: If you buy or sell something at a particular price, you buy it or sell it for that price.
To buy or sell something at a particular price pomeni, da tisto kupimo ali prodamo za tako ceno.

seg.quote: The book is published at $7.95.

sense.def: If you are at lunch, dinner, or any other meal, you are eating it.
To be at lunch, dinner, or any other meal pomeni jesti kosilo, večerjo ali kak drug obed.
If you are working at something, you are dealing with it. If you are aiming at something, you are trying to achieve it.
To be working at something pomeni, da se z nečim ukvarjamo. To be aiming at something pomeni, da poskušamo nekaj doseči.

seg.quote: It means working harder at your thesis.

sense.def: If something is done at someone's command or invitation, it is done as a result of it.
Kadar nekaj storimo at someone's command ali at someone's invitation, je to posledica ukaza ali vabila.
You use at to say that someone or something is in a particular state or condition.
Z besedo at povemo, da je nekdo ali nekaj v določenem stanju ali položaju.

seg.quote: He remains at liberty.
The two nations are at war.

sense.def: You use at to say how something is done.
Z besedo at povemo, kako je nekaj storjeno.

seg.quote: Guardsmen herded them back at gun point.

sense.def: You use at after a verb to indicate that something is being done in a tentative way.
Z besedo at za glagolom povemo, da je nekaj storjeno z oklevanjem.

seg.quote: Rudolph sipped at his drink.

sense.def: If you are good at something, you do it well. If you are bad at something, you do it badly.
Kdor je good at something, tisto zna dobro. Kdor je bad at something, tisto počne slabo.

seg.quote: They seemed to be very good at reading.

sense.def: If you are delighted, pleased, or appalled at something, that is the effect it has on you.
Kadar je človek delighted, pleased ali appalled at something, je zaradi tistega navdušen, vesel ali zgrožen.
Ate is the past tense of eat.
Ate je preteklik glagola to eat.
Atheism is the belief that there is no God.
Atheism je prepričanje, da Boga ni.

seg.quote: He is a convinced atheist.

sense.def: An athlete is a person who takes part in athletics competitions.
An athlete je oseba, ki sodeluje na športnih oziroma atletskih tekmovanjih.
Athletics consists of sports such as running, the high jump, and the javelin.
Athletics je športna panoga, v katero sodijo na primer tek, skok v višino in metanje kopja.
Athletic means relating to athletes and athletics.
Athletic pomeni povezan s športom in športniki.
An athletic person is fit, healthy, and active.
Kdor je athletic, je telesno izurjen, zdrav in dejaven.
-ation, -tion, and -ion are added to verbs to form nouns referring to an action or the result of an action. Nouns of this kind are often not defined but are treated with the related verbs.

Pripone -ation, -tion, in -ion dodajamo glagolom, da oblikujemo samostalnike, ki se nanašajo na dejavnost ali njene posledice. Takih samostalnikov v tem slovarju ponavadi ne razlagamo, temveč jih obravnavamo pri ustreznih glagolih.

seg.quote: ...upon completion of their studies.
We will make such alterations as we consider necessary.

sense.def: An atlas is a book of maps.
An atlas je knjiga zemljevidov.
A planet's atmosphere is the layer of air or other gas around it.
A planet's atmosphere je plast zraka ali kakšnega drugega plina okoli planeta.

seg.quote: ...atmospheric pollution.

sense.def: The atmosphere of a place is the air that you breathe there.
The atmosphere of a place je zrak, ki ga v nekem kraju dihamo.

seg.quote: ...the polluted atmosphere of towns and cities.

sense.def: You can also refer to the general impression that you get of a place as its atmosphere.
Z besedo atmosphere opisujemo tudi splošni vtis, ki nam ga daje določen kraj.

seg.quote: It's got such a friendly atmosphere.

sense.def: An atom is the smallest amount of a substance that can take part in a chemical reaction.
An atom je najmanjši delec snovi, ki je lahko udeležen v kemičnem procesu.
An atom bomb or an atomic bomb causes an explosion by the sudden release of energy that results from splitting atoms.
An atom bomb ali an atomic bomb povzroči eksplozijo z nenadno sprostitvijo energije, ki jo povzroči cepitev atomov.
Atomic means relating to the power produced by splitting atoms.
Kar je atomic, je povezano z energijo, ki nastane pri cepitvi atomov.
Atomic also means relating to the atoms that substances consist of.
Atomic je tudi povezan z atomi, iz katerih so sestavljene snovi.
If you atone for something that you have done, you do something to show that you are sorry you did it;
To atone for something pomeni pokazati svoje obžalovanje za to, kar smo storili;
Something that is atrocious is extremely bad.
Kar je atrocious, je izjemno slabo.

seg.quote: ...speaking French with an atrocious accent.
The farm animals are treated atrociously.

sense.def: An atrocity is a very cruel, shocking action.
An atrocity je zelo kruto, osupljivo dejanje.
If you attach something to an object, you join it or fasten it to the object.
To attach something to an object pomeni tisto združiti ali pritrditi na neki predmet.
If someone is attached to an organization, they are working for it, usually for a short time.
To be attached to an organization pomeni delati za tisto organizacijo, navadno krajši čas.

seg.quote: Hospital officers would be temporarily attached to NHS hospitals.

sense.def: If you attach a quality to something or someone, you consider that they have that quality.
To attach a quality to something or someone pomeni domnevati, da ima nekaj ali nekdo tako lastnost.

seg.quote: Don't attach too much importance to what he said.

sense.def: An attaché is a member of the staff in an embassy.
An attaché je član diplomatskega predstavništva ali veleposlaništva.
If you are attached to someone or something, you are very fond of them.
Kadar je človek attached to someone or something, ima nekoga ali nekaj zelo rad.
An attachment to someone or something is a fondness for them.
An attachment to someone or something je čustveno nagnjenje do nekoga ali nečesa.

seg.quote: ...a romantic attachment.

sense.def: An attachment is a device that can be fixed onto a machine in order to enable it to do different jobs.
An attachment je orodje, ki ga je mogoče priklopiti na stroj, da omogoči opravljanje različnih del.

seg.quote: ...a special attachment for cleaning upholstery.

sense.def: If you attack someone, you try to hurt them using physical violence.
To attack someone pomeni, da poskusimo tistega človeka raniti z uporabo telesnega nasilja.

seg.quote: The court decided that he was insane when he attacked the women.
...a worrying increase in attacks on old people.

sense.def: If you attack a person, belief, or idea, you criticize them strongly.
To attack a person, belief, or idea pomeni močno grajati neko osebo, prepričanje ali idejo.

seg.quote: The senator attacked the press for misleading the public.
...attacks on various aspects of apartheid.
Burt's work came under violent attack.

sense.def: If you attack a job or a problem, you start to deal with it in an energetic way.
To attack a job or a problem pomeni, da se začnemo z nekim delom ali problemom intenzivno ukvarjati.
When players attack in a game such as football, they try to score a goal.
Kadar športniki attack, poskušajo zabiti gol, na primer pri nogometu.
An attack of an illness is a short period in which you suffer badly from it.
An attack of an illness je krajše obdobje, ko smo zelo bolni.

seg.quote: ...an attack of smallpox.

sense.def: Someone's attacker is the person who attacks them.
One's attacker je oseba, ki človeka napade.

seg.quote: He described his attacker to the police.

sense.def: If you attain something, you achieve it, often after a lot of effort.
To attain something pomeni tisto doseči, pogosto z velikim trudom.

seg.quote: ...the qualities which enabled him to attain his ambitions.

sense.def: The attainment of something is the achieving of it.
The attainment of something pomeni, da nekaj dosežemo.

seg.quote: ...the attainment of independence.

sense.def: An attainment is a skill you have learned, or something you have achieved.
An attainment je znanje, ki smo si ga pridobili, ali nekaj, kar smo dosegli.
If you attempt something or attempt to do something, you try to do it.
To attempt something ali to attempt to do something pomeni poskusiti tisto opraviti.

seg.quote: A long time had elapsed since I had attempted any serious study.
Some of the crowd attempted to break through police cordons.
The young birds manage to fly several kilometres at their first attempt.

sense.def: An attempted crime is an unsuccessful effort to commit a crime.
Zločin, ki je attempted, je nekdo poskusil storiti, a mu je pri tem spodletelo.

seg.quote: He was charged with attempted murder.

sense.def: If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it.
To attend a meeting or other event pomeni biti navzoč na sestanku ali pri kakem drugem dogodku.

seg.quote: I stopped off in London to attend a conference.

sense.def: If you attend an institution such as a school or church, you go to it regularly.
To attend an institution pomeni, da nekam redno hodimo, na primer v šolo ali cerkev.
If you attend to something, you deal with it.
To attend to something pomeni, da tisto opravimo.
The attendance at a meeting is the number of people who are present there.
The attendance at a meeting je število ljudi, ki so navzoči na sestanku.
If you talk about someone's attendance at an institution, you are referring to the fact that they go there regularly.
One's attendance at an institution pomeni, da tisti človek redno hodi v določeno ustanovo.

seg.quote: She was allowed to resume her attendance at the High School.

sense.def: An attendant is someone whose job is to serve people in a place such as a petrol station or a museum.
An attendant je človek, ki poklicno streže ljudem, na primer na bencinski črpalki ali v muzeju.
If you give something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.
To give one's attention to something pomeni, da nekaj gledamo, poslušamo ali o tistem pazljivo razmišljamo.

seg.quote: When he felt he had their attention, he began.

sense.def: If something is getting attention, it is being dealt with.
Kadar nekaj is getting attention, se s tistim ukvarjamo.

seg.quote: They needed medical attention.

sense.def: If someone brings something to your attention or draws your attention to it, they point it out to you.
Kadar človek brings something to one's attention ali draws one's attention to something, na tisto nekoga opozori.
If something attracts your attention or catches your attention, you suddenly notice it.
Kadar nekaj attracts one's attention ali catches one's attention, človek tisto nenadoma opazi.
If you pay attention to something, you watch it, listen to it, or take notice of it.
To pay attention to something pomeni tisto gledati, poslušati ali opaziti.

seg.quote: There's far too much attention being paid to these hooligans.

sense.def: When soldiers stand to attention, they stand up straight with their feet together and their arms at their sides.
Kadar vojaki stand to attention, stojijo vzravnano s stopali skupaj in rokami ob telesu.
If you are attentive, you are paying close attention to what is being said or done.
Kadar je človek attentive, je zelo pozoren na to, kaj drugi govorijo ali počnejo.

seg.quote: ...an attentive audience.
He was listening attentively.

sense.def: To be attentive also means to be helpful and polite.
To be attentive tudi pomeni, da smo vljudni in pripravljeni pomagati.

seg.quote: He was unfailingly attentive.

sense.def: To attest something or to attest to it means to show that it is true;
To attest something ali to attest to something pomeni pokazati, da je nekaj res;

seg.quote: The perfection of their design is attested by the fact that they survived for thousands of years.
Historic documents attest to the truth of this.

sense.def: An attic is a room at the top of a house just below the roof.
An attic je prostor na vrhu hiše tik pod streho.
Your attire is the clothes you are wearing;
One's attire je obleka, ki jo človek nosi;
Your attitude to something is the way you think and feel about it.
One's attitude to something je način, kako človek o nečem misli ali čuti.
Your attitude to someone is the way you behave when you are dealing with them.
One's attitude to someone je način, kako se človek do nekoga vede.

seg.quote: I resented his attitude.

sense.def: An attitude is also a position in which you hold your body.
An attitude je tudi položaj človekovega telesa.

seg.quote: ...with her arms flung out in an attitude of surrender.

sense.def: In the United States, an attorney is a lawyer.
An attorney je v Združenih državah Amerike poimenovanje za pravnika.
If something attracts people or animals, it has features that cause them to come to it.
Kadar nekaj attracts people or animals, ima lastnosti, ki privabljajo ljudi ali živali.

seg.quote: The show attracted large crowds this year.
Moths are attracted to lights.

sense.def: If someone or something attracts you, they have qualities which cause you to like or admire them. You can also say that their qualities attract you to them.
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj attracts someone, ima lastnosti, zaradi katerih nam je nekaj všeč ali tisto občudujemo. Lahko tudi rečemo, da lastnosti tistega človeka ali stvari attract someone to them.

seg.quote: She didn't attract me physically.
What attracted me to Valeria was her sense of humour.
I was becoming attracted to a girl from the next office.

sense.def: If something attracts support or publicity, it gets it.
Kadar nekaj attracts support or publicity, temu javnost nameni podporo ali pozornost.
If something attracts your attention, you notice it.
Kadadr nekaj attracts one's attention, človek tisto opazi.
If something magnetic attracts an object, it causes the object to move towards it.
Kadar nekaj magnetnega attracts an object, povzroči, da se predmet tistemu približa.
Attraction is a feeling of liking someone, and often of being sexually interested in them.
Attraction je občutek, da nam nekdo ugaja, pogosto tudi spolno.

seg.quote: ...the attraction between the sexes.

sense.def: Attraction is also the quality of being interesting or desirable.
Attraction je tudi lastnost, da je nekdo ali nekaj zanimivo ali zaželeno.

seg.quote: The attraction of the house lay in its simplicity.

sense.def: An attraction is a feature which makes something interesting or desirable.
An attraction je lastnost, zaradi katere je nekaj zanimivo ali zaželeno.

seg.quote: One of the main attractions of the city was its superb transport system.

sense.def: An attraction is also something that people can go to for interest or enjoyment, for example a famous building.
An attraction je tudi neki kraj, na primer znamenita stavba, kamor gredo ljudje lahko zaradi zanimanja ali za zabavo.
